original: slar lus kyi yo byad de dag gang dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: slar lus kyi yo byad de dag gang dag yin zhe na /
translated: What are those physical necessities?

original: de'i phyir bza' bar bya ba dang lhung bzed dang chos gos dang gnas dang so bkru ba dang me la sogs pa ni lus kyi yo byad yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bza' bar bya ba dang lhung bzed dang chos gos dang gnas dang so bkru ba dang me la sogs pa ni lus kyi yo byad yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore he says: Food, the begging-bowl, the robes, the dwelling, tooth-wood, and fire, etc. are the physical necessities.

original: 'o na lus kyi yo byad rnams su nye bar sbyar ba gang yin par blta bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na lus kyi yo byad rnams su nye bar sbyar ba gang yin par blta bar bya zhe na /
translated: What should be regarded as the necessities of the body?

original: de'i phyir de dag tu ni sa dang lci ba dang tshon dang rtsva dang shing la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag tu ni sa dang lci ba dang tshon dang rtsva dang shing la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore he says: Earth, cow-dung, dye, grass, wood, etc. are the necessities of the body.

original: lus kyi yo byad de dag tu nye bar sbyar ba de dag la chu la sogs pa dgos pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: lus kyi yo byad de dag tu nye bar sbyar ba de dag la chu la sogs pa dgos pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the purpose of water, etc. in those necessities of the body?

original: de'i phyir de dag tu dgos pa ni 'di lta ste byi dor bya ba dang kha bsgyur ba dang chag chag gdab pa dang / phyag dar bya ba dang zhal zhal bya ba dang 'u sha dang thang dang thug pa rnams btung ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag tu dgos pa ni 'di lta ste byi dor bya ba dang kha bsgyur ba dang chag chag gdab pa dang / phyag dar bya ba dang zhal zhal bya ba dang 'u sha dang thang dang thug pa rnams btung ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the purpose in those is as follows: cleaning, dyeing, sprinkling, sweeping, plastering, and drinking gruel, thin porridge, and thick porridge.

original: sbyor ba 'di rnams zhes bya ba 'og nas 'byung ba 'di rnams la thams cad du so sor mngon par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba 'di rnams zhes bya ba 'og nas 'byung ba 'di rnams la thams cad du so sor mngon par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: All of these that will be mentioned below should be applied individually to these practices.

original: chu srol bkag pa dang bsal ba dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: chu srol bkag pa dang bsal ba dag kyang ngo //
translated: Also stopping and releasing the water flow.

original: shing dang g-yeng ba dag gzhug pa dang dra ba dang bshal pa dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: shing dang g-yeng ba dag gzhug pa dang dra ba dang bshal pa dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Also inserting wood and chaff, and straining and filtering. This is to be connected with should be done.

original: 'dir shing dang g-yer ba zhes bya ba ni dpe tsam du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir shing dang g-yer ba zhes bya ba ni dpe tsam du rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, wood and chaff should be understood as mere examples.

original: rim pa gcig pa las gzhan pa sbu can la sogs pa bkru ba yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rim pa gcig pa las gzhan pa sbu can la sogs pa bkru ba yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Also washing the woolen cloth and so on, which are different from the single-layered ones.🔽Here is the Sanskrit-English alignment based on the Japanese translations:

original: rim pa gcig pa las gzhan pa zhes bya ba chig rkyang las so //
analyzed: rim pa gcig pa las gzhan pa zhes bya ba chig rkyang las so //
translated: The phrase other than one layer means other than a single layer.

original: gzhan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase other than means

original: 'di ni ngo bo las ston par byed pa sbu can la sogs pas zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: 'di ni ngo bo las ston par byed pa sbu can la sogs pas zhes bya bas so //
translated: that this is taught by the nature of the term, such as with hair and so on.

original: de yang srog chags kyi khams lhag par mang ba'i chu lta bu yang sbyor ba dag yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yang srog chags kyi khams lhag par mang ba'i chu lta bu yang sbyor ba dag yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase and so on means that it is also water that has an abundance of living organisms.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni gos rim pa gcig pa de yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni gos rim pa gcig pa de yang ngo //
translated: The phrase and so on means that single-layered cloth is also like that.

original: chu zhes bya ba ni bkru ba yang ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: chu zhes bya ba ni bkru ba yang ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase water means that washing is also like that.🔽The phrase and so on means that it is also like that.

original: de lta bu yang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de lta bu yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu yang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de lta bu yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Here the text says,

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus chags chag 'debs sam phyag dang byed pa dang 'u sha dang thang dang thug pa dag byed na srog chags ji snyed 'chi ba dang de snyed kyi ltung byed du 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus chags chag 'debs sam phyag dang byed pa dang 'u sha dang thang dang thug pa dag byed na srog chags ji snyed 'chi ba dang de snyed kyi ltung byed du 'gyur la /
translated: If a monk uses water that contains living organisms to make a mud plaster, or to make a floor covering, or to make a plaster for a wall, or to make a plaster for a floor, or to make a plaster for a wall, or to make a plaster for a floor, then for however many living beings die, he commits that many offenses of wrong conduct.

original: ma 'chi na ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: ma 'chi na ni nyes byas so //
translated: If they do not die, then he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong gis srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu'i yur ba 'gog gam sel bar byed na srog chags ji snyed 'chi ba de snyed kyi ltung byed du 'gyur la mi 'chi na ni nyes byas so //🔽dge slong gis srog chags dang bcas pa'i @228b chur shing 'dzud dam 'dren nam /
analyzed: dge slong gis srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu'i yur ba 'gog gam sel bar byed na srog chags ji snyed 'chi ba de snyed kyi ltung byed du 'gyur la mi 'chi na ni nyes byas so // dge slong gis srog chags dang bcas pa'i @228b chur shing 'dzud dam 'dren nam /
translated: If a monk blocks or diverts a canal that contains living beings, he commits a downfall for each living being that dies. If they do not die, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If a monk puts wood into water that contains living beings, or pulls it out,

original: chu'i nang nas skam sar bshal la g-yer bas g-yeng bar byed dam 'dren nam chu'i nang nas skam sar bshal bar byed na snga ma bzhin no //🔽gos spu can dang lhan pa can dag shing gis brdung ba dang 'khru bar byed na srog chags ji snyed 'chi pa de nyid kyi ltung byed du 'gyur la ma 'chi na ni nyes byas so //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: chu'i nang nas skam sar bshal la g-yer bas g-yeng bar byed dam 'dren nam chu'i nang nas skam sar bshal bar byed na snga ma bzhin no //🔽gos spu can dang lhan pa can dag shing gis brdung ba dang 'khru bar byed na srog chags ji snyed 'chi pa de nyid kyi ltung byed du 'gyur la ma 'chi na ni nyes byas so //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /

original: gos spu can dang lhan pa can dag shing gis brdungs pa dang bkru bar mi bya ste 'khru na 'ga' tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gos spu can dang lhan pa can dag shing gis brdungs pa dang bkru bar mi bya ste 'khru na 'ga' tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: One should not beat or wash woolen or patched robes with wood, because if one washes them, they will be ruined.

original: 'on kyang rim pa gcig pa ni bkru bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rim pa gcig pa ni bkru bar bya'o //
translated: However, one should wash them in one stage.

original: dge slong dag gis bkru ba gtan btang ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong dag gis bkru ba gtan btang ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said that monks should not wash them at all.

original: gang na srog chags kyi khams mang la chu'i khams nyung ba der bkru bar mi bya'i gang na chu'i khams mang la srog chags kyi khams nyung ba der bkru bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang na srog chags kyi khams mang la chu'i khams nyung ba der bkru bar mi bya'i gang na chu'i khams mang la srog chags kyi khams nyung ba der bkru bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: He said, “One should not wash them where the element of living beings is abundant and the element of water is scarce. One should wash them where the element of water is abundant and the element of living beings is scarce.”

original: 'di ni nye bar longs mi spyad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar longs mi spyad pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not non-enjoyment.

original: de bas na 'dir 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ni ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ni ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the statement that it would be a fault here means that one should understand that it would be a downfall.

original: srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la longs spyod pa'i rnam par 'byed pa'o /
analyzed: srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la longs spyod pa'i rnam par 'byed pa'o /
translated: This concludes the analysis of the enjoyment of water containing living beings.

original: // / dpyang tshags bcab par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / dpyang tshags bcab par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The text reads: One should set up the water strainer.

original: dpyad tshags zhes bya ba 'di yang ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: dpyad tshags zhes bya ba 'di yang ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is this called a water strainer?

original: da'i phyir bzed snod kyi steng gi nam mkha' la gzhag par bya zhing dgang ba dang btsag par bya ba'i chu bzed par byed pa tshags gdags par bya ba'i lcags dag btab pa'i shing bu gsum dang ldan pa ni de zhes bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: da'i phyir bzed snod kyi steng gi nam mkha' la gzhag par bya zhing dgang ba dang btsag par bya ba'i chu bzed par byed pa tshags gdags par bya ba'i lcags dag btab pa'i shing bu gsum dang ldan pa ni de zhes bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, It is a three-pronged stick with nails driven into it, which is placed in the air above the water-holding vessel, and is used to hold the water strainer for pouring and straining water.

original: chu zed par byed pa'i tshags gdags par bya ba'i 'og tu bum pa la sogs pa'i snod gzhag par bya ba gang yin pa'i bzed snod kyi steng gi nam mkha' la gzhag par bya zhing dgang ba dang chu bzed par byed pa'i tshags gdags par bya ste /
analyzed: chu zed par byed pa'i tshags gdags par bya ba'i 'og tu bum pa la sogs pa'i snod gzhag par bya ba gang yin pa'i bzed snod kyi steng gi nam mkha' la gzhag par bya zhing dgang ba dang chu bzed par byed pa'i tshags gdags par bya ste /
translated: The water strainer is placed in the air above the water-holding vessel, which is the vessel such as a pot that is to be placed below the water strainer. It is used for pouring and straining water.

original: de dbyung bar bya ba'i don du gong du lcags gzer dag btab pa de zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dbyung bar bya ba'i don du gong du lcags gzer dag btab pa de zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the three-pronged stick with nails driven into it for the purpose of removing it.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dpyang tshags bya zhing de'i ya thog tu lcags gzer dag gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dpyang tshags bya zhing de'i ya thog tu lcags gzer dag gdab par bya'o //
translated: Here the text is: “One should make a water strainer and attach it to the top of the water pot.

original: de la chu tshags gdags par bya zhing de'i 'og tu bum pa gzhag par bya'o //🔽chu snod kyi bum pa dag dgang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la chu tshags gdags par bya zhing de'i 'og tu bum pa gzhag par bya'o // chu snod kyi bum pa dag dgang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: One should attach the water pot to it and place it below.🔽One should fill the water pot of the water container.”

original: gang zhig 'dir chu snod kyi bum pa dgang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i don ni chu @229a * //
analyzed: gang zhig 'dir chu snod kyi bum pa dgang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i don ni chu @229a * //
translated: The meaning of the statement “One should fill the water pot of the water container” is that one should fill the water pot with the water of the water container.

original: snod kyi chus bum pa gang bar bya zhes gsungs pas zed snod dang 'di la sogs pa byed pas zhes bya ba don gyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snod kyi chus bum pa gang bar bya zhes gsungs pas zed snod dang 'di la sogs pa byed pas zhes bya ba don gyis rig par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of “with the water container” and so on is understood.

original: chu gnas par bya ba'i phyir chu tshags su gcal gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni chu gnas par bya ba'i phyir chu tshags de'i nang du gcal gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: chu gnas par bya ba'i phyir chu tshags su gcal gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni chu gnas par bya ba'i phyir chu tshags de'i nang du gcal gzhug par bya'o //
translated: “One should put gravel in the water strainer in order to make the water stay” means that one should put gravel in that water strainer in order to make the water stay.

original: gcal ci zhig gzhug par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gcal ci zhig gzhug par bya zhe na /
translated: What should be put in the gravel?

original: de'i phyir phye ma'am lci ba'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir phye ma'am lci ba'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it is said, “sand or ashes.”

original: yang na tshags rten snod do zhes bya ba ni chu gnas par bya ba'i phyir chu tshags la yang na tshags rten snod gzhug go //
analyzed: yang na tshags rten snod do zhes bya ba ni chu gnas par bya ba'i phyir chu tshags la yang na tshags rten snod gzhug go //
translated: Or, a water-pot is a support for a water-strainer, in order to hold water.

original: de ci 'dra ba cig ce na de'i phyir sa dang zangs ma las byas pa gang yang rung ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ci 'dra ba cig ce na de'i phyir sa dang zangs ma las byas pa gang yang rung ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: What is it like? Therefore, it is said, “made of either clay or copper.”

original: sa las byas pa yang rung zangs ma las byas pa yang rung zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa las byas pa yang rung zangs ma las byas pa yang rung zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is made of either clay or copper.

original: de ni shing bu gsum gyi thog ma la gdags so zhes bya ba ste ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de ni shing bu gsum gyi thog ma la gdags so zhes bya ba ste ji ltar zhe na /
translated: It is attached to the top of the three sticks. How?

original: de'i phyir bu gur lung byas te'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bu gur lung byas te'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “having made a hole.”

original: 'dir bu ga phug nas don bsgrub pa la ltos nas bu ga du ma yang bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis khas blangs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir bu ga phug nas don bsgrub pa la ltos nas bu ga du ma yang bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis khas blangs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, having made a hole, many holes should be made in order to accomplish the purpose. By this, it should be understood that it is accepted.

original: phyi rol gyi ngos su tshags rten snod gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bcing ba gang dang gang med pas 'di la gnas pa med na de 'di la bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ngos su tshags rten snod gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bcing ba gang dang gang med pas 'di la gnas pa med na de 'di la bya'o //
translated: The water-pot should be placed on the outside. The meaning is that if it is not tied to this, it will not remain here.

original: de yang skyes pa la dgongs nas smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang skyes pa la dgongs nas smos pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, this is stated with reference to men.

original: de ltar de ci zhig gis gdags she na /
analyzed: de ltar de ci zhig gis gdags she na /
translated: In what way is it to be carried?

original: de'i phyir snga ma ni tha gus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir snga ma ni tha gus so //
translated: Therefore it is said, the former with a rope,

original: phyi ma ni lcags thag 'jam pos so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phyi ma ni lcags thag 'jam pos so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the latter with a soft iron chain.

original: snga ma sa las byas pa ni tha gus gdags so //
analyzed: snga ma sa las byas pa ni tha gus gdags so //
translated: The former, made of wood, is to be carried with a rope.

original: phyi ma zangs kyis byas pa ni lcags thag 'jam pos gdags so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyi ma zangs kyis byas pa ni lcags thag 'jam pos gdags so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The latter, made of copper, is to be carried with a soft iron chain. This is the meaning.

original: de bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la de zhes bya ba ni bcang bar bya ba'i snod do //
analyzed: de bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la de zhes bya ba ni bcang bar bya ba'i snod do //
translated: It is to be carried. Here, “it” refers to the vessel that is to be carried.

original: 'dir de yan lag nyid lcags thag dang tha gu bstan no //
analyzed: 'dir de yan lag nyid lcags thag dang tha gu bstan no //
translated: Here, the rope and the chain are taught as parts of it.

original: de bas na 'di dag la yang 'dir 'chang ba bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di dag la yang 'dir 'chang ba bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that here the carrying is taught for these two.

original: chu mi 'dzag na shing leb kyis chu chags la dal bus gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: chu mi 'dzag na shing leb kyis chu chags la dal bus gdab par bya'o //
translated: If water does not drip, it should be carried slowly with a wooden plank to prevent splashing.

original: bum tshags gce'u can ni tshegs chung du zhes bya ba ni dpyang tshags yod kyang tshegs chung zhing sla ba yin pas de la 'dod pa bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bum tshags gce'u can ni tshegs chung du zhes bya ba ni dpyang tshags yod kyang tshegs chung zhing sla ba yin pas de la 'dod pa bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The “vase with a spout” is called “little trouble.” Since it has a hanging loop, it is little trouble and easy. The meaning is that one should generate desire for that.

original: bum tshags gce'u can ni de nas dga' bar bya bar rig par zhes bya bas bstan zin to //
analyzed: bum tshags gce'u can ni de nas dga' bar bya bar rig par zhes bya bas bstan zin to //
translated: The “vase with a spout” is taught by “then one should know the delight.”

original: bcang ba ni rigs sam mi rigs zhes bya bas ma bstan to //
analyzed: bcang ba ni rigs sam mi rigs zhes bya bas ma bstan to //
translated: “One should hold” is not taught by “is it proper or not?”

original: de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de brjod par bya ste /
translated: That should be stated.

original: de'i phyir de bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “one should hold that.”

original: de ci las byas pa zhe na /
analyzed: de ci las byas pa zhe na /
translated: What is it made of?

original: @229b de'i phyir sa 'am zangs las byas pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: @229b de'i phyir sa 'am zangs las byas pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “made of clay or copper.”

original: de'i dbyibs ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: de'i dbyibs ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: What is its shape?

original: de'i phyir de ni bum ba'i dbyibs dang nang padma'i spu gu lta bu dang ldan pas 'og sbubs can yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni bum ba'i dbyibs dang nang padma'i spu gu lta bu dang ldan pas 'og sbubs can yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “it is hollow below, since it has the shape of a vase and an inner tube like a lotus stalk.”

original: 'di rnams kyi 'og tu rtsa'i sbubs yod pas na 'og sbubs can no //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi 'og tu rtsa'i sbubs yod pas na 'og sbubs can no //
translated: Since there is a tube of channels below these, it is hollow below.

original: nang padma'i spu gu lta bu dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nang padma'i spu gu lta bu dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is said to have an inner core like a lotus filament.

original: padma'i snying po'i nang na gnas pa'i spu gu dag lta bu nang gi spu gu 'og sbubs can gang la yod pa de ni 'og sbubs can padma lta bu nang gi bu ga lta bu'o //
analyzed: padma'i snying po'i nang na gnas pa'i spu gu dag lta bu nang gi spu gu 'og sbubs can gang la yod pa de ni 'og sbubs can padma lta bu nang gi bu ga lta bu'o //
translated: It has an inner core like the filaments that are located in the center of a lotus.

original: padma'i lte ba med bar padma lta bu nyid 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: padma'i lte ba med bar padma lta bu nyid 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: A lotus is not established as a lotus without a center.

original: de bas na 'di la tshig 'dis kun nas thob par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di la tshig 'dis kun nas thob par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this is understood to be the complete statement.

analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bum pa'i dbyibs lta bur bya zhing de'i nang du padma'i rnam pa lta bu'i bu ga dag gdod par bya'o //
translated: Here, the text says, “Make it like the shape of a vase, and inside of that make holes like the shape of a lotus.

original: de dag bsdu ba'i phyir de dag gi steng du bu gu chen bo gcig gdod par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag bsdu ba'i phyir de dag gi steng du bu gu chen bo gcig gdod par bya'o //

original: de dag nyid bsdu ba'i phyir 'og sbubs can du bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag nyid bsdu ba'i phyir 'og sbubs can du bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In order to collect those, make it with an inner core.”

original: 'dir bum pa'i bu ga chen po gcig gdod par bya'o zhes rnam par gnas ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir bum pa'i bu ga chen po gcig gdod par bya'o zhes rnam par gnas ba yin no //
translated: Here, it is established that one big hole is made in the vase.

original: de yang 'dir don gyis thob ba ste de bas na 'dir ma bstan to //
analyzed: de yang 'dir don gyis thob ba ste de bas na 'dir ma bstan to //
translated: This is the meaning that is implied here, and therefore it is not taught here.

original: de dag tu ras ma dgab pa nyid do zhes bya ba la de dag tu zhes bya ba ni nang gi bu ga rnams la'o //
analyzed: de dag tu ras ma dgab pa nyid do zhes bya ba la de dag tu zhes bya ba ni nang gi bu ga rnams la'o //
translated: In those, the cloth is not covered. In those means in the inner cavities.

original: 'dir gzhung ni de dag gi steng du ras g-yogs te chu btsag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin gyi bum pa'i bu ga la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni de dag gi steng du ras g-yogs te chu btsag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin gyi bum pa'i bu ga la ni ma yin no //

analyzed: chu tshags nye bar gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bdag gi ba 'di shin tu byas pa nges par bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should set out the water strainer means that one should make this one's own.

translated: The water strainer is triangular, with a rim, or with a stand. The water strainer with a spout is not without a strainer.

original: de bas na 'dis 'di la ma bzung ba nyid du shes par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dis 'di la ma bzung ba nyid du shes par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not understand that this is not grasped by this.

original: 'chang ba nye bar dgos bar bya ba la gsal tshags kyi tshig gis bzung ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'chang ba nye bar dgos bar bya ba la gsal tshags kyi tshig gis bzung ba nyid du rig par bya'o //

original: de dang ldan pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase in possession of means

original: nyid do zhes bya ba ni chu tshags nyid do //🔽de med par ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: nyid do zhes bya ba ni chu tshags nyid do // de med par ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro bar mi bya'o //

original: nang dang bcas pa dang lhan cig tu mi bya'o //
analyzed: nang dang bcas pa dang lhan cig tu mi bya'o //

original: gal te rkyen de lta bu yod na bzod pa gsol te'o //
analyzed: gal te rkyen de lta bu yod na bzod pa gsol te'o //

analyzed: bya ba byed pa na yod pa nyid ni yod pa nyid yin no //
translated: When the action is being performed, existence means existing.🔽 When the action is being performed, if another person promises, I will give it, then in possession of means in possession of that.

original: gzhan gyis 'di ltar der byin no zhes khas blangs pa nyid de dang ldan pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba la der zhes bya ba ni bya ba byed pa'i dus la'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'di ltar der byin no zhes khas blangs pa nyid de dang ldan pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba la der zhes bya ba ni bya ba byed pa'i dus la'o //

original: chu bcags pa'i dus der gzhan gyis khas blangs pa la de dang ldan pa nyid ni chu tshags dang ldan ba nyid do //
analyzed: chu bcags pa'i dus der gzhan gyis khas blangs pa la de dang ldan pa nyid ni chu tshags dang ldan ba nyid do //
translated: At the time of straining water, if another person promises, I will give it, then in possession of means in possession of a water strainer.
