analyzed: nyes byas so //
translated: It is a wrong action.

original: gal te de la rung ba ma lags pa de 'dra ba'i bca' bar bgyi ba dang / bza' bar bgyi ba stsal na ltung ba cir 'gyur nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te de la rung ba ma lags pa de 'dra ba'i bca' bar bgyi ba dang / bza' bar bgyi ba stsal na ltung ba cir 'gyur nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one gives him such food and drink as is not suitable for him, what is the offense? It is a wrong action.

original: gang zhig de la ma yin zhes bya ba 'og ma'i dri ba las gsungs na snga rol du dge slong la mi rung ba gang yin pa de bzung ba zhes bya ba des pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig de la ma yin zhes bya ba 'og ma'i dri ba las gsungs na snga rol du dge slong la mi rung ba gang yin pa de bzung ba zhes bya ba des pa'o //
translated: If one asks, “What is not suitable for him?” as in the following verse, then the answer is, “Whatever is not suitable for the monk.”

original: ci don gang yang rung ba'i phyir sbyin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci don gang yang rung ba'i phyir sbyin nam zhe na /
translated: “Is it given for any purpose?”

original: de'i phyir sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa dang bral pa nyid kyi phyir ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa dang bral pa nyid kyi phyir ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “Except when free from the view of sinfulness.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa dang dbral bar 'dod pa ni ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa dang dbral bar 'dod pa ni ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The text here says, “There is no offense if one wishes to free him from the view of sinfulness.”

original: ci zhig rjes su bsgrub na gcer bu pa la sbyin pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig rjes su bsgrub na gcer bu pa la sbyin pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the offense if one gives to a naked ascetic?

original: de'i phyir rang gis byin na'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gis byin na'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, “if one gives oneself.”

original: mi rung ba dag ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni rang dang de la mi rung ba'i bca' ba dang bza' ba dag sbyin pa la ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: mi rung ba dag ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni rang dang de la mi rung ba'i bca' ba dang bza' ba dag sbyin pa la ni nyes byas te /
translated: “If they are unsuitable, there is an offense of wrong conduct” means that if one gives food and drink that are unsuitable for oneself or for them, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'di dag sbyin du 'jug na shin tu na smad pa nyid de 'di ni mtshon pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag sbyin du 'jug na shin tu na smad pa nyid de 'di ni mtshon pa tsam yin no //
translated: If one causes them to be given, there is a very serious offense. This is just an illustration.

original: 'dir gzhan la yang dngos gzhi ma yin par byas pa sbyin pa thams cad du sbyin par byas la gos la sogs pa la nyes byas su rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhan la yang dngos gzhi ma yin par byas pa sbyin pa thams cad du sbyin par byas la gos la sogs pa la nyes byas su rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Here, in all cases, one should understand that if one gives what is not the actual basis, there is an offense of wrong conduct, as in the case of giving cloth, and so on.

original: sbyin du 'jug na yang ngo //
analyzed: sbyin du 'jug na yang ngo //
translated: If one causes them to be given, there is also an offense.

original: rang gis zhal ta byas na'o zhes bya ba ni rang gis lus sam de 'brel pa @236b la mi rung ba'i bca' ba dang bza' ba dag la nyes byas so //
analyzed: rang gis zhal ta byas na'o zhes bya ba ni rang gis lus sam de 'brel pa @236b la mi rung ba'i bca' ba dang bza' ba dag la nyes byas so //
translated: “If one gives oneself” means that if one gives food and drink that are unsuitable for oneself or for them, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de la gcer bu pa la yongs su 'tshol bar byed na nyes byas so //
analyzed: de la gcer bu pa la yongs su 'tshol bar byed na nyes byas so //
translated: If one searches for a naked ascetic, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: mngon gsum du sbyin pa la 'di dang 'brel pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon gsum du sbyin pa la 'di dang 'brel pa ma yin no //
translated: If one gives in the presence of a naked ascetic, there is no offense.

original: rang gis gzhal ta byas na sbyin du 'jug pa la de dang 'brel pa nyid la gus pa nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rang gis gzhal ta byas na sbyin du 'jug pa la de dang 'brel pa nyid la gus pa nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If he himself evaluates and makes the gift, then he himself would be the one who is respectful.

original: de bas na rang gis zhal ta byas nas sbyin du 'jug pa'i dbang du byas nas nyes byas 'di brjod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rang gis zhal ta byas nas sbyin du 'jug pa'i dbang du byas nas nyes byas 'di brjod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this offense should be understood as applying to one who makes a gift after himself evaluating the gift.

original: bgo bsha' byed na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni bgo bsha' byed na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni bgo bsha' byed pa'i ngo bos bca' ba dang bza' ba dag la lus sam de dang 'brel pa las gzhan du nyes byas so //
analyzed: bgo bsha' byed na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni bgo bsha' byed na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni bgo bsha' byed pa'i ngo bos bca' ba dang bza' ba dag la lus sam de dang 'brel pa las gzhan du nyes byas so //
translated: Even if he is distributing, he should not do it in this way. Even if he is distributing, he should not do it by the nature of distributing food and drink with his own hand or with someone else related to him.

original: gang zhig slong ba 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i ngo bo gzhan du 'jog pa gdol pa bzhin du de sbyin pas na de la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gang zhig slong ba 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i ngo bo gzhan du 'jog pa gdol pa bzhin du de sbyin pas na de la nyes pa med do //
translated: If someone else is the one who is the object of the request, then there is no offense for him if he gives in that way, like an outcaste.

original: bgo bsha' bya ba'i tshul gyis 'dir yongs su tshol bar byed par 'gyur ba nyid yod pa yin no //
analyzed: bgo bsha' bya ba'i tshul gyis 'dir yongs su tshol bar byed par 'gyur ba nyid yod pa yin no //
translated: Here, there is the nature of distributing, and he is the one who is seeking.

original: de bas na 'dir nyes pa med pa nyid med do //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir nyes pa med pa nyid med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no absence of offense here.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las gcig tu bgo bsha' bya ste za na nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las gcig tu bgo bsha' bya ste za na nyes byas so //
translated: Here, the text is divided into two parts: if one eats the food that has been divided, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gzhan gyis rang gi don du bgo bsha' byed du 'jug pa la nyes byas las shin tu na smad pa nyid ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis rang gi don du bgo bsha' byed du 'jug pa la nyes byas las shin tu na smad pa nyid ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one causes another to divide it for one’s own sake, it is said to be an offense of wrong conduct, but it is more reprehensible.

original: mi rung ba'i bza' bar bya ba dang bca' bar bya ba dag la mdo snga ma dag gis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mi rung ba'i bza' bar bya ba dang bca' bar bya ba dag la mdo snga ma dag gis shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the food and drink that are not suitable from the earlier sūtras.

original: gcer bu pa la sbyin pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: gcer bu pa la sbyin pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: (10) The downfall of giving to the naked.

original: // / gang du dmag la lta ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / gang du dmag la lta ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Where is there a downfall for watching an army?

original: de'i phyir g-yul la rnam par dga' ba'i dmag la lta ba'i don nyid kyis so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir g-yul la rnam par dga' ba'i dmag la lta ba'i don nyid kyis so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “Because of the meaning of watching an army that is enjoying a battle.”

original: zhugs pa la zhes bya ba dang 'brel lo //
analyzed: zhugs pa la zhes bya ba dang 'brel lo //
translated: It is connected with “if one goes.”

original: bsod snyoms la sogs pa'i don du byung bas dmag la lta bar byed na yang ltung byed do //
analyzed: bsod snyoms la sogs pa'i don du byung bas dmag la lta bar byed na yang ltung byed do //
translated: If one watches an army for the sake of alms-food and so forth, there is a downfall.

original: ci rgyu mtshan gang yang rung bas blta'o cog la'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci rgyu mtshan gang yang rung bas blta'o cog la'am zhe na /
translated: Is it a downfall for watching any army for any reason?

original: de'i phyir rgyal po dang btsun mo dang gzhon nu dang zhang blon dang khrom gyi ru sna dang / grong rdal gyi mi dang ljongs kyi mis bkug pa dang bar chad byung ba'i dbang nyid ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyal po dang btsun mo dang gzhon nu dang zhang blon dang khrom gyi ru sna dang / grong rdal gyi mi dang ljongs kyi mis bkug pa dang bar chad byung ba'i dbang nyid ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos ste /
translated: Therefore, the text says, “except in the case of the king, the queen, the prince, the minister, the leader of a caravan, the city-dwellers, the country people, and those who are summoned or who have fallen into misfortune.”

original: 'di rnams kyis kyang brjod de bar du gcod pa'i rgyu mtshan la nye bar ltung ba dor nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis kyang brjod de bar du gcod pa'i rgyu mtshan la nye bar ltung ba dor nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: These are also mentioned because they are the causes of obstacles. The meaning is that one should avoid falling into misfortune.

original: stobs kyis bzung nas khyer ba ni bar du gcod pa nye bar ltung ba la khongs su bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: stobs kyis bzung nas khyer ba ni bar du gcod pa nye bar ltung ba la khongs su bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that being carried off by force is included in falling into misfortune.

original: nye bar 'tshe ba dang dge 'dun nam gang zag gam mchod rten la sogs pa la par du gcod pa nyid ni shes par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar 'tshe ba dang dge 'dun nam gang zag gam mchod rten la sogs pa la par du gcod pa nyid ni shes par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: One should not understand that harm and obstacles to the Saṅgha, to individuals, to the stūpa, and so on are to be avoided.

original: rjes su bsgrub pa gang la ltung ba 'di yin zhe na /🔽de'i @237a * //
analyzed: rjes su bsgrub pa gang la ltung ba 'di yin zhe na / de'i @237a * //
translated: With regard to the practice of the vow, in what circumstances does this downfall occur?

original: phyir 'phags pa'i nyen kor gyi mtha' las 'das te mthong na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phyir 'phags pa'i nyen kor gyi mtha' las 'das te mthong na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the text says, “if one goes beyond the boundary of the noble one’s zone and sees it.”

original: gnas gang na 'phags pa'i gnas de'i nye 'khor gang yin pa de'i mtha' gang yin pa de las 'das te mthong ba chos gos kyi nyen kor gang yin pa de ni 'dir nyen kor du rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas gang na 'phags pa'i gnas de'i nye 'khor gang yin pa de'i mtha' gang yin pa de las 'das te mthong ba chos gos kyi nyen kor gang yin pa de ni 'dir nyen kor du rigs pa yin no //
translated: The field of the robe is the field of the robe of one who has gone beyond the boundary of the field of the robe of the place where the noble one is staying and the field of the robe of the place where he is staying.

original: grong dang 'brel pa dor nas 'dir thogs pa dang bcas pa'i khyim bzhin du ma bsgribs pa la nyes pa med pa ltar /
analyzed: grong dang 'brel pa dor nas 'dir thogs pa dang bcas pa'i khyim bzhin du ma bsgribs pa la nyes pa med pa ltar /
translated: Just as there is no fault in an uncovered house in the village, so too there is no fault in the open air here.

original: dge slong glang po che'i tshogs lta ba'i phyir 'gro na ji srid du mig gis ma mthong gi bar du ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong glang po che'i tshogs lta ba'i phyir 'gro na ji srid du mig gis ma mthong gi bar du ni nyes byas so //
translated: If a monk goes to see a herd of elephants, as long as he does not see them with his eyes, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: mig gis mthong bar gyur na ni ltung byed do //
analyzed: mig gis mthong bar gyur na ni ltung byed do //
translated: If he sees them with his eyes, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: de bzhin du rta'i tshogs dang shing rta'i tshogs dang rkang thang gi tshogs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ltung ba bstan pa la mthong ba tsam la dngos gzhir gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rta'i tshogs dang shing rta'i tshogs dang rkang thang gi tshogs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ltung ba bstan pa la mthong ba tsam la dngos gzhir gsungs so //
translated: In the teaching on the offense, it is said that the actual offense is committed by merely seeing a herd of horses, a herd of chariots, a herd of infantry, and so on.

original: de'i snga rol du nyen kor gyi mtha' ma las ma 'das par de'i don du 'jug pa la de'i bzhin bsgyur ba tsam gyis mthong ba la ni nyes byas su gtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i snga rol du nyen kor gyi mtha' ma las ma 'das par de'i don du 'jug pa la de'i bzhin bsgyur ba tsam gyis mthong ba la ni nyes byas su gtogs par bya'o //
translated: Prior to that, if one enters for that purpose without exceeding the limit of danger, then it is to be included in a wrong action, merely by the transformation of that.

original: dmag la lta ba'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: dmag la lta ba'i ltung byed do /
translated: The downfall through watching an army.

original: // / gang du dmag gi nang du gnas pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / gang du dmag gi nang du gnas pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Where is there a downfall through staying in an army?

original: de'i phyir de dag med par der nyin mtshan gnyis las lhag par 'dug na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag med par der nyin mtshan gnyis las lhag par 'dug na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “If one stays there for more than two days and nights without a reason.”

original: de dag med par zhes bya ba ni rgyal po la sogs pas bkug pa dang bar chad nye bar byung ba'i dbang nyid do //
analyzed: de dag med par zhes bya ba ni rgyal po la sogs pas bkug pa dang bar chad nye bar byung ba'i dbang nyid do //
translated: “Without a reason” means that one is summoned by a king, and so forth, or that an obstacle has arisen.

original: der zhes bya ba ni g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag la'o //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag la'o //
translated: “There” means in an army that is eager for battle.

original: nyin mtshan gnyis las zhes bya ba ni nyin mo dang mtshan mo dag la'o //
analyzed: nyin mtshan gnyis las zhes bya ba ni nyin mo dang mtshan mo dag la'o //
translated: “For more than two days and nights” means for more than one day and one night.

original: de las gang du lhag par 'dug na'o zhes bya ba 'di ni nyin mtshan dag go //
analyzed: de las gang du lhag par 'dug na'o zhes bya ba 'di ni nyin mtshan dag go //
translated: “If one stays there” means for those days and nights.

original: nyin mtshan gyi mthar yang 'dul ba'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: nyin mtshan gyi mthar yang 'dul ba'i tha snyad do //
translated: Even at the end of the day and night, it is a rule of training.

original: de bas na 'di la yang dngos gzhi'i rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di la yang dngos gzhi'i rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is also established as the main part here.

original: 'dir yang gang zhig rnam par gnas pa la skad cig ma'i rjes su mthun pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang gang zhig rnam par gnas pa la skad cig ma'i rjes su mthun pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: And here, it is not suitable to be in accordance with the momentariness of what is established.

original: de'i phyir 'dir sbyor ba thob pa 'dun nas rnam par gnas pa yin gyi ltung ba med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir sbyor ba thob pa 'dun nas rnam par gnas pa yin gyi ltung ba med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, here, one who has attained practice is established through intention, but it is not a downfall.

original: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i rjes su sgrub pa la dus nam gyi tshe byas pa kha na ma tho ba med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i rjes su sgrub pa la dus nam gyi tshe byas pa kha na ma tho ba med pa ma yin no //
translated: In following what has a fault, when it is done, it is not without fault.

original: nyin mtshan gzhan po 'di la ni nyin mtshan gzhan la zhugs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nyin mtshan gzhan po 'di la ni nyin mtshan gzhan la zhugs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: In this other day and night, one does not enter into another day and night.

original: de bas na nyin mtshan so sor 'dir kha na ma tho bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na nyin mtshan so sor 'dir kha na ma tho bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be known that here, in each day and night, there is a fault.

original: dgos pa med na snga ma la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'i tshul gyis dgos pa med na snga ma yang nyin zhag gsum par 'dug pa @237b las gnas pa gang yin pa de la yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dgos pa med na snga ma la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'i tshul gyis dgos pa med na snga ma yang nyin zhag gsum par 'dug pa @237b las gnas pa gang yin pa de la yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that if there is no purpose by way of reasoning, then also in the former case, whatever is the case of abiding for three days and nights, that is the meaning of “also.”

original: mthar ni dngos gzhi ste snga rol du ni nyes byas zhes bya ba 'di la 'dir snga ma bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mthar ni dngos gzhi ste snga rol du ni nyes byas zhes bya ba 'di la 'dir snga ma bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: In the end, it is the actual basis, and in the beginning, it is a misdeed.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong la de 'dra ba'i rkyen yod par gyur na rtsom pa'i dmag la lta ba'i phyir nye bar 'gro bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong la de 'dra ba'i rkyen yod par gyur na rtsom pa'i dmag la lta ba'i phyir nye bar 'gro bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text says that if a monk has such conditions, he should go near in order to see the army that is starting out.

original: legs pa'i ngo bo 'dod pa'i don med pa na dmag gi nang du so sor nyams su myong bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs pa de'i tshig gi brjod pa'o //
analyzed: legs pa'i ngo bo 'dod pa'i don med pa na dmag gi nang du so sor nyams su myong bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs pa de'i tshig gi brjod pa'o //
translated: If there is no purpose of desiring to see the nature of the army, then it is said that one should not experience it individually in the midst of the army. That is the expression of the words.

original: dmag gi nang na gnas pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: dmag gi nang na gnas pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: It is a downfall to remain in the midst of an army.

original: // / dpung gi yan lag rnams ni byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba ni g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag gi dpung gi yan lag glang po che dang rta dang shing rta dang rkang thang dang rgyal mtshan la sogs pa rnams kyi dmag la zhes bya
analyzed: // / dpung gi yan lag rnams ni byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba ni g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag gi dpung gi yan lag glang po che dang rta dang shing rta dang rkang thang dang rgyal mtshan la sogs pa rnams kyi dmag la zhes bya
translated: The limbs of the army are the agents. The limbs of the army of the army that delights in battle are the elephant, horse, chariot, infantry, flag, and so on.

original: bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bar sbyar ro //
translated: The word “army” is supplied.

original: 'dir mtshon pa'i ni brtsams pa'i g-yul ngo rnams kyi yan lag tu rnam par gnas pa yin zhes bya ba thams cad khongs su bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir mtshon pa'i ni brtsams pa'i g-yul ngo rnams kyi yan lag tu rnam par gnas pa yin zhes bya ba thams cad khongs su bsdu ba'o //
translated: Here, the limbs of the army are established as the limbs of the battle that is begun, which is illustrated by the army. This includes everything.

original: ci de thams cad la 'di rnams byed pa po yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci de thams cad la 'di rnams byed pa po yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are they agents in all of these?

original: de'i phyir bar chad kyi dbang gis 'gro ba ma yin pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bar chad kyi dbang gis 'gro ba ma yin pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “when not going due to the power of an obstruction.”

original: spangs nas zhes bya ba brjod pa dag la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: spangs nas zhes bya ba brjod pa dag la ltung ba med do //
translated: When one has abandoned the expression “falls,” there is no fault.

original: rgyu dag las gcig ni 'dir rgyu nyid de bar chad kyi dbang gis ltung ba nyid de /
analyzed: rgyu dag las gcig ni 'dir rgyu nyid de bar chad kyi dbang gis ltung ba nyid de /
translated: From among the causes, one is the cause here. It is falling due to the power of an obstruction.

original: rgyal po la sogs pa las smos pa las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyal po la sogs pa las smos pa las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not from a king, etc.

original: 'dir gzhung ni bar chad brgyad po dag las bar chad gang yang rung ba nye bar gnas par gyur na nyes pa med do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bar chad brgyad po dag las bar chad gang yang rung ba nye bar gnas par gyur na nyes pa med do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here the text says that if any of the eight obstructions should arise, there is no fault.

original: de yang de tsam du zad kyi gnod pa thams cad nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i don du 'gro ba la yang 'dir nyes pa med pa la sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni bar chad tsam la yang dag par brten pa'o //
analyzed: de yang de tsam du zad kyi gnod pa thams cad nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i don du 'gro ba la yang 'dir nyes pa med pa la sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni bar chad tsam la yang dag par brten pa'o //
translated: And that is all. There is no fault here in applying to the pacification of all harm, which is called “the mere obstruction.”

original: bsdus pa dang so so dag go zhes bya ba ni g-yul gyi yan lag rnams la byed pa po nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bsdus pa dang so so dag go zhes bya ba ni g-yul gyi yan lag rnams la byed pa po nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The “collection” and “individual” are to be connected with “the one who is the agent in the branches of battle.”

analyzed: brdegs na'o zhes bya ba rjes su bsgrub pa bshad pa'o //
translated: this is the explanation of the subsequent establishment of if he strikes.

analyzed: 'dir mngon par zhen pa dang khros pa dang drag por gyur pa dang yid mi bde ba zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gzhan gyis kyang sbyin pa la kha na ma tho ba nyams pas 'dir bskyed par rnam par gnas pa yin no //

analyzed: de'i phyir lus sam des 'phangs pa'am de dang 'brel pa dag gis so //
translated: Therefore, it is said: by the body, or by what is projected by it, or by what is connected with it.

analyzed: lus sam des 'phangs pa'am de dang 'brel pa dag gis so zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: 'dir 'ga' zhig tu ni shin tu yang ma chad pa la na smad par shes par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa ni gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa tha na rkang pa'i mthe bo la sogs pa

analyzed: lus la sogs pa rnams kyi mthar thug pa la yang dag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The culmination of the body, etc. should be understood.

original: gang la brdegs par yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang la brdegs par yin zhe na /
translated: By whom is it defiled?

original: de'i phyir dge slong la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the text says: “to a monk.”

original: ltung ba 'byin pa po yang dge slong yin te /
analyzed: ltung ba 'byin pa po yang dge slong yin te /

analyzed: der bdag nyid la yang brdegs pa la zhes bya ba thob pa'o //

analyzed: de'i phyir reg na'o zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: ci ltung byed gcig tu 'gyur ram zhe na /

analyzed: ma phog na nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni sor mo la sogs pa brdeg spyad dag gis ma phog na nyes byas so //
translated: If one does not strike with fingers, etc., there is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽One should strike what is to be struck,

original: brdeg par bya ba gzhan yin la /
analyzed: brdeg par bya ba gzhan yin la /
translated: but one should not strike another.

original: gzhan la brdeg par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni sems brdeg par bya ba nyid la rang gi lus la brdeg pa 'di bkag pa'o //🔽'dir @239b gzhung ni de lta bas na dge slong gis brdeg par bya ba gzhan yin la /
analyzed: gzhan la brdeg par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni sems brdeg par bya ba nyid la rang gi lus la brdeg pa 'di bkag pa'o // 'dir @239b gzhung ni de lta bas na dge slong gis brdeg par bya ba gzhan yin la /
translated: The meaning of this is that one should strike one’s own body, but one should not strike another’s body.🔽The text says, “Therefore, a monk should strike what is to be struck, but should not strike another.”

original: gzhan la brdeg par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa la bu yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la brdeg par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa la bu yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the text.

original: ka ba la brdeg par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ka ba la brdeg par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not strike a pillar.

original: rtsig pa dang / sa dang shing ljon pa dang gzhan la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni phran tshegs rnams la 'bras bu la sogs pa de dbab pa'i don du 'dir brdeg pa ster ba la sogs pa 'byung po'i tshogs 'jig pa'i cho ga la de khongs su 'dus pa zhes bya
analyzed: rtsig pa dang / sa dang shing ljon pa dang gzhan la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni phran tshegs rnams la 'bras bu la sogs pa de dbab pa'i don du 'dir brdeg pa ster ba la sogs pa 'byung po'i tshogs 'jig pa'i cho ga la de khongs su 'dus pa zhes bya
translated: “Walls, earth, trees, and so on” means that in the case of minor offenses, striking and so on are permitted here in order to bring about the result of subduing spirits and so on. This is included in the rite of destroying the assembly of spirits.

original: ba gzhan 'gog pa ni 'di'i yul lo //
analyzed: ba gzhan 'gog pa ni 'di'i yul lo //
translated: The object of this rule is to prevent others from doing the same.

original: bud shing gi don du shing ljon pa dang / mandal gyi don du sa brdung ba la sogs pa 'di lta bu la yang /
analyzed: bud shing gi don du shing ljon pa dang / mandal gyi don du sa brdung ba la sogs pa 'di lta bu la yang /
translated: In the case of striking a tree for the sake of firewood, or striking the ground for the sake of a mandala, and so on,

original: ci 'dis bkag pa nyid yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dis bkag pa nyid yin nam zhe na /
translated: is this also prohibited?

original: ma yin te zhes bstan pa ni brdeg pa ster ba'i sbom po la 'jug pa la 'di bkag pa yin gyi gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bstan pa ni brdeg pa ster ba'i sbom po la 'jug pa la 'di bkag pa yin gyi gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: To explain that it is not, the text says, “This is prohibited in the case of striking and so on for the sake of subduing spirits, but not in other cases.”

original: de ltar yang tshe dang ldan pas ri shing gshegs pa 'jug pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang tshe dang ldan pas ri shing gshegs pa 'jug pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the venerable one will go to the forest and enter.

original: brdeg pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: brdeg pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: This is the downfall of striking.

original: // / gang du gzas pa'i ltung byed ces bya ba 'di la rnyog pa can gyi sems nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa nas gzas pa na'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mtha' ma la ltos nas brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / gang du gzas pa'i ltung byed ces bya ba 'di la rnyog pa can gyi sems nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa nas gzas pa na'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mtha' ma la ltos nas brjod par bya ste /
translated: The second case is used in the phrase “when one threatens to strike,” and so on.

original: de'i phyir brdeg par gzas pa na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir brdeg par gzas pa na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the phrase “when one threatens to strike” is stated.

original: ci 'dir gcig nyid du 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dir gcig nyid du 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: “But would this not be just one offense?”

original: de'i phyir rdzas re re la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rdzas re re la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the phrase “for each substance” is stated.

original: sor mo la sogs pa'i rdzas ji snyed gzas pa de snyed kyi ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sor mo la sogs pa'i rdzas ji snyed gzas pa de snyed kyi ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there would be as many offenses as there are substances, such as fingers, that are threatened.

original: gzas pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: gzas pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: This is the offense of threatening.

original: // / ci zhig byas na gnas ngan len 'chab pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / ci zhig byas na gnas ngan len 'chab pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the offense of concealing a serious fault?

original: de'i phyir pham par gyur pa dang dge 'dun lhag ma dag bcab ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir pham par gyur pa dang dge 'dun lhag ma dag bcab ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the phrase “concealing a defeating offense or a serious violation” is stated.

original: gnas ngan len ces bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ba dang de dang 'di la 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: gnas ngan len ces bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ba dang de dang 'di la 'brel pa'o //
translated: The term “serious fault” is explained below, and it is related to this.

original: ci bcab pa rnam pa thams cad la gnas ngan len du 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: ci bcab pa rnam pa thams cad la gnas ngan len du 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Is concealment a negative tendency in all cases?

original: de'i phyir bde ba la mi reg pa dang dge sbyong gi tshul dang tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad dang / dge 'dun 'khrug tu dogs pa'i dbang nyid ma gtogs par 'chab na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba la mi reg pa dang dge sbyong gi tshul dang tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad dang / dge 'dun 'khrug tu dogs pa'i dbang nyid ma gtogs par 'chab na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said: “except when there is the power of not touching pleasure, the power of an obstacle to the way of virtuous ones and celibacy, and the power of fearing a schism in the Saṅgha.”

original: dbang nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni bde ba la mi reg pa la sogs pa thams cad dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbang nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni bde ba la mi reg pa la sogs pa thams cad dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The term “power” should be applied to all cases, such as not touching pleasure.

original: bar chad ces bya ba'i sgra ni dge sbyong gi tshul dang / tshangs par spyod pa gnyis dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bar chad ces bya ba'i sgra ni dge sbyong gi tshul dang / tshangs par spyod pa gnyis dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The term “obstacle” should be applied to both the way of virtuous ones and celibacy.

original: bde ba la mi reg pa'i dbang nyid dang / dge sbyong gi tshul gyi bar chad kyi dbang nyid dang / tshangs par spyod @240a * //
analyzed: bde ba la mi reg pa'i dbang nyid dang / dge sbyong gi tshul gyi bar chad kyi dbang nyid dang / tshangs par spyod @240a * //
translated: The power of not touching pleasure, the power of an obstacle to the way of virtuous ones, the power of an obstacle to celibacy, the power of fearing a schism in the Saṅgha, and the power of fearing a wrong view.

original: pa'i bad chad kyi dbang nyid dang / dge 'dun 'khrug tu dogs pa'i dbang nyid ma gtogs par gzhan pham bar 'gyur ba dang dge 'dun lhag ma dag 'chab na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pa'i bad chad kyi dbang nyid dang / dge 'dun 'khrug tu dogs pa'i dbang nyid ma gtogs par gzhan pham bar 'gyur ba dang dge 'dun lhag ma dag 'chab na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and the power of the illness itself, and the power of the fear of a schism in the Saṅgha, except for the other defeats and the remaining offenses of the monks.

original: de la 'dir dge sbyong gi bar chad la sogs pa ni dpe tsam du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'dir dge sbyong gi bar chad la sogs pa ni dpe tsam du rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the obstacles to the religious life and so on should be understood as mere examples.

original: gang zag gi gzhi 'khor dang bcas pas 'chab pa'i cho ga shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag gi gzhi 'khor dang bcas pas 'chab pa'i cho ga shes par bya'o //
translated: The rite of concealment should be understood in terms of the individual and the basis.

original: dus gang gi tshe bcabs she na /
analyzed: dus gang gi tshe bcabs she na /
translated: At what time is there concealment?

original: de'i phyir nyin mtshan gyi mthar ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyin mtshan gyi mthar ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “at the end of the day and night.”

original: gang gi rjes la skye rengs 'char ka tshun chad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi rjes la skye rengs 'char ka tshun chad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is up to the time of dawn.

original: snga rol du ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni nyin mtshan gyi mtha'i snga rol du 'chab pa la ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: snga rol du ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni nyin mtshan gyi mtha'i snga rol du 'chab pa la ni nyes byas so //
translated: Before that, there is an offense of wrong conduct. Before the end of the day and night, if there is concealment, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ltung ba gzhan yang ngo zhes bya ba chung ba la don 'thob pa la pham par gyur pa dang / dge 'dun gyi lhag ma dag las gzhan pa'i ltung byed bcabs na ni nyin mtshan gyi mthar yang nyes byas la snga rol du yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: ltung ba gzhan yang ngo zhes bya ba chung ba la don 'thob pa la pham par gyur pa dang / dge 'dun gyi lhag ma dag las gzhan pa'i ltung byed bcabs na ni nyin mtshan gyi mthar yang nyes byas la snga rol du yang nyes byas so //
translated: If one conceals a downfall other than a defeating offense or a partially defeating offense, then at the end of the day and night, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gnas ngan len 'chab pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: gnas ngan len 'chab pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: It is also a downfall to conceal a negative tendency.

original: // / ci zhig byas na zan gcod du 'jug pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / ci zhig byas na zan gcod du 'jug pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the downfall of making someone stop eating?

original: de'i phyir nad kyi gnyen po'i don nyid ma gtogs par ched du bsams te khyim pa sbyin pa po zan gcod du bcug na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nad kyi gnyen po'i don nyid ma gtogs par ched du bsams te khyim pa sbyin pa po zan gcod du bcug na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “Except for the purpose of treating an illness, if one intentionally makes a layperson stop eating.”

original: zan gang gi sbyin pa po khyim pa gang yin pa de ni sbyin pa po khyim pa'i zan te /
analyzed: zan gang gi sbyin pa po khyim pa gang yin pa de ni sbyin pa po khyim pa'i zan te /
translated: The food of a layperson who is a donor is the food of a layperson donor.

original: de gcod pa ni dge slong gi ched du bsams te zan gang gis gcod du bcug na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de gcod pa ni dge slong gi ched du bsams te zan gang gis gcod du bcug na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one makes that person stop eating, it means that one intentionally makes a layperson stop eating.

original: ci rnam pa thams cad du bcug pa la yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci rnam pa thams cad du bcug pa la yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it the case that one commits a downfall for making anyone stop eating?

original: de'i phyir nad kyi gnyen po'i don nyid ma gtogs pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir nad kyi gnyen po'i don nyid ma gtogs pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, the phrase “except for the purpose of curing an illness” is applied.

original: gcod du bcug pa ni der rang gi tshig gis zhes bya ba 'jug go //
analyzed: gcod du bcug pa ni der rang gi tshig gis zhes bya ba 'jug go //
translated: “To have someone else do it” is supplied by the phrase “there, with one’s own words.”

original: de lta bas na spring yig dang lag yig dang lag rtsis dang ; mngags pa dang brgyud pa dang zur gyis gcod du bcug na nyes byas so //
analyzed: de lta bas na spring yig dang lag yig dang lag rtsis dang ; mngags pa dang brgyud pa dang zur gyis gcod du bcug na nyes byas so //
translated: Therefore, if one has someone else write a letter, a note, a sign, or if one sends a messenger, or if one has someone else do it indirectly, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽Here, the text is to be understood as it is stated in some recitations.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las gsung de 'dis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las gsung de 'dis bsdus par rig par bya'o //

original: sbyin bdag khyim pa dag zan gcod par byed du bcug pa 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las mu stegs can gyi khyim bdag tu byed du bcug na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin bdag khyim pa dag zan gcod par byed du bcug pa 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las mu stegs can gyi khyim bdag tu byed du bcug na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The downfall is having someone else do it.

original: zan gcod du 'jug pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: zan gcod du 'jug pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: The downfall is having

original: // / seng ge la reg par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni me dang 'dra bar bsnyen par dka' zhing bzod par dka' ba nyid yin pa'i phyir reg par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: // / seng ge la reg par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni me dang 'dra bar bsnyen par dka' zhing bzod par dka' ba nyid yin pa'i phyir reg par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: One should not touch a lion, because it is difficult to approach and difficult to bear, like fire.

original: rin po che'am de dang mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rin po che'am de dang mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not because it is a jewel or equal to one.

original: de @240b bas na der 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de @240b bas na der 'jug pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is an engagement there.

original: rin po che 'am de dang 'di mnyam pas de reg pa bkag pa la dus byin gyis brlab pa'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rin po che 'am de dang 'di mnyam pas de reg pa bkag pa la dus byin gyis brlab pa'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the aspect of blessing the time, which is the prohibition of touching a jewel or that which is equal to it,

original: de la dus byin gyis brlabs pa'i ngo bo gsungs pa ni ston pa dang chos dang dge 'dun dang tshangs par spyod pa rnams kyis chos dang ldan pa'i bya ba'i don nyid dang lhung bzed dang tshon gyi las la brtag pa ni dus byin gyis brlabs pa yin🔽no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de la dus byin gyis brlabs pa'i ngo bo gsungs pa ni ston pa dang chos dang dge 'dun dang tshangs par spyod pa rnams kyis chos dang ldan pa'i bya ba'i don nyid dang lhung bzed dang tshon gyi las la brtag pa ni dus byin gyis brlabs pa yin🔽no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, “The essence of blessing the time is the Dharma activity of the Teacher, the Dharma, the Saṅgha, and the pure lives, and the investigation of the activity of the begging bowl and the dye is the blessing of the time.”

original: de rnams kyis chos dang ldan pa'i bya ba gang yin pa de'i don nyid la reg pa la lhung bzed dang tshon gyi las la brtags pa ni dus byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis chos dang ldan pa'i bya ba gang yin pa de'i don nyid la reg pa la lhung bzed dang tshon gyi las la brtags pa ni dus byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One, having seen that they were engaged in the work of the bowls and the robes, said to them, “Monks, you should not do the work of the bowls and the robes.🔽The Blessed One said, “Monks, you should consecrate the time.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni dus byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / de dag gis gang gi don du byin gyis brlab pa mi shes nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dus byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / de dag gis gang gi don du byin gyis brlab pa mi shes nas /
translated: Not knowing for what purpose they should consecrate the time,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: the Blessed One said,🔽“Monks, you should consecrate the time by relying on the work of the Teacher, the work of the Dharma, the work of the Saṅgha, the work of the preceptor and instructor, and the work of fellow practitioners of celibacy.

original: ston pa'i bya ba dang chos dang dge 'dun dang / slob dpon dang mkhan po dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa'i bya bas mngon par brten pa ni byin gyis brlab pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa sems kyis 'dir rnam par gnas pa yin no //🔽chos dang ldan pa'i bya ba'i don gyi dbang nyid kyis ni 'dir 'jug par rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: ston pa'i bya ba dang chos dang dge 'dun dang / slob dpon dang mkhan po dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa'i bya bas mngon par brten pa ni byin gyis brlab pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa sems kyis 'dir rnam par gnas pa yin no // chos dang ldan pa'i bya ba'i don gyi dbang nyid kyis ni 'dir 'jug par rigs pa yin te /
translated: Here, you should remain in the consecration and in the mental formation.🔽The purpose of the consecration is the work of the Dharma.

original: de'i phyir chos dang ldan pa'i don nyid kyi tshig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos dang ldan pa'i don nyid kyi tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the consecration is the word for the work of the Dharma.

original: slob dpon dang mkhan po dag la ni ma yin te tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dag la yang ma yin no ;
analyzed: slob dpon dang mkhan po dag la ni ma yin te tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dag la yang ma yin no ;
translated: But not to the master or preceptor, nor to those who are fellow brahmacarins.

original: / de bas na 'dir de dag gi zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: / de bas na 'dir de dag gi zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
translated: Therefore, here the word “them” is used.

original: 'dir lhung bzed dang tshon gyi las zhes smos pas ni /
analyzed: 'dir lhung bzed dang tshon gyi las zhes smos pas ni /
translated: Here, by mentioning the work of the begging bowl and the work of the robes,

original: rang gi lhung bzed dang chos gos kyi las bstan to //
analyzed: rang gi lhung bzed dang chos gos kyi las bstan to //
translated: the work of one’s own begging bowl and robes is indicated.

original: lhung bzed kyi las bya'o zhe 'am /
analyzed: lhung bzed kyi las bya'o zhe 'am /
translated: “The work of the begging bowl should be done,”

original: tshon gyi las bya'o zhes yid kyis brtag pa gang yin pa de ni dus byin gyis brlab pa yin no //
analyzed: tshon gyi las bya'o zhes yid kyis brtag pa gang yin pa de ni dus byin gyis brlab pa yin no //
translated: or “the work of the robes should be done,” whatever mental consideration there is, that is the blessing of the occasion.

original: yun ring du byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dus zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yun ring du byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dus zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “It should be blessed for a long time” is connected with “the occasion.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag lhung bzed kyi las dang tshon gyi las dag byed pa na yang dang yang brjed ngas pas me la reg nas de dag 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag lhung bzed kyi las dang tshon gyi las dag byed pa na yang dang yang brjed ngas pas me la reg nas de dag 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Here, the text is as follows: When the monks were doing the work of the begging bowl and the work of the robes, they repeatedly touched the fire out of forgetfulness. When they gave rise to regret, the Blessed One said:🔽“Monks, I allow you to bless the occasion for the work of the begging bowl and the work of the robes.”

original: dus yun ring du byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba de 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: dus yun ring du byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba de 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: This is included in the statement, for a long time.

original: ci zhig byas na me'i tha snyad kyi ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig byas na me'i tha snyad kyi ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is done that becomes a downfall of abandoning the training?

original: de'i phyir rtse ba nyid na'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtse ba nyid na'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it says, if one plays with it.

original: de rnam pa gang gis yin zhe na /
analyzed: de rnam pa gang gis yin zhe na /
translated: In what way?

original: rtse ba'i ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir gzhan la gtong bas zla ba dang nyi ma dang mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa byed pas so zhes bya ba @241a * //
analyzed: rtse ba'i ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir gzhan la gtong bas zla ba dang nyi ma dang mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa byed pas so zhes bya ba @241a * //
translated: In order to teach the nature of playing, it says, by throwing it to another, making a circle with the sun or moon, or a circle with fire, and so on.

original: smos so // ci zhig rtse ba la zhe na /
analyzed: smos so // ci zhig rtse ba la zhe na /
translated: What is played with?

original: de'i phyir me'i zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir me'i zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it says, with fire.

original: ci rtse ba 'ba' zhig la ltung ba 'dir 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: ci rtse ba 'ba' zhig la ltung ba 'dir 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Does this downfall occur only for playing?

original: de'i phyir dus byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i dge slong na ba'i dbang nyid du gnas pa ma yin pas reg na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dus byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i dge slong na ba'i dbang nyid du gnas pa ma yin pas reg na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, if one touches it, not being a fully ordained monk who is sick and not being in a situation where there is no other choice.

original: me la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: me la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is connected with with fire.

original: ji ltar reg na zhe na de'i phyir rang ngam bsgo bas so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar reg na zhe na de'i phyir rang ngam bsgo bas so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says, by oneself or by one who is told to do so.

original: ci rtse bas reg pa 'ba' zhig la ltung ba 'dir 'gyur ram zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci rtse bas reg pa 'ba' zhig la ltung ba 'dir 'gyur ram zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Does this downfall apply only to one who touches a fire for fun?🔽The text says,

original: sbar ba dang gsod pa dang reg pa dang ma reg pa'i bud shing bskul ba dang bcas pa 'dren pa dang ma dag ma spung ba dang 'bru ba dag la'o zhes bya ba smos so //🔽dus byin gyis ma brlabs pa'am na ba'i dbang nyid du gnas pa ma yin pa'i rang ngam bsgo bas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽me sbar tam gsod dam mes reg pa'i bud shing bskul tam /🔽mes ma reg pa'i bud shing bskul tam /🔽me dang bcas pa'i bud shing 'dren tam bskul tam /
analyzed: sbar ba dang gsod pa dang reg pa dang ma reg pa'i bud shing bskul ba dang bcas pa 'dren pa dang ma dag ma spung ba dang 'bru ba dag la'o zhes bya ba smos so // dus byin gyis ma brlabs pa'am na ba'i dbang nyid du gnas pa ma yin pa'i rang ngam bsgo bas zhes bya bar sbyar ro // me sbar tam gsod dam mes reg pa'i bud shing bskul tam / mes ma reg pa'i bud shing bskul tam / me dang bcas pa'i bud shing 'dren tam bskul tam /
translated: to one who lights a fire, kills, touches fire, or stirs up unburned or half-burned firewood, or who gathers or scatters firewood.🔽One who is not consecrated, or who is not sick, should not light a fire, or kill, or touch fire, or stir up unburned or half-burned firewood, or gather or scatter firewood, either by oneself or by one who is told to do so.🔽The text says, “to one who lights a fire, kills, or touches fire, or stirs up unburned or half-burned firewood, or gathers or scatters firewood.”

original: ma dag ma sgrungs sam 'bru bar byed pa 'di rnams la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma dag ma sgrungs sam 'bru bar byed pa 'di rnams la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should not light a fire, or kill, or touch fire, or stir up unburned or half-burned firewood, or gather or scatter firewood.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong me sbar bar byed na des dus byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong me sbar bar byed na des dus byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: If a monk lights a fire, he should consecrate it.

original: byin gyi ma brlabs par sbar bar byed na ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: byin gyi ma brlabs par sbar bar byed na ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If he lights a fire without consecrating it, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: sbar tam gsod pa dag la ni 'di yin te /🔽bud shing mes reg pa bskul tam /
analyzed: sbar tam gsod pa dag la ni 'di yin te / bud shing mes reg pa bskul tam /
translated: This is the case for lighting a fire or killing.🔽If he lights a fire that is in contact with kindling,

original: mas ma reg pa'i bud shing bskul tam /
analyzed: mas ma reg pa'i bud shing bskul tam /
translated: or if he lights kindling that is not in contact with fire,

original: me dang bcas shing 'brel pa'i bud shing phyir drangs sam /
analyzed: me dang bcas shing 'brel pa'i bud shing phyir drangs sam /
translated: or if he removes kindling that is in contact with fire,

original: mdag ma dag spungs sam de bzhin du mgal bar skul bar byed dam /
analyzed: mdag ma dag spungs sam de bzhin du mgal bar skul bar byed dam /
translated: or if he piles up embers, or similarly lights a fire in a pan,

original: mgal ba 'dren par byed dam /
analyzed: mgal ba 'dren par byed dam /
translated: or if he lights a fire in a pan,

original: shing 'dzud par byed na thams cad ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shing 'dzud par byed na thams cad ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: or if he puts wood into a fire, in all cases he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: mes ma reg pa'i bud shing bskul tam zhes bya ba gzhan klog pa 'di bud shing bskul bar gyur na ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes smos pa dang / 'dir rang gis bskul ba la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba dang / 'dir gzhan la bsgo ba zhes bya ba mdo'i tshig las rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mes ma reg pa'i bud shing bskul tam zhes bya ba gzhan klog pa 'di bud shing bskul bar gyur na ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes smos pa dang / 'dir rang gis bskul ba la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba dang / 'dir gzhan la bsgo ba zhes bya ba mdo'i tshig las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The reading of another text, if one urges wood that is not burning, means that if one urges wood that is burning, there is an offense. And here, if one urges it oneself, there is no offense, and here, if one orders another, should be understood from the words of the sutra.

original: me ma mur ni phyed shi ba nyid do zhes bya ba nyes byas byed pa po nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: me ma mur ni phyed shi ba nyid do zhes bya ba nyes byas byed pa po nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: A half-dead fire is one that is half-extinguished. The meaning is that the one who does the act is at fault.

original: 'dir gzhung ni me ma mur la reg na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni me ma mur la reg na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text states, If one touches a half-dead fire, there is an offense.

original: me lce dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: me lce dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Also, flames.

original: yang gi sgras ni phyed shi ba nyid ces bya ba'i rjes snyegs pa'i phyir smos so //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni phyed shi ba nyid ces bya ba'i rjes snyegs pa'i phyir smos so //
translated: The word also is stated in order to include the phrase half-dead.

original: 'dir gzhung ni me ma mur la reg na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni me ma mur la reg na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text states, If one touches a half-dead fire, there is an offense.

original: 'dir @241b gang zhig me ma mur dang me lce rnams la der bud shing 'dzud pa dang 'byin pa ni me gzhan gyi nyes pa kho na yin gyi der ci zhig 'dir byas pas nyes byas su rtogs par bya zhes bya ba 'dir ston pa ni der bud
analyzed: 'dir @241b gang zhig me ma mur dang me lce rnams la der bud shing 'dzud pa dang 'byin pa ni me gzhan gyi nyes pa kho na yin gyi der ci zhig 'dir byas pas nyes byas su rtogs par bya zhes bya ba 'dir ston pa ni der bud
translated: Here, the one who puts fuel into the fire of live coals and the one who removes it are only at fault for the other fire, but what is done here should be understood as a fault.

original: shing 'jug pa dang 'byin pa ni me gzhan gyi nyes pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: shing 'jug pa dang 'byin pa ni me gzhan gyi nyes pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Here, the one who puts fuel into the fire and the one who removes it are at fault for the other fire.

original: me gzhan du 'dzud pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: me gzhan du 'dzud pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The other fire is the one that is put in.

original: me ma mur dang me lce'i 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: me ma mur dang me lce'i 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the one that is put into the fire of live coals.

original: de lta bas na de'i dbang gis 'dir ltung ba 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i dbang gis 'dir ltung ba 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it does not fall by the power of that.

original: me gzhan gyi dbang kho nar ltung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: me gzhan gyi dbang kho nar ltung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it falls only by the power of the other fire.

original: 'dir 'dzud pa la ni ltung byed du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'dzud pa la ni ltung byed du shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, it should be understood that putting it in is a downfall.

original: skra dang kha spu dang sen mo dang mchil ma dang snabs dang skyugs pa dang rlugs pa dang / mon sran snge'u dang / mon sran gre'u dang til dang 'bru mar dang sbrang rtsi dang mar dag ni bud shing gi phyed nyid do zhes bya ba smos te /🔽bud shing gi phyed du gyur pa 'di rnams la ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: skra dang kha spu dang sen mo dang mchil ma dang snabs dang skyugs pa dang rlugs pa dang / mon sran snge'u dang / mon sran gre'u dang til dang 'bru mar dang sbrang rtsi dang mar dag ni bud shing gi phyed nyid do zhes bya ba smos te / bud shing gi phyed du gyur pa 'di rnams la ni nyes byas te /
translated: These are half fuel.

original: 'di rnams la ni 'jog pa dang 'don pa dag la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di rnams la ni 'jog pa dang 'don pa dag la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is a minor offense to place these in the fire, but not to remove them.

original: klog pa kha cig las dge slong gis me'i nang du skra dang spu dang rus pa dang sen mo dag 'jug na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: klog pa kha cig las dge slong gis me'i nang du skra dang spu dang rus pa dang sen mo dag 'jug na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Some recitations of the scriptures state that if a monk places hair, beard, bone, or nail in the fire, it is a minor offense.

original: gzhan du na yang me'i nang du mchil ma dang snabs dang skyugs pa dang rlugs pa dag 'dzud na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa dang / zhu ba las kyang btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis til mar dang mon sran sde'u dang / mon sran gre'u zhugs su gsol na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du na yang me'i nang du mchil ma dang snabs dang skyugs pa dang rlugs pa dag 'dzud na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa dang / zhu ba las kyang btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis til mar dang mon sran sde'u dang / mon sran gre'u zhugs su gsol na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: “Venerable One, if a monk requests sesame oil, lentils, and beans, what is his offense?”

original: nyes byas so //
analyzed: nyes byas so //
translated: “It is an offense of wrong conduct.”🔽Some recitations say:

original: klog pa kha cig las btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis mar dang 'bru dang sprang rtsi zhugs su stsol na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: klog pa kha cig las btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis mar dang 'bru dang sprang rtsi zhugs su stsol na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: “Venerable One, if a monk requests butter, grain, and honey, what is his offense?”🔽“It is an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de bzhin du rus pa dang mchil ma bsregs na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rus pa dang mchil ma bsregs na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, if one burns bone and saliva, one commits an offense.

original: de dag ni bsdus nas smras so //
analyzed: de dag ni bsdus nas smras so //
translated: These are stated in summary.

original: de dag kyang dpe tsam du zad de rtsva dang shing dang ras pa la dang bal du gyur pa yang de dang 'dra bar bcas pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: de dag kyang dpe tsam du zad de rtsva dang shing dang ras pa la dang bal du gyur pa yang de dang 'dra bar bcas pa'i chos can no //
translated: These are merely examples. Grass, wood, cloth, cotton, and wool are also similar. They are subject to the precepts.

original: gzhan gyi bya ba gzhan la byin gyis rlob pa ni phyed byin gyis brlabs pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bya ba gzhan la byin gyis rlob pa ni phyed byin gyis brlabs pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The blessing of another’s action by another is half a blessing.

original: 'di ni don ji lta bar byin gyis brlab par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni don ji lta bar byin gyis brlab par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: This is not a blessing as it is intended.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni na smad pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni na smad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is reprehensible.🔽In some texts, it says:

original: 'dir gzhung la la dag las ni 'di skad ces dge slong gis mkhan po'i bya ba la me la reg cing slob dpon la byin gyis rlob par byed na nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung la la dag las ni 'di skad ces dge slong gis mkhan po'i bya ba la me la reg cing slob dpon la byin gyis rlob par byed na nyes byas so //
translated: If a monk touches the fire for the preceptor’s action and blesses the master, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: chos kyi bya bas dge 'dun la byin gyis rlob par byed na nyes byas so //
analyzed: chos kyi bya bas dge 'dun la byin gyis rlob par byed na nyes byas so //
translated: If he blesses the saṅgha with a Dharma action, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: thams cad phyin ci log tu @242a * //
analyzed: thams cad phyin ci log tu @242a * //
translated: If he blesses everything in the opposite way,

original: byin gyis rlob par byed na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: byin gyis rlob par byed na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: me la reg pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: me la reg pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: The downfall of touching fire

original: // / ci zhig byas na dad pa phyir bsgyur ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / ci zhig byas na dad pa phyir bsgyur ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the downfall of turning away from faith?

original: de'i phyir dge slong gi don gyi ched kyi las byas pa la dad pa phul ba'i phyir bsgyur ba'i phyir smras na'o zhes bya ba smos ste ;
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong gi don gyi ched kyi las byas pa la dad pa phul ba'i phyir bsgyur ba'i phyir smras na'o zhes bya ba smos ste ;
translated: Therefore, it is said that “it is for the purpose of returning the faith that was offered for the purpose of a monk’s work.”

original: dge slong dang 'brel pa'i don gyis dgos pa gang yin pa de ni dge slong gi don to //
analyzed: dge slong dang 'brel pa'i don gyis dgos pa gang yin pa de ni dge slong gi don to //
translated: The purpose that is related to a monk is the purpose of a monk.

original: don de'i phyir las byas pa gang yin pa de ni dge slong gi don ched do //
analyzed: don de'i phyir las byas pa gang yin pa de ni dge slong gi don ched do //
translated: The work that is done for that purpose is for the purpose of a monk.

original: don gyi ched de la gsol ba dang brjod pa dang dgag dbye dang bsgo ba'i bdag nyid kyis las byas pa gang yin pa de don gyi ched kyi las so //
analyzed: don gyi ched de la gsol ba dang brjod pa dang dgag dbye dang bsgo ba'i bdag nyid kyis las byas pa gang yin pa de don gyi ched kyi las so //
translated: The work that is done for that purpose by means of a proposal, a proclamation, a lifting of restrictions, or an instruction is work for the purpose of a monk.

original: las de byas pa la zhes bya ba ni byas zin pa la'o //
analyzed: las de byas pa la zhes bya ba ni byas zin pa la'o //
translated: “For the purpose of a monk’s work” means for the purpose of work that has been done.

original: las byas pa de la dad pa phul ba phyir bsgyur ba'i phyir smras pa ni dge slong dad pa slar byin cig /
analyzed: las byas pa de la dad pa phul ba phyir bsgyur ba'i phyir smras pa ni dge slong dad pa slar byin cig /
translated: “For the purpose of returning the faith that was offered” means that a monk says, “Give me back my faith.”

original: khyod la mi sbyin no zhes de skad zer zhing phyir 'phrog pa ste /
analyzed: khyod la mi sbyin no zhes de skad zer zhing phyir 'phrog pa ste /
translated: “I will not give it to you,” and he takes it back.

original: de bas na dad pa phyir bsgyur ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽tshogs pa 'di 'jig pa dge 'dun 'byed pa zhes bya ba'i kha na ma tho ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na dad pa phyir bsgyur ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to // tshogs pa 'di 'jig pa dge 'dun 'byed pa zhes bya ba'i kha na ma tho ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that it is a downfall that is a degeneration of faith.

original: dad pa phyir bsgyur ba'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: dad pa phyir bsgyur ba'i ltung byed do /
translated: This is the downfall called “splitting the Saṅgha,” which is a downfall that is a degeneration of faith.

original: // / zla ba dang nyi ma ma gtogs pa'i snang ba dang bcas pa'i gnas kyi phyogs su nyal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: // / zla ba dang nyi ma ma gtogs pa'i snang ba dang bcas pa'i gnas kyi phyogs su nyal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not sleep in a place that is illuminated except in the case of the moon and the sun.

original: zla ba dang nyi ma dag ma gtogs pa'i snang ba zla ba dang nyi ma dag las gzhan pa'i snang ba khyim gyi phyogs gang na yod pa der ro //
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma dag ma gtogs pa'i snang ba zla ba dang nyi ma dag las gzhan pa'i snang ba khyim gyi phyogs gang na yod pa der ro //
translated: Except for the moon and the sun, one should not sleep in a place that is illuminated by any other light, such as a lamp.

original: khyim de ni der gang zhig slar bkab pa dang yongs su bskor ba khyim gyi tha mar zhes bya ba 'di 'jug pas khyim 'di'i ngo bo rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khyim de ni der gang zhig slar bkab pa dang yongs su bskor ba khyim gyi tha mar zhes bya ba 'di 'jug pas khyim 'di'i ngo bo rig par bya'o //
translated: The term “house” here should be understood as referring to a house that is covered and surrounded.

original: 'di phyogs kyi tshig ni phyogs gang na snang ba med pa der nyal ba la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: 'di phyogs kyi tshig ni phyogs gang na snang ba med pa der nyal ba la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: The term “place” indicates that there is no fault if one sleeps in a place that is not illuminated.

original: phyogs de las gzhan du ni ltung ba med ces bya ba'i don 'di bsgrub pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: phyogs de las gzhan du ni ltung ba med ces bya ba'i don 'di bsgrub pa'i don du'o //
translated: The meaning of the verse is to establish that there is no offense in any other position.

original: 'o na 'di ltar snang ba dang bcas pa nyid la phyogs gcig tu snang ba dang bral ba'i phyogs la snang du rung ba nyid yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'di ltar snang ba dang bcas pa nyid la phyogs gcig tu snang ba dang bral ba'i phyogs la snang du rung ba nyid yod do zhe na /
translated: But if it is proper to see in a position that is not the proper position, then it is proper to see in a position that is not the proper position.

original: bden mod kyi 'on kyang 'di ni longs spyod can gyi yo lang spang ba'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: bden mod kyi 'on kyang 'di ni longs spyod can gyi yo lang spang ba'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: This is true, but this is in order to avoid the enjoyment of the pleasure of sex.

original: lta ba'i phyir bkag pa ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: lta ba'i phyir bkag pa ni ma yin no ;
translated: It is not a prohibition for the purpose of seeing.

original: /'dir gleng gzhi ni gtso bo ma yin te /
analyzed: /'dir gleng gzhi ni gtso bo ma yin te /
translated: Here, the nidana is not primary,

original: zla ba dang nyi ma dag las spang ba ma yin pa nyid brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma dag las spang ba ma yin pa nyid brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is stated that there is no prohibition regarding the moon and sun.

original: nyal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyid log pa las 'da' bar bya ste /
analyzed: nyal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyid log pa las 'da' bar bya ste /
translated: One should not sleep means one should not pass beyond sleep.

original: de nyal na mtshan mo'i mthar ni dngos gzhir 'gyur ba'i nyes byas so //
analyzed: de nyal na mtshan mo'i mthar ni dngos gzhir 'gyur ba'i nyes byas so //
translated: If one sleeps, there is an offense that is the actual basis at the end of the night.

original: mdun rol du ni sbyor bar 'gyur ba'i @242b zhes bya ba 'di 'dir rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mdun rol du ni sbyor bar 'gyur ba'i @242b zhes bya ba 'di 'dir rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that in the future there will be a preparation.

original: ci rnam pa thams cad nyid kyis de lta yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci rnam pa thams cad nyid kyis de lta yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it always so?

original: de'i phyir nad pa dang / nad g-yog gi dbang nyid ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nad pa dang / nad g-yog gi dbang nyid ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore he says, “except when there is a reason of illness or a reason of a companion.”

original: nad pa'i dbang nyid dang nad g-yog gi dbang nyid kyis der nyal ba ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: nad pa'i dbang nyid dang nad g-yog gi dbang nyid kyis der nyal ba ni ma gtogs so //
translated: Except when there is a reason of illness or a reason of a companion, it is not permitted to sleep there.🔽Here, some say that it is a thullaccaya offense.

original: 'di la kha cig ni ltung byed ce'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir snang ba dang bcas pa'i khyim gyi phyogs su nyal ba 'di la 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig ni ltung byed du 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di la kha cig ni ltung byed ce'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir snang ba dang bcas pa'i khyim gyi phyogs su nyal ba 'di la 'dul ba 'dzin pa kha cig ni ltung byed du 'dod do //
translated: In this case, some Vinaya experts consider it a thullaccaya offense to sleep in a house where there is light.

original: de ni mi rigs te bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig tu nyal na zhes smos ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig tu nyal na zhes smos ba yin te /
translated: That is not correct, because it says, “if he sleeps together with one who is not fully admitted to the order.”

original: de bas na dge slong gis snang ba dang bcas pa'i gnas su bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nyal bar mi bya'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du rtsig pa'i bar dang de bzhin du shing drung dag tu zhes bya ba ni dpe tsam du rig par bya'o //
