original: nyid de shing gi rtsa ba gcig pur ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyid de shing gi rtsa ba gcig pur ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not just at the root of a tree.

original: kun nas yongs su bskor ba la yang ma g-yogs pa dang gsang bar gyur pa gzhan dag kyang 'dir 'phangs par rig par bya'i //
analyzed: kun nas yongs su bskor ba la yang ma g-yogs pa dang gsang bar gyur pa gzhan dag kyang 'dir 'phangs par rig par bya'i //
translated: It should be understood that in the case of a complete enclosure, there is an offense if they are not covered and are in a concealed place.

original: nye 'khor dang bcas pa gnas pa tsam las gzhan tha dad par gyur pa lhag par gnas pa la ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye 'khor dang bcas pa gnas pa tsam las gzhan tha dad par gyur pa lhag par gnas pa la ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is not the case that it is the special state of abiding that is separate from the mere state of abiding together with its surrounding area.

original: de bud med dang lhan cig nyal ba la dmigs kyis bsal ba'i bye brag gang zhig bstan pa'i phyir 'di la ni bya gag 'phur nas bab pa'i lam gyis bar du chod par gyur pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de bud med dang lhan cig nyal ba la dmigs kyis bsal ba'i bye brag gang zhig bstan pa'i phyir 'di la ni bya gag 'phur nas bab pa'i lam gyis bar du chod par gyur pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to teach the specific exception to this rule, the line, “Here, it is the path of a flying bird that is obstructed” is stated.

original: bya gag 'phur nas bab pa'i bar gyi lam gang yin pa de la /
analyzed: bya gag 'phur nas bab pa'i bar gyi lam gang yin pa de la /
translated: The path of a flying bird is the path of a bird flying through the sky.

original: 'dir bud med dang lhan cig bar du chod par gyur pa nyid do //🔽nye 'khor dang bcas nas gnas khang tsam gyi pha rol na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bud med dang lhan cig bar du chod par gyur pa nyid do // nye 'khor dang bcas nas gnas khang tsam gyi pha rol na ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, the path of a flying bird is obstructed by a woman.🔽It is not the case that the path of a flying bird is obstructed by the surrounding area of the dwelling.

original: de tsam gyi bar chad kyis bar du chod pa med pa dang bar du chod pa la bar du mi rgyu ba'i dbang gis gnas gcig pa nyid du brten pa yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyi bar chad kyis bar du chod pa med pa dang bar du chod pa la bar du mi rgyu ba'i dbang gis gnas gcig pa nyid du brten pa yin no //
translated: The path of a flying bird is not obstructed by the mere dwelling. It is obstructed by the surrounding area of the dwelling.🔽The path of a flying bird is obstructed by the surrounding area of the dwelling because the bird does not travel through that area.

original: tha dad par gyur ba nyid du lhag par gnas pa tha dad par gnas pa nyid ces bya ba 'di la 'di ni byed pa po'o //
analyzed: tha dad par gyur ba nyid du lhag par gnas pa tha dad par gnas pa nyid ces bya ba 'di la 'di ni byed pa po'o //
translated: The state of being situated as different is called the state of being situated as separate.🔽In the case of the inner, there is no other place in between, and the covering is the same.

original: nang du gcig tu rgyu zhing bar na gnas gzhan med pa ma yin pa nyid la ni g-yogs pa thams cad gcig pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni bar na gnas gzhan med pa @244b g-yogs pa gang yin pa de ni bar na gnas gzhan med pa
analyzed: nang du gcig tu rgyu zhing bar na gnas gzhan med pa ma yin pa nyid la ni g-yogs pa thams cad gcig pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni bar na gnas gzhan med pa @244b g-yogs pa gang yin pa de ni bar na gnas gzhan med pa
translated: That which is the covering without another place in between is the state of being without another place in between.

original: nyid do // gnas med par gyur pa'i bar dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyid do // gnas med par gyur pa'i bar dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: being without a place, it is free from an interval.

original: 'di'i gang slar g-yogs shing yongs su bskor ba'i mthar thug pa nye 'khor du gyur pa ma yin pa'i gnas gzhan thams cad la gnas tha dad pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i gang slar g-yogs shing yongs su bskor ba'i mthar thug pa nye 'khor du gyur pa ma yin pa'i gnas gzhan thams cad la gnas tha dad pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: All the other places that are not the end of the covering and surrounding are not different places.

original: rgyu ba'i go skabs gang 'di la gnas pa nyid du byed pa'i nye 'khor dang ldan pa la phal cher la g-yogs pa nyid kyis gnas gzhan ma yin pa nye bar med pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu ba'i go skabs gang 'di la gnas pa nyid du byed pa'i nye 'khor dang ldan pa la phal cher la g-yogs pa nyid kyis gnas gzhan ma yin pa nye bar med pa nyid do //
translated: The opportunity for movement is the space that is occupied by the surrounding area. For the most part, it is covered by the non-separation of the other place.

original: gnas ma yin par gyur pa'i bar gyi de la nang du rgyu ba 'di yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas ma yin par gyur pa'i bar gyi de la nang du rgyu ba 'di yod pa yin te /
translated: This is the movement within the space that is not occupied.

original: 'byung ba nyid kyis ni go skabs de 'dir 'jug pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba nyid kyis ni go skabs de 'dir 'jug pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the opportunity is entered into by the elements themselves.

original: de dang lhan cig tu gnas pa nyid de dang lhan cig tu gang gi phyir de brjod pa thams cad la gnas ma yin par gyur pa nyid la rgyu ba'i lam pa la'o //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig tu gnas pa nyid de dang lhan cig tu gang gi phyir de brjod pa thams cad la gnas ma yin par gyur pa nyid la rgyu ba'i lam pa la'o //
translated: The non-separation of the place that is occupied together with that is the path of movement for all expressions of that.

original: gal te ma yin na 'di la g-yogs pa nyid la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gal te ma yin na 'di la g-yogs pa nyid la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: If it is not so, then there is no downfall in the covering of this.

original: gal te g-yogs pa nyid yin na nyes byas su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te g-yogs pa nyid yin na nyes byas su rig par bya'o //
translated: If it is the covering, then it should be understood as a minor offense.

original: khyams ngos bzhi dang gsum pa dag la nor dag la bar chod dang bcas pa nyid kyis nyes byas su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khyams ngos bzhi dang gsum pa dag la nor dag la bar chod dang bcas pa nyid kyis nyes byas su rig par bya'o //
translated: In the four sides and the third part of the courtyard, it should be understood as a minor offense due to the separation.

original: rang gi char gtogs pa'i sgo bcad pa la ni nye 'khor yang tha dad pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni ltung ba 'byin pa po'i char gtogs pa'i sgo gang yin pa bcad pas bcad pa nyid kyi sgo dang nye 'khor la yang 'dir bud med dang lhan
analyzed: rang gi char gtogs pa'i sgo bcad pa la ni nye 'khor yang tha dad pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni ltung ba 'byin pa po'i char gtogs pa'i sgo gang yin pa bcad pas bcad pa nyid kyi sgo dang nye 'khor la yang 'dir bud med dang lhan
translated: The door and its vicinity are separate for one who is included in the boundary of the one who commits the downfall.

original: cig tu nya ba la tha dad pa nyid do //
analyzed: cig tu nya ba la tha dad pa nyid do //
translated: In this case, a monk and a woman are separate in the vicinity of the door.

original: khang bzangs kyi phyogs kyi gzhan la gnas khang gzhan sgo khang dang bar rim pa rnams la gong rim nyid du smos dgos so //
analyzed: khang bzangs kyi phyogs kyi gzhan la gnas khang gzhan sgo khang dang bar rim pa rnams la gong rim nyid du smos dgos so //
translated: In a mansion, the other rooms on the other sides, the door, and the corridors are called the upper and lower stories.

original: ltung ba 'byin par byed pa dge slong gis bsrungs pa nyid ni de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni ltung ba 'byin par byed pa dge slong gis bsrungs pa nyid dang / bud med kyi tshigs kyang bdag pos bsrungs ba nyid do //
analyzed: ltung ba 'byin par byed pa dge slong gis bsrungs pa nyid ni de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni ltung ba 'byin par byed pa dge slong gis bsrungs pa nyid dang / bud med kyi tshigs kyang bdag pos bsrungs ba nyid do //
translated: The monk who commits the downfall is protected, just like the woman.

original: 'dir bud med dang lhan cig tu nyal ba gang yin pa de rang gi char gtogs pa'i sgo bcad pas bcad pa zhes bstan pa gang yin pa de ni de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir bud med dang lhan cig tu nyal ba gang yin pa de rang gi char gtogs pa'i sgo bcad pas bcad pa zhes bstan pa gang yin pa de ni de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Here, “sleeping together with a woman” means that the door is closed by the one who belongs there. This should be understood as it is taught.

original: 'di yang nye bar spyod pa la sogs pa rnams la tha dad ba nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di yang nye bar spyod pa la sogs pa rnams la tha dad ba nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This also means that there is a difference in the case of using a bed and so on.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong bar rim kha na rtag tu nyal bar byed cing bud med sgo khang na nyal na /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong bar rim kha na rtag tu nyal bar byed cing bud med sgo khang na nyal na /
translated: Here, the text is as follows: A monk always sleeps in a place where there is a woman sleeping in the doorway.

original: dge slong des phyi sgo gcad par bya ba'am dge slong srung ma gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong des phyi sgo gcad par bya ba'am dge slong srung ma gzhag par bya'o //
translated: That monk should close the outer door or place a monk as a guard.

original: phyi sgo gcod par mi byed dam dge slong srung ma 'jog par mi byed par gsol phab ste gnyid log par byed @245a * //
analyzed: phyi sgo gcod par mi byed dam dge slong srung ma 'jog par mi byed par gsol phab ste gnyid log par byed @245a * //
translated: If he does not close the outer door or place a monk as a guard, and goes to sleep after being served food,

original: na ji srid du skya re ngas ma shar gyi bar du ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: na ji srid du skya re ngas ma shar gyi bar du ni nyes byas so //
translated: as long as the dawn has not broken, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: skya rengs shar nas ni ltung byed do //
analyzed: skya rengs shar nas ni ltung byed do //
translated: When the dawn has broken, it is a pāyantika.

original: bdag pos bsrungs par gyur na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba 'di yang sungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag pos bsrungs par gyur na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba 'di yang sungs pa yin no //
translated: If the woman is guarded by her master, there is no offense.

original: gnas tha dad pa nyid la ni bdag pos bsrungs pa nyid la ltung ba med pa yin no //🔽gnas gcig pa nyid la ni bdag pos bsrungs pa nyid la yang spyod pa las byung ba'i cha dad /
analyzed: gnas tha dad pa nyid la ni bdag pos bsrungs pa nyid la ltung ba med pa yin no // gnas gcig pa nyid la ni bdag pos bsrungs pa nyid la yang spyod pa las byung ba'i cha dad /
translated: If the woman is in a different location, there is no offense if she is guarded by her master.🔽If she is in the same location, there is no offense if she is guarded by her master, and if she is a woman who is a companion of a guard, who prevents her from sitting together with a man.

original: lhan cig tu bud med la sogs pa dang 'dug pa'i gegs byed pa'i bud med dang 'brel pa'i srung ma nyid la yang ltung ba med pa yin pas de'i phyir 'dir bdag pos bsrungs pa nyid ni de bzhin du 'dir ltung bas go bar byed pa'i blo la
analyzed: lhan cig tu bud med la sogs pa dang 'dug pa'i gegs byed pa'i bud med dang 'brel pa'i srung ma nyid la yang ltung ba med pa yin pas de'i phyir 'dir bdag pos bsrungs pa nyid ni de bzhin du 'dir ltung bas go bar byed pa'i blo la
translated: Therefore, in this case, the phrase “guarded by her master” is not understood as a basis for an offense.

original: skabs med do //
analyzed: skabs med do //
translated: There is no opportunity for that.

original: de bas na 'dir yang gnas tha dad pa nyid la bdag pos bsrungs pa nyid la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir yang gnas tha dad pa nyid la bdag pos bsrungs pa nyid la ltung ba med do //
translated: Therefore, in this case, there is no offense if the woman is in a different location and guarded by her master.

original: 'dir bdag pos zhes smos pa ni dpe tsam du zad do //
analyzed: 'dir bdag pos zhes smos pa ni dpe tsam du zad do //
translated: The phrase “guarded by her master” is merely an example.

original: rim khang gzhan la ni skas steng du btul ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rim khang gzhan la ni skas steng du btul ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In other rooms, it is only on the stairs.

original: rim khang gi khyer gzhan la ni skas steng du brtul ba nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: rim khang gi khyer gzhan la ni skas steng du brtul ba nyid kyang ngo //
translated: In other rooms, it is only on the stairs.

original: rang gi char gtogs pa'i sgo bcad pas bcad pa dang 'dra bar ltung ba 'byin pa po dge slong gis bsrungs pa nyid gcig pur ma zad de /
analyzed: rang gi char gtogs pa'i sgo bcad pas bcad pa dang 'dra bar ltung ba 'byin pa po dge slong gis bsrungs pa nyid gcig pur ma zad de /
translated: Just as one is restrained by closing the door belonging to oneself, so too, the monk who commits the offense is restrained by the restraint of the Saṅgha alone, not just by his own restraint.

original: tshogs la bsrungs pa nyid kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshogs la bsrungs pa nyid kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is restrained by the restraint of the Saṅgha.

original: gzhan gnas ma yin pa nyid pa nyid la ni na smad do zhes bya ba ni nye 'khor la sogs pa las gzhan du gyur pa gang yin pa 'dir zhugs pa nyid kyis 'dir brtsams pa ni gnas med pa nyid la 'dir na smad pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gnas ma yin pa nyid pa nyid la ni na smad do zhes bya ba ni nye 'khor la sogs pa las gzhan du gyur pa gang yin pa 'dir zhugs pa nyid kyis 'dir brtsams pa ni gnas med pa nyid la 'dir na smad pa ste /
translated: If it is not the proper place, it is censured. If it is somewhere other than the vicinity and so on, it is censured here for being in an improper place,

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa ni ma yin no //🔽'dir gnas su gyur pa nyid la ni nyes byas yongs su rdzogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa ni ma yin no // 'dir gnas su gyur pa nyid la ni nyes byas yongs su rdzogs pa nyid do //
translated: but not for being without fault.🔽If it is the proper place, the complete offense is committed.

original: gzhan la nyes byas par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la nyes byas par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If it is somewhere else, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ci zhig byas na bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig byas na bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the offense entailing suspension for sleeping in the same sleeping place as someone who is not fully ordained?

original: de'i phyir bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig tu mtshan mo gsum pa la nyal na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig tu mtshan mo gsum pa la nyal na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “If one sleeps for a third night with someone who is not fully ordained.”

original: 'gal zla gnyid ma log pa la de dang lhan cig tu nyal ba bsgrub pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gal zla gnyid ma log pa la de dang lhan cig tu nyal ba bsgrub pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not established that one sleeps with someone who is not fully ordained if one is not asleep.

original: de bas na de dang lhan cig gnyid log pa la ni gnyid kyi kha na ma thob nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //🔽gcig la ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: de bas na de dang lhan cig gnyid log pa la ni gnyid kyi kha na ma thob nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir ro // gcig la ni nyes byas so //
translated: Therefore, in order to establish that sleeping with someone who is not fully ordained is a downfall due to sleep,🔽one offense of wrong conduct is for the fully ordained monk,

original: spyod lam ni gzhan gyi 'dir ltung byed du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: spyod lam ni gzhan gyi 'dir ltung byed du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: and one offense entailing suspension is for the other.

original: gnyid ma log pa la gcig tu bsgrub pa nyid kyis 'di lta bur gyur pa gang la gzhan dang 'dra ba lhan cig nyal ba la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gnyid ma log pa la gcig tu bsgrub pa nyid kyis 'di lta bur gyur pa gang la gzhan dang 'dra ba lhan cig nyal ba la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: Since it is established that one sleeps with someone who is not fully ordained if one is asleep, there is no offense if one sleeps with someone who is not fully ordained in this way, but who is similar to the other.

original: kha cig ni gzhan du yang dge slong gnyid log pa nyid la ltung ba @245b med do zhes 'dod pa de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: kha cig ni gzhan du yang dge slong gnyid log pa nyid la ltung ba @245b med do zhes 'dod pa de ni mi rigs te /
translated: Some assert that there is no offense for a monk who falls asleep elsewhere.

original: 'dug pa la ni skyon med pa'i phyir dang nyams pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dug pa la ni skyon med pa'i phyir dang nyams pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: That is illogical, because there is no fault in sitting and because there is no degeneration.

original: de bas na 'dug pa la bsgrub pas so //
analyzed: de bas na 'dug pa la bsgrub pas so //
translated: Therefore, it is established that there is an offense for one who is sitting.

original: mtshan mo'i dus la ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan mo'i dus la ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one asks, “Is there an offense at the time of night?”

original: de'i phyir mthar ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthar ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “at the end.”

original: skad cig gang gi mjug thogs su skye rengs 'char ba der ro zhes bya ba'i don to ;🔽/'dir gzhung ni gnas bzhi po dag tu skya rengs 'char bar byed cing /
analyzed: skad cig gang gi mjug thogs su skye rengs 'char ba der ro zhes bya ba'i don to ; /'dir gzhung ni gnas bzhi po dag tu skya rengs 'char bar byed cing /
translated: The meaning is that it is at the end of the moment when the sun rises.🔽Here, the treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:

original: skya rengs na ltung byed du 'gyur ba kho nar gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: skya rengs na ltung byed du 'gyur ba kho nar gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “There is an offense at the end of the four periods when the sun rises.

original: gang zhig ji ltar mthar ro zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: gang zhig ji ltar mthar ro zhes brjod ce na /
translated: If one asks, “Why is it said that it is at the end?”

original: nyes pa med de /
analyzed: nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault,

original: de'i phyir sgo nas 'di bstan par nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgo nas 'di bstan par nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible to teach this through the door of the end.

original: mdun rol du ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni mtha' ma las mdun rol du gsum du gtogs pa'i gnyid log pa la ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: mdun rol du ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni mtha' ma las mdun rol du gsum du gtogs pa'i gnyid log pa la ni nyes byas so //
translated: In front, there is an offense. In front of the end, there is an offense for falling asleep in the three divisions.

original: nyin mo tha dad nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: nyin mo tha dad nyid kyang ngo //
translated: And also during the day, there is a separate offense.

original: de bas na gzhan du gzhag gzhan la nyes byas bskyed pa zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gzhan du gzhag gzhan la nyes byas bskyed pa zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that there is an offense for causing another to fall asleep.

original: lam gyis du ba par mya ba la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni mdun rol du ni gnyid log pa la nyes pa med pa nyid la 'dir bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: lam gyis du ba par mya ba la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni mdun rol du ni gnyid log pa la nyes pa med pa nyid la 'dir bsgrub pa'o //
translated: There is no offense if one is going along a road and falls asleep. This is the establishment of the non-offense for falling asleep in front.

original: gal te bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa med pa'i gnas rnyed pa med na mthar ni nyes pa kho nar 'gyur zhes shugs kyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa med pa'i gnas rnyed pa med na mthar ni nyes pa kho nar 'gyur zhes shugs kyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: If one does not find a place to stay where there are no fully ordained monks, one should understand by implication that there is an offense in the end.

original: mthar yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar yang des mdun rol du gnyid log pa tsam byas su zin kyang des dub ba la mthar yang gnyid log pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: mthar yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar yang des mdun rol du gnyid log pa tsam byas su zin kyang des dub ba la mthar yang gnyid log pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: In the end, it is the same. Even if one merely falls asleep in front in that way, there is no offense for falling asleep in the end due to exhaustion.

original: dge slong gis byar mi rung ba yod na de sgrub par byed pa dang lhan cig pa'i nad g-yog la yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong gis byar mi rung ba yod na de sgrub par byed pa dang lhan cig pa'i nad g-yog la yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If a monk is not permitted to do something, there is no offense for one who is doing it, or for a nurse, if he sleeps together with him.

original: dge slong gis byar mi rung ba byin pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de sgrub par byed pa'i phyir gang zhig der 'dzin par byed par gyur pa de yang lhan cig tu nyal ba la mdun rol dang mthar yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong gis byar mi rung ba byin pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de sgrub par byed pa'i phyir gang zhig der 'dzin par byed par gyur pa de yang lhan cig tu nyal ba la mdun rol dang mthar yang nyes pa med do //
translated: If a monk is not permitted to give something, and so on, there is no offense for one who is doing it, or for one who is holding it, if he sleeps together with him, either before or after.

original: der nad pa dang nad g-yog la nyes pa med pa kho na yin gyi gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: der nad pa dang nad g-yog la nyes pa med pa kho na yin gyi gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: Only the sick person and the nurse are without offense, not others.

original: dge tshul dang yang ngo zhes bya ba ni dge tshul dang lhan cig nyal ba la mdun rol du mthar yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dge tshul dang yang ngo zhes bya ba ni dge tshul dang lhan cig nyal ba la mdun rol du mthar yang nyes pa med do //
translated: Also, a novice monk. There is no offense for a novice monk if he sleeps together with him, either before or after.

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: With whom?

original: de'i phyir de dang ldan pa la'o zhes bya ba smos ta /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dang ldan pa la'o zhes bya ba smos ta /
translated: Therefore, it says, “if he has that.”

original: dge tshul dang ldan pa la'o //
analyzed: dge tshul dang ldan pa la'o //
translated: If he has a novice monk.

original: gnas skabs gang gi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: gnas skabs gang gi tshe zhe na /
translated: In what circumstances?

original: de'i phyir dge slong sdig can nye bar gyur pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong sdig can nye bar gyur pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “when a sinful bhikṣu is nearby.”

original: ci de dang ldan pa thams cad la'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci de dang ldan pa thams cad la'am zhe na /
translated: Is it in all those who possess it?

original: de'i phyir de spyug pa la 'bad pa byas sam byed pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de spyug pa la 'bad pa byas sam byed pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “when one is making an effort to expel him or has made an effort.”

original: gang gis dge @246a * //
analyzed: gang gis dge @246a * //
translated: By whom is the sinful bhikṣu expelled?

original: slong sdig can de spyug pa'i phyir 'bad pa sdar byas pa'am byed cing de las te /
analyzed: slong sdig can de spyug pa'i phyir 'bad pa sdar byas pa'am byed cing de las te /
translated: By one who has made or is making an effort to expel that sinful bhikṣu.

original: gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not from another.

original: brtson 'grus ji snyed pa byed pa'i phyir nus pa nyid de snyed pa'i 'bad pa la der brtson pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ji snyed pa byed pa'i phyir nus pa nyid de snyed pa'i 'bad pa la der brtson pa'o //
translated: The effort is the exertion to the extent of the effort.

original: des mngon par 'du byas pa'i sems kyis 'jigs pa dag las brtsams te /
analyzed: des mngon par 'du byas pa'i sems kyis 'jigs pa dag las brtsams te /
translated: The mind that is formed by that begins with fear.

original: lus sam ngag gis ldog pa nyid la 'dir 'bad pa ma byas pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lus sam ngag gis ldog pa nyid la 'dir 'bad pa ma byas pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: The body or speech turns away from that. The effort is not not making an effort here.

original: ci dus gang yang rung ba la nyes pa med pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci dus gang yang rung ba la nyes pa med pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is there no fault in any time?

original: de'i phyir gnas par khas blangs na dus phyi ma dang snga ma'i gnyis pa dag la bab pa na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas par khas blangs na dus phyi ma dang snga ma'i gnyis pa dag la bab pa na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, if one accepts that one should stay, then one should stay in the latter and former two months.

original: phyi mar khas blangs pa'i dus su gyur pa snga ma'i gnyis po dag ni dbyar zla tha chungs nya nas ston zla ra ba'i nya'i bar du khas blangs pa snga ma dang phyi ma la gnas par gyur pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyi mar khas blangs pa'i dus su gyur pa snga ma'i gnyis po dag ni dbyar zla tha chungs nya nas ston zla ra ba'i nya'i bar du khas blangs pa snga ma dang phyi ma la gnas par gyur pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The former two months that are accepted in the latter time are the latter and former months that are accepted from the full moon of Āṣāḍha to the full moon of Āgrahāyaṇī. The meaning is that one should stay in the latter and former months.

original: des lhag par gnas par mi bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des lhag par gnas par mi bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not stay beyond that.

original: des zhes bya ba ni dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa la zla ba gnyis las lhag par gnas par mi bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa la zla ba gnyis las lhag par gnas par mi bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: That means that one should not stay beyond two months in the rainy season retreat that one has accepted.

original: phyi mar khas blangs pa la da ltar byung ba'i phyir 'di'o //
analyzed: phyi mar khas blangs pa la da ltar byung ba'i phyir 'di'o //
translated: Since it is present in the latter time that is accepted, it is this.

original: gnas par khas blangs pa snga ma shos mi bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni des zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas par khas blangs pa snga ma shos mi bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni des zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should not stay beyond the former time that is accepted for the rainy season retreat. One should not stay beyond that is to be connected with that.

original: snga ma mi bsrung bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni zla ba gnyis po dag gi snga rol du khas blangs pa snga ma shos mi bsrung bar bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: snga ma mi bsrung bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni zla ba gnyis po dag gi snga rol du khas blangs pa snga ma shos mi bsrung bar bya ba nyid do //
translated: The former is the one that was accepted before the two months.

original: de dge tshul nye bar ma bzhag pa gzhag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dge tshul nye bar ma bzhag pa gzhag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The novice monk should not be placed in a position where he is not placed.

original: des zhes bya ba ni dge slong sdig can gnas par gyur pa'i gnas la gnas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni dge slong sdig can gnas par gyur pa'i gnas la gnas par gyur pa'o //
translated: By him means by the sinful monk who has become a resident in a place that has become a residence.

original: lam du dge tshul gnyid bro bas rmya bar gyur na mdun du btang ste 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: lam du dge tshul gnyid bro bas rmya bar gyur na mdun du btang ste 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: If the novice monk is tired from sleep on the road, he should be sent ahead.

original: gal te bru ba tsha bar gyur na /
analyzed: gal te bru ba tsha bar gyur na /
translated: If he becomes hungry,

original: de la nang bar gyi dus su kha zas sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de la kha zas nang par khye'u sus kyi dus su sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de la nang bar gyi dus su kha zas sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de la kha zas nang par khye'u sus kyi dus su sbyin par bya'o //

original: gal te dro kar yang na de'i tshe yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te dro kar yang na de'i tshe yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is noon, then at that time.

original: gal te dro kar yang bkres par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dro kar yang bkres par gyur na /
translated: If he becomes hungry at noon,

original: de'i tshe yang de la dro zan sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang de la dro zan sbyin par bya'o //
translated: then at that time food should be given to him.

analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung byed do /
translated: It is a downfall to sleep with someone who is not fully ordained.

analyzed: de la smad pa nyid du byas pas mi gtong bar 'gyur na de'i 'og tu phangs par byed par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: 'di ni skrod pas smad pa nyid la rnam par gzhag pa smad pa nyid du byed pa spangs pa nyid du rig par bya'o //

original: lta bar gyur pa mi gtong ba'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa mi gtong ba'i ltung byed do /

analyzed: de'i phyir shes gtso bo zhes bya ba smos te /

translated: One who has not made amends for a downfall is

analyzed: de ltar yang btang ba'i ma bshags pa nyid la kha na ma tho ba 'di mi bskyed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he does not generate this offense in the very non-confession of the abandonment.

original: de lta bas na 'dir ma btang ba nyid ni ma byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir ma btang ba nyid ni ma byas pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, here, the very non-abandonment is the very non-performance.

original: lta ba brten pa mi gtong ba nyid dang ltung byed la ni ma byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: lta ba brten pa mi gtong ba nyid dang ltung byed la ni ma byas pa nyid do //
translated: In the case of the offense of the fixed view and the offense of the downfall, it is the very non-performance.

original: dge slong la'o zhes bya ba ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la gang du yin zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong la'o zhes bya ba ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la gang du yin zhe na /
translated: “To a monk” means to one who has not completed the novitiateship.

original: 'dir rab tu byung ba nyid rnam par gcad pa'i don du khyim pa 'am phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir rab tu byung ba nyid rnam par gcad pa'i don du khyim pa 'am phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba la ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the exclusion is for the purpose of the very ordination; it is not for the householder or for the renunciate of another religion.

original: smon lam dang las 'di dag la yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par gcod pa 'di yang 'dir rnam pa gzhan la ni mi 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir rnam pa gzhan rjes su rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smon lam dang las 'di dag la yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par gcod pa 'di yang 'dir rnam pa gzhan la ni mi 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir rnam pa gzhan rjes su rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This exclusion is also for the purpose of the exclusion of another aspect, because the aspiration and the action are not in the other aspect, and because it is not desired in the other aspect.

original: kun du spyod pa gang la de byed pa po yin zhe na /
analyzed: kun du spyod pa gang la de byed pa po yin zhe na /
translated: In which practice is he the agent of that?

original: de'i phyir lung 'bogs pa dang dmigs kyis dri ba dang / gnas dang rjes su ston pa dang gdams ngag sbyin pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lung 'bogs pa dang dmigs kyis dri ba dang / gnas dang rjes su ston pa dang gdams ngag sbyin pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “expounding the scriptures, questioning, and giving instructions and advice.”

original: 'dir so sor sbyin pa'i sgra las mngon par sbyor bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir so sor sbyin pa'i sgra las mngon par sbyor bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the term “giving” is to be understood as “giving individually.”

original: lta ba smra na'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lta ba smra na'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: “If he speaks about views.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las dge slong gis spangs pa'i drung du lta ba smra na longs spyod las byung ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las dge slong gis spangs pa'i drung du lta ba smra na longs spyod las byung ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text says: “If a bhikṣu speaks about views in the presence of one who has been expelled, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.”

original: zang zing gi longs spyod byed na'o zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed dang chos gos zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhi phyi ma'i tshig go //
analyzed: zang zing gi longs spyod byed na'o zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed dang chos gos zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhi phyi ma'i tshig go //
translated: “If he uses material things” refers to the bowl and robes, etc.

original: 'di la gcig pa nyid kyi phyir 'dug pa nyid dag la 'dir thob pa la bsdus pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'di la gcig pa nyid kyi phyir 'dug pa nyid dag la 'dir thob pa la bsdus pa 'di yin no //
translated: Here, the term “sitting” is included in the term “obtaining.”

original: bsnyen bskur bdag gir byed na'o //
analyzed: bsnyen bskur bdag gir byed na'o //
translated: “If he accepts service.”

original: gnas su lhan cig nyal na yang ngo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gnas su lhan cig nyal na yang ngo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “If he sleeps in the same place as him.”

original: dus nam gyi tshe lhan cig tu nyal zhe na /
analyzed: dus nam gyi tshe lhan cig tu nyal zhe na /
translated: When do they sleep together?

original: de'i phyir mthar ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthar ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, “at the end.”

original: gang gi mthar zhe na de'i phyir mtshan mo'i 'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang gi mthar zhe na de'i phyir mtshan mo'i 'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: At the end of what? Therefore, he says, “at the end of the night.”

original: gnas skabs 'di la 'dug pa 'di'i yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: gnas skabs 'di la 'dug pa 'di'i yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: This is the period when he is completely finished with his activities.

original: gzhan gyis sbrul na yang zhes bya ba ni 'di chos rnam par gtan la dbab pa las rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis sbrul na yang zhes bya ba ni 'di chos rnam par gtan la dbab pa las rtogs pa yin te /
translated: If he is conjured up by another, this is understood from the analysis of the Dharma.

original: 'di dang lhan cig tu nye bar gnas pa'i byed pa po yo byad nye par bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dang lhan cig tu nye bar gnas pa'i byed pa po yo byad nye par bsdu ba'o //
translated: The agent who is present with her is the one who gathers the necessary articles.

original: de dag 'dra ba'i chu dang so shing la sogs pa de dang lhan cig tu 'du 'dzi byed na phyin ci log tu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag 'dra ba'i chu dang so shing la sogs pa de dang lhan cig tu 'du 'dzi byed na phyin ci log tu rig par bya'o //
translated: If he is similar to her in using the water, tooth cleaner, and so on, then he is known as the one who is in error.

original: phebs par smra ba dang smos 'drin dag la der gtogs pa'i gtso bo nyid du byed pa ni 'du 'dzir gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: phebs par smra ba dang smos 'drin dag la der gtogs pa'i gtso bo nyid du byed pa ni 'du 'dzir gyur pa nyid do //
translated: The one who is the chief in that group of intimate friends is known as the one who is in error through intimacy.

original: gzhan dag la ni nyes byas su rtogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la ni nyes byas su rtogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: But if he is with another, it is understood as a minor offense.

original: ci rnam pa thams cad du gzhan gyis sprul pa la yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci rnam pa thams cad du gzhan gyis sprul pa la yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are all emanations created by others?

original: de'i phyir nad dang lta ba dang bral @247b bar 'dod pa'i don gyis ni ma gtogs so zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nad dang lta ba dang bral @247b bar 'dod pa'i don gyis ni ma gtogs so zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, the root text states, “except for the purpose of curing illness and for the purpose of demonstrating the consequences of karma.”

original: nad par gtogs pa de'i don dang lta ba dang bral bar gtogs pa'i don gyis sprul ba gang yin pa de ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nad par gtogs pa de'i don dang lta ba dang bral bar gtogs pa'i don gyis sprul ba gang yin pa de ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that emanations created for the purpose of curing illness and for the purpose of demonstrating the consequences of karma are excluded.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa la ci zhig bsgrub par bya zhe na /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa la ci zhig bsgrub par bya zhe na /
translated: What is accomplished by one who is immoral?

original: de'i phyir blang ba'i rnam par gzhag pa las 'da' bar bya ba zhes bya ba de la kha na ma tho ba rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir blang ba'i rnam par gzhag pa las 'da' bar bya ba zhes bya ba de la kha na ma tho ba rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the root text states, “the transgression of the rules of proper conduct.”

original: de bas na de la tshul khrims 'chal ba'i phyir 'dir 'jug pa thob pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de la tshul khrims 'chal ba'i phyir 'dir 'jug pa thob pa yin no //
translated: Thus, one who is immoral does not obtain entry into this stage.

original: de ltar yang shin tu tshul khrims 'chal ba mkhan po dang slob dpon dag la nye bar gnas par bya ba nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar yang shin tu tshul khrims 'chal ba mkhan po dang slob dpon dag la nye bar gnas par bya ba nyid du gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that even a very immoral person should remain close to spiritual and philosophical teachers.

original: tshul khrims 'chal ba'i lci ba nyid yongs su spong ba'i don du so sor bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ba'i lci ba nyid yongs su spong ba'i don du so sor bskor bar bya'o //
translated: One should turn away from the heavy offense of immorality.

original: spangs pa'i rjes su phyogs pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: spangs pa'i rjes su phyogs pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: This is the downfall through following a rejection.

original: // / de dag la gzham pa dang las kyis mi bsgo bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis gang zhig lta ba dang 'brel pa rnams la cho ga 'di bya ba nyid du bstan pa de ni dge tshul yod par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir 'di la gal te
analyzed: // / de dag la gzham pa dang las kyis mi bsgo bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis gang zhig lta ba dang 'brel pa rnams la cho ga 'di bya ba nyid du bstan pa de ni dge tshul yod par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir 'di la gal te
translated: This is the procedure for those who are connected with views.

original: dge slong gi khongs su sdud na /
analyzed: dge slong gi khongs su sdud na /
translated: If they are included among the monks,

original: de la las kyi mtha' la mi gtong na de'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la las kyi mtha' la mi gtong na de'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: if they are not assigned to work, what should be done?

original: de'i phyir ltos nas brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir ltos nas brjod par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it should be said in dependence on that:

original: tshig de nyid la zhugs pa mi gtong na /
analyzed: tshig de nyid la zhugs pa mi gtong na /
translated: If they are not released from that statement,

original: dge tshul bsnyil bar bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dge tshul bsnyil bar bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: they should be expelled as novices.

original: tshig de nyid zhugs pa de ltar bdag gis ji srid par du gcod pa'i phyir nus pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gang la yod pa de ni tshig de nyid la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: tshig de nyid zhugs pa de ltar bdag gis ji srid par du gcod pa'i phyir nus pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gang la yod pa de ni tshig de nyid la zhugs pa'o //
translated: The phrase that very phrase is the phrase I am not able to do that for as long as I live.

original: de'i dngos po mi gtong na dge tshul de bsnyil bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos po mi gtong na dge tshul de bsnyil bar bya'o //
translated: If he does not give up that view, that novice monk should be expelled.

original: 'dir 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni dpe tsam yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni dpe tsam yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, desire should be understood as merely an example.

original: de bas na lta ba thams cad yod par byed pa'i tshig bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na lta ba thams cad yod par byed pa'i tshig bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, all views is the abbreviated phrase.

original: 'di ma yin zhes bya ba ni zhugs pa'o //🔽bstan pa la gang zhig tshul 'dir legs par zhugs pa la yang legs par gnas pa de'i chos dang ldan pa dag gis smad par bya ba stobs dang ldan pa la gang du yang mi 'jug pa de las 'dir smod par bya ba rnam par gzhag par bya
analyzed: 'di ma yin zhes bya ba ni zhugs pa'o // bstan pa la gang zhig tshul 'dir legs par zhugs pa la yang legs par gnas pa de'i chos dang ldan pa dag gis smad par bya ba stobs dang ldan pa la gang du yang mi 'jug pa de las 'dir smod par bya ba rnam par gzhag par bya
translated: The phrase that is not so is the phrase that is not so.

original: ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ba ma yin no //
translated: For one who is well-established in this rule, the powerful blame by those who possess the Dharma does not occur anywhere. Therefore, here it is not established as blameworthy.

original: dge 'dun la tha dad par byed pa ni gsal ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun la tha dad par byed pa ni gsal ba'o //
translated: Causing division in the Saṅgha is clear.

original: dge 'dun kun nas ltung ba las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun kun nas ltung ba las 'byung ba'o //
translated: The Saṅgha is the one who excommunicates.

original: 'di la kun nas ltung ba nyid kyis dge 'dun la khongs su sdud pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la kun nas ltung ba nyid kyis dge 'dun la khongs su sdud pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, the Saṅgha is not included in the excommunication itself.

original: 'dug pa'i dbus su gnas pa la ni 'khor gyi dbus kyi dngos po nyid la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dug pa'i dbus su gnas pa la ni 'khor gyi dbus kyi dngos po nyid la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: For one who is in the middle of the Saṅgha, the status of being in the middle of the assembly does not exist.

original: de bas na bsnyil bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'di la spang bar bya ba'i las la brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bsnyil bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'di la spang bar bya ba'i las la brtags pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is an analysis of the action of excommunication.

original: gzhag par bya'o @248a * //
analyzed: gzhag par bya'o @248a * //
translated: “To be reinstated”

original: zhes bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba gsal ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba gsal ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: is not a clear understanding.

original: so so'i dngos po la nges par ldan pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: so so'i dngos po la nges par ldan pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it a definite possession of one’s own status.

original: 'di'i las byed pa la rtogs pa bsgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i las byed pa la rtogs pa bsgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: The action of this is not the establishment of understanding.

original: de bas na 'dir rtogs pa bsgrub pa la de'i cho ga brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'dir rtogs pa bsgrub pa la de'i cho ga brjod par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, here the procedure for establishing understanding should be stated.

original: khyod la dang por gsol ba dang bzhi'i las so ;
analyzed: khyod la dang por gsol ba dang bzhi'i las so ;
translated: First, the four-part action of requesting is for you.

original: / de'i 'og tu bsnyil ba rtsom mo zhes bya ba dang / gsol ba byas so //
analyzed: / de'i 'og tu bsnyil ba rtsom mo zhes bya ba dang / gsol ba byas so //
translated: After that, the beginning of the excommunication is stated, and the request is made.

original: las brjod pa dang po dang gnyis pa yang byas zin gyi sdig pa can gyi lta bar gyur pa 'di lta bu 'di thong shig ces mthar dge slong gis de la bsgrags par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: las brjod pa dang po dang gnyis pa yang byas zin gyi sdig pa can gyi lta bar gyur pa 'di lta bu 'di thong shig ces mthar dge slong gis de la bsgrags par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The first and second recitations of the rite are done, and finally the monk should proclaim to him, “Give up this sinful view that has arisen.”

original: dang por zhis bya ba ni gsol ba la'o //
analyzed: dang por zhis bya ba ni gsol ba la'o //
translated: The first is the request.

original: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni bsnyil ba'i las la'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni bsnyil ba'i las la'o //
translated: After that is the rite of ejecting.

original: bsnyil ba'o zhes bya ba ni las la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bsnyil ba'o zhes bya ba ni las la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Ejecting is connected to the rite.

original: rtsom pa zhes bya ba ni rtsom pa ste 'di ni dang po'i cha'o //
analyzed: rtsom pa zhes bya ba ni rtsom pa ste 'di ni dang po'i cha'o //
translated: Commencement is the beginning.

original: rtsom pa de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: rtsom pa de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that commencement?

original: de'i phyir gsol ba byas zin gyi sdig pa can gyi lta bar gyur pa 'di lta bu 'di thong shig ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsol ba byas zin gyi sdig pa can gyi lta bar gyur pa 'di lta bu 'di thong shig ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “Give up this sinful view that has arisen.”

original: 'di ni gcig ste gzhan bshad pa ni las brjod pa dang po yang byas zin gyi sdig pa can gyi lta bar gyur pa 'di lta bu 'di zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: 'di ni gcig ste gzhan bshad pa ni las brjod pa dang po yang byas zin gyi sdig pa can gyi lta bar gyur pa 'di lta bu 'di zhes bya bas so //
translated: This is one. The explanation of the others is by the first recitation of the rite, “This sinful view that has arisen.”

original: de'i 'og tu las brjod pa gnyis pa yang byas zin gyi sdig pa can gyi lta bar gyur pa 'di lta bu 'di thong shig ces bya bas so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu las brjod pa gnyis pa yang byas zin gyi sdig pa can gyi lta bar gyur pa 'di lta bu 'di thong shig ces bya bas so //
translated: Then, after that, the second announcement is made, saying, “Abandon this kind of sinful view that has already been confessed.”

original: re re'i mthar zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang las brjod pa dang po dag so sor re re'i mtha' nas brtsams te mthar mi 'gro bar ldog pa ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dgag pa'i don du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: re re'i mthar zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang las brjod pa dang po dag so sor re re'i mtha' nas brtsams te mthar mi 'gro bar ldog pa ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dgag pa'i don du brjod par bya'o //
translated: “At the end of each” means that it is not proper to stop at the end of each of the first announcement and the second announcement, and to turn back without going to the end. This should be stated in order to reject the idea that there is a separate stopping at the end of each.

original: btang na phyi ma mi bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: btang na phyi ma mi bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “If it is abandoned, the later one is not done.”

original: snga ma nyid kyis so sor ldog pa yod pa la phyi ma mi bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma nyid kyis so sor ldog pa yod pa la phyi ma mi bya'o //
translated: Since there is a separate stopping at the end of the first announcement, the later one is not done.

original: brda'i byed pa yang cho ga 'dis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: brda'i byed pa yang cho ga 'dis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The function of the sign should also be understood by this rite.

original: thams cad du 'brel pa byed pa la sogs pa'i don gyi las la mi bsgo ba dang smad par bya ba dang spang ba dang bsnyil ba rnams nyid la sngar bshad pa'i cho ga'i dngos po la ltos nas cho ga rig par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du 'brel pa byed pa la sogs pa'i don gyi las la mi bsgo ba dang smad par bya ba dang spang ba dang bsnyil ba rnams nyid la sngar bshad pa'i cho ga'i dngos po la ltos nas cho ga rig par bya'o //
translated: In all cases, the rite should be understood in terms of the entity of the previously explained rite, in the sense of not being ordered to do the action of the object, such as connecting, and in the sense of being censured, abandoned, and dismissed.

original: bsnyil ba sdud pa'i ltung ba byed pa po nyid ni gang yin ci zhig spyad na zhes bya ba 'di la sngar bshad pa la mngon par brten nas de skad smrab pa 'byung ba la slar byas pas dge slong la zhes bya ba 'di'i gnas su gang du
analyzed: bsnyil ba sdud pa'i ltung ba byed pa po nyid ni gang yin ci zhig spyad na zhes bya ba 'di la sngar bshad pa la mngon par brten nas de skad smrab pa 'byung ba la slar byas pas dge slong la zhes bya ba 'di'i gnas su gang du
translated: The one who is disrobed is the one who is spoken of in the phrase “the monk.”

original: 'du shes bya ba la smos pa ni dge tshul bsnyil ba nyid du gyur pa'i gnas skabs la ste /
analyzed: 'du shes bya ba la smos pa ni dge tshul bsnyil ba nyid du gyur pa'i gnas skabs la ste /
translated: The one who is spoken of in the phrase “the novice” is the one who is in the state of having been disrobed.

original: bsnyel par ma rdzogs pa la 'di lta bu nyid yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽nyes byas 'di yod la dor ba rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyel par ma rdzogs pa la 'di lta bu nyid yin na zhes bya ba'i don to // nyes byas 'di yod la dor ba rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that if he is not fully disrobed, this is the case.

original: bsnyil @248b ba sdud pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: bsnyil @248b ba sdud pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: This is the presentation of the downfall of making one disrobe.

original: // / ci zhig byas na kha ma bsgyur ba'i gos gyon pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / ci zhig byas na kha ma bsgyur ba'i gos gyon pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is done to commit the downfall of wearing undyed robes?

original: de'i phyir sngon po'am dmar po'am dur smrig gis kha ma bsgyur ba rang gi gos tha na lhung bzed kyi kha g-yogs dang / snod dang rkang pa'i 'bob dang ske rags dag gi bgo ba la sogs pa yongs su longs spyod na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon po'am dmar po'am dur smrig gis kha ma bsgyur ba rang gi gos tha na lhung bzed kyi kha g-yogs dang / snod dang rkang pa'i 'bob dang ske rags dag gi bgo ba la sogs pa yongs su longs spyod na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, one should enjoy one’s own robes, even a covering for the begging bowl, a foot-covering, or a belt, which are not dyed blue, red, or orange.

original: tshon chen po brgyad po rnams spangs nas gzhan gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig las gos kha bsgyur bar bya'o zhes bya ba phran tshegs dag las smos so //
analyzed: tshon chen po brgyad po rnams spangs nas gzhan gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig las gos kha bsgyur bar bya'o zhes bya ba phran tshegs dag las smos so //
translated: The Kṣudraka Collection mentions that one should dye one’s robes with any of the eight colors, avoiding the other colors.

original: 'dir yang 'dag pa zhes bya ba las gang zhig 'di la dmar pos zhes bya ba rnam par 'byed pa klog pa kha cig las 'dir yang 'don pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang 'dag pa zhes bya ba las gang zhig 'di la dmar pos zhes bya ba rnam par 'byed pa klog pa kha cig las 'dir yang 'don pa yin te /
translated: Here, the word “pure” is read in the Vibhāṣā as “which is not dyed red.”

original: tshon chen po rnam pa brgyad kyis kha sgyur bar byed la li khri dang / mthing shun dang rgya skyegs dang / mtshal dang / gur gum dang / btsod dang / rma shing dang / le brgan rtsis kha sgyur bar byed nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: tshon chen po rnam pa brgyad kyis kha sgyur bar byed la li khri dang / mthing shun dang rgya skyegs dang / mtshal dang / gur gum dang / btsod dang / rma shing dang / le brgan rtsis kha sgyur bar byed nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The eight great colors are: lac, indigo, vermillion, madder, saffron, red arsenic, cochineal, and crimson.

original: kha dog chen po brgyad ma gtogs pa gzhan gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig gis gos kha bsgyur bar bya zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: kha dog chen po brgyad ma gtogs pa gzhan gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig gis gos kha bsgyur bar bya zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One said, Except for the eight great colors, one may dye the robes with any other color.

original: de bas na 'dir sngon po la sogs pa ni dpe tsam du rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir sngon po la sogs pa ni dpe tsam du rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, here blue and so on should be understood as mere examples.

original: de la sngon pos zhes bya ba ni skye ba phun sum tshogs pa'i tshon la dper rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la sngon pos zhes bya ba ni skye ba phun sum tshogs pa'i tshon la dper rig par bya'o //
translated: Among them, blue should be understood as an example of the color of perfect birth.

original: dmar pos zhes bya ba ni sa las 'byung ba'i khams la'o //
analyzed: dmar pos zhes bya ba ni sa las 'byung ba'i khams la'o //
translated: Red is from the element of earth.

original: rma shing zhes bya ba ni skye ba phun sum tshogs pa'i me tog dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i tshon las bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: rma shing zhes bya ba ni skye ba phun sum tshogs pa'i me tog dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i tshon las bskyed pa'o //
translated: Cochineal is from the color of perfect birth, such as flowers and fruits.

original: kha ma bsgyur ba zhes bya ba ni tshon gyis so //
analyzed: kha ma bsgyur ba zhes bya ba ni tshon gyis so //
translated: “Uncolored” means not dyed.

original: de bas na gang yang rung bas kha ma bsgyur ba'i rang gi gos la zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi gos nye bar longs spyod pa la na smad pa nyid de kha na ma tho ba stobs dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de bas na gang yang rung bas kha ma bsgyur ba'i rang gi gos la zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi gos nye bar longs spyod pa la na smad pa nyid de kha na ma tho ba stobs dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore, “one’s own robe that is not dyed” means that there is a downfall if one uses another’s robe, because it is a powerful downfall.

original: bdag tu byas pa dang dkris par mngon par brten pa nyid shin tu stobs dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu byas pa dang dkris par mngon par brten pa nyid shin tu stobs dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a powerful downfall if one makes it one’s own and keeps it.

original: de ltar yang so sor khyim pa'i gos bgo ba bkag pa'i tshul gyis te gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang so sor khyim pa'i gos bgo ba bkag pa'i tshul gyis te gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, it is a downfall if one wears a householder’s robe, but not if one does not.

original: de lta bu'i ltung byed la 'byung ba srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ltung byed la 'byung ba srid pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible for such a downfall to occur in any other way.

original: gos sar pa so sor rnyed pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gos sar pa so sor rnyed pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: “If one uses a new robe that one has acquired individually” means

original: gang zhig so sor rnyed pa'i tshig byas zhes bya ba 'di'i rjes la yang rang gi tshig smos pa de las so //
analyzed: gang zhig so sor rnyed pa'i tshig byas zhes bya ba 'di'i rjes la yang rang gi tshig smos pa de las so //
translated: that one should say “that one has acquired individually” after the word “new.”

original: sar pa zhes bya ba la sar pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sar pa zhes bya ba la sar pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: “New” means one of two kinds of new.

original: sar pa las kyang sar pa dang sor sor rnyed pa las kyang sar ba ste /
analyzed: sar pa las kyang sar pa dang sor sor rnyed pa las kyang sar ba ste /
translated: and from the new, the new.

original: don 'di la ni sor sor rnyed pa las sar pa mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba 'dir gzhung du @249a * //
analyzed: don 'di la ni sor sor rnyed pa las sar pa mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba 'dir gzhung du @249a * //
translated: In this case, the text should read: “from the new, the new is preferred.”

original: rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: This is the way the text should be.

original: rnying pa la yang kha ma bsgyur ba la bgo bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnying pa la yang kha ma bsgyur ba la bgo bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: And because the old is to be shared when it is not altered.

original: yang gang zhig klog pa las 'byung ba yin te /🔽don 'di la ni sar pa las sar pa mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba 'di las nyams pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang gang zhig klog pa las 'byung ba yin te / don 'di la ni sar pa las sar pa mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba 'di las nyams pa nyid do //
translated: But if it is from a reading,🔽then in this case, the text should read: “from the new, the new is preferred.” This is the way the text should be.

original: de lta bas na so sor rnyed pa las gang zhig thog ma nyid gang yin pa des chos gos dang po so sor rnyed pas 'di zhes bya ba 'di'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bas na so sor rnyed pa las gang zhig thog ma nyid gang yin pa des chos gos dang po so sor rnyed pas 'di zhes bya ba 'di'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the first of those obtained separately is the first robe. This is the meaning of the text.

original: 'dir thams cad dkris pa dang / dus 'byung ba dang phye ma la sogs pa la nyes par bgo par bya ba'i gos bgo bar byed par nus pa nyid ni ma yin zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i don du smos pa ni tha na lhung bzed kyi kha g-yogs dang zhes bya ba la sogs
analyzed: 'dir thams cad dkris pa dang / dus 'byung ba dang phye ma la sogs pa la nyes par bgo par bya ba'i gos bgo bar byed par nus pa nyid ni ma yin zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i don du smos pa ni tha na lhung bzed kyi kha g-yogs dang zhes bya ba la sogs
translated: Here, the point of mentioning “even a covering for the begging bowl” is to show that it is not possible to wear a garment that is cut up into strips, squares, and so on.

original: pa'o // 'dir lhung bzed kyi kha g-yogs kyis bsod snyoms nye bar g-yogs ba brjod pa mthong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: pa'o // 'dir lhung bzed kyi kha g-yogs kyis bsod snyoms nye bar g-yogs ba brjod pa mthong ba yin gyi /
translated: Here, it is seen that the covering for the begging bowl is mentioned as a covering for the alms-bowl.🔽But elsewhere, it is not permitted.

original: gzhan du ni rjes su gnang ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir 'dir zhu ba'i gzhung kha cig las lhung bzed kyi dra ba la sogs pa rkang pa bkru pa'i snod du sbyar du rung ngam zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan du ni rjes su gnang ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir 'dir zhu ba'i gzhung kha cig las lhung bzed kyi dra ba la sogs pa rkang pa bkru pa'i snod du sbyar du rung ngam zhe na /
translated: In some texts, it is asked whether a begging bowl net and so on are suitable for a foot-washing vessel.

original: rung zhes gsungs pa ni chu tshags 'dir rigs par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: rung zhes gsungs pa ni chu tshags 'dir rigs par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir bsdus pa yin te /
translated: The answer “suitable” is included here because it is reasonable to use a water-strainer.

original: rgyu ba 'di chu gzung ba la kha bsgyur ba dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu ba 'di chu gzung ba la kha bsgyur ba dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: This is the transformation of the water-strainer into a water-holder.

original: gzung ba dang ldan pa nyid dang 'di la byin len bya ba nyid dang / nye bar gnas pa nyid dang dus ma yin pa nyid la gzung bar bya ba dang nye bar gnas pa nyid yod kyang longs spyad par bya ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba dang ldan pa nyid dang 'di la byin len bya ba nyid dang / nye bar gnas pa nyid dang dus ma yin pa nyid la gzung bar bya ba dang nye bar gnas pa nyid yod kyang longs spyad par bya ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: and it is not to be used if it is to be held, if it is to be received, if it is to be kept, or if it is untimely.

original: don 'di ni phal cher nyams pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don 'di ni phal cher nyams pa ma yin no //
translated: This meaning is not lost.

original: de lta bas na yo byad dang chos gos sbyin pa 'di dang 'di la kha ma bsgyur ba nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na yo byad dang chos gos sbyin pa 'di dang 'di la kha ma bsgyur ba nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the giving of requisites and robes is established without any modification.

original: bgo ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni bsod snyoms so sor g-yogs pa yang ste /
analyzed: bgo ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni bsod snyoms so sor g-yogs pa yang ste /
translated: “Clothing, etc.” means almsfood, a covering, and a bed.

original: bgo ba dang g-yogs pa dang nyid la ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: bgo ba dang g-yogs pa dang nyid la ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: The meaning is that it is not clothing, a covering, and a bed.

original: /'dir tshad dang ldan pa nyid kyang ma yin zhes bya ba 'di 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: /'dir tshad dang ldan pa nyid kyang ma yin zhes bya ba 'di 'jug pa'o //
translated: Here, the phrase “it is not of the right measure” is also applicable.

original: ske rags dag la yang gal te nyes pa yod na tshad dang mi ldan pa'i gos la sogs pa la yang 'byung ba'i phyir 'os pa ma yin zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ske rags dag la yang gal te nyes pa yod na tshad dang mi ldan pa'i gos la sogs pa la yang 'byung ba'i phyir 'os pa ma yin zhes gsungs so //
translated: If there is a fault in the waistband, it is not suitable because it would also occur in robes that do not have the proper measurements.

original: sde pa gzhan gyis ni rung bar bya mi dgos pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sde pa gzhan gyis ni rung bar bya mi dgos pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Other sects say that it does not need to be made suitable.

original: dge slong dang dge slong ma dang dge tshul dang dge slob ma dang dge tshul ma'i sde ba'i 'khor rnams ni de ni 'dir sde pa zhes bya ba'i sgrar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong dang dge slong ma dang dge tshul dang dge slob ma dang dge tshul ma'i sde ba'i 'khor rnams ni de ni 'dir sde pa zhes bya ba'i sgrar 'gyur ro //
translated: The assembly of fully ordained monks, fully ordained nuns, male novices, female novices, and female probationary nuns is called a sect here.

original: de las sde pa gzhan gang yang rung ba'i gos rang spyod pa la ni yang gzod rung bar bya mi dgos pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las sde pa gzhan gang yang rung ba'i gos rang spyod pa la ni yang gzod rung bar bya mi dgos pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that robes of any other sect that are used by oneself do not need to be made suitable again.

original: khyim pas brkus pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzod @249b rung bar bya mi dgos pa nyid ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: khyim pas brkus pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzod @249b rung bar bya mi dgos pa nyid ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is not stolen by a layperson. The meaning is that it does not need to be made suitable again.

original: 'dir mdo de gnyis kyi gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las dge slong gi gos rung bar byas pa gang yin pa de ni dge slong ma rnams la yang rung bar byas pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'dir mdo de gnyis kyi gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las dge slong gi gos rung bar byas pa gang yin pa de ni dge slong ma rnams la yang rung bar byas pa nyid yin la /
translated: “Whatever is suitable for a monk’s robe is also suitable for nuns.

original: de bzhin du sde pa lda po thams cad la yang rung bar byas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sde pa lda po thams cad la yang rung bar byas pa nyid yin no //
translated: Whatever is suitable for all the sects is also suitable for the rest.

original: dge slong gis rgyal po'am phyir rgol ba gzhan dag gos brkus par gyur pa zhig gal te slad kyis thob par gyur na yang rung bar bgyi 'tshal lam nye ba 'khor mi dgos te /
analyzed: dge slong gis rgyal po'am phyir rgol ba gzhan dag gos brkus par gyur pa zhig gal te slad kyis thob par gyur na yang rung bar bgyi 'tshal lam nye ba 'khor mi dgos te /
translated: If a monk steals a robe from a king or another opponent, and later obtains it, it is not necessary to make it suitable, Upāli,

original: snga ma nyid du rung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma nyid du rung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: because it was already suitable.

original: kha dog chen por kha bsgyur ba'i gos brten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kha dog chen por kha bsgyur ba'i gos brten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not wear a robe that is dyed a brilliant color.

original: 'di'i gzhung ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di'i gzhung ni bshad zin to //
translated: The text of this has been explained.

original: 'dir brgyad kyi tshig ni dpe tsam du rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir brgyad kyi tshig ni dpe tsam du rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Here, the words of the eight are merely illustrative.

original: de bas na 'dir nye bar ma bsdus so //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir nye bar ma bsdus so //
translated: Therefore, they are not included here.

original: khyim pa'i gos kyang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyim pa'i gos kyang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not wear the robes of a layperson.

original: bgo ba brten par mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bgo ba brten par mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should not wear the robes of a layperson.

original: 'dir phran tshegs dag las dang po'i gzhung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir phran tshegs dag las dang po'i gzhung ngo //
translated: Here is the text of the Kṣudraka-vastu.🔽One should wear the robes inside the monastery, covered with the ochre robe.

original: gtsug lag khang gi nang du dur smrig gis g-yogs te brten par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir gnas khang gtsug lag khang nas phyir mi 'byung bar bgo bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin gyi gnas khang la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi nang du dur smrig gis g-yogs te brten par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir gnas khang gtsug lag khang nas phyir mi 'byung bar bgo bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin gyi gnas khang la ni ma yin no //
translated: Here it is said that one should wear the robes inside the monastery, not leaving the monastery. It is not said that one should wear the robes inside the dwelling.

original: gzhan ma yin pa la yang gtsug lag khang nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa la yang gtsug lag khang nyid ma yin no //
translated: And the monastery itself is not the dwelling.

original: de bas na 'di la sor sor bzung ba ma byas so //
analyzed: de bas na 'di la sor sor bzung ba ma byas so //
translated: Therefore, this is not to be taken literally.

original: khyim pa'i gos ji lta bu la gtsug lag khang gi nang du bgo ba brten par bya ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: khyim pa'i gos ji lta bu la gtsug lag khang gi nang du bgo ba brten par bya ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: What kind of robes of a layperson should one wear inside the monastery?

original: de'i phyir dur smrig gis g-yogs te brten par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dur smrig gis g-yogs te brten par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that one should wear the robes inside the monastery, covered with the ochre robe.

original: mal cha'i steng du brten pa la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir gzhan du ni btags pa'o //
analyzed: mal cha'i steng du brten pa la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir gzhan du ni btags pa'o //
translated: There is no offense if one relies on it on a bed.🔽The robe is shared if it is obtained by one on the road.

original: lam du gos brnyas pa ni thung mong nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni brnyas pa gcig gis thob pa yang 'di ni thun mong pa nyid du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lam du gos brnyas pa ni thung mong nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni brnyas pa gcig gis thob pa yang 'di ni thun mong pa nyid du bstan pa'o //
translated: The robe is shared if it is obtained by one on the road.

original: su dang thun mong ba nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: su dang thun mong ba nyid yin zhe na /
translated: With whom is it shared?

original: de'i phyir grogs dag dang yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir grogs dag dang yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “with companions.”

original: ji lta bu ngag dang zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu ngag dang zhe na /
translated: What kind of companions?

original: de'i phyir dge slong dang dge tshul dag dang ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong dang dge tshul dag dang ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “with monks and novices.”🔽If one is alone, one should cover it starting from the top, beginning with the elders.

original: gcig pu nyid yin na rgan rabs nas brtsams te ji srid slebs pa'i steng du g-yogs so zhes bya ba ni gos brnyas pa ni zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gcig pu nyid yin na rgan rabs nas brtsams te ji srid slebs pa'i steng du g-yogs so zhes bya ba ni gos brnyas pa ni zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The robe is shared if it is obtained by one on the road.

original: dmigs kyis ma bsngos na gzhan las gyon te btsag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dmigs kyis ma bsngos na gzhan las gyon te btsag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is not assigned, one should not dye it with another.

original: gos thun mong ba bgos nas zhes bya ba mi brjod pa dam pa rnams kyis rjes su gnang ba la de la yang khongs su bsdu ba sgrub pa'i don du gang zhig thun mong nyid du sbyin pa ste /🔽de dang @250a * //
analyzed: gos thun mong ba bgos nas zhes bya ba mi brjod pa dam pa rnams kyis rjes su gnang ba la de la yang khongs su bsdu ba sgrub pa'i don du gang zhig thun mong nyid du sbyin pa ste / de dang @250a * //
translated: In that case, it is included in the practice. What is given in common is for the purpose of establishing that.🔽It is not specified as that or this.

original: 'di zhes bya ba bye brag tu ni ma yin te /🔽de ni dmigs kyis ma bsngos pa'i //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba bye brag tu ni ma yin te / de ni dmigs kyis ma bsngos pa'i //
translated: That is not specified.

original: bsod nams 'dod pas mgron du bos na kha tshar ma bcad pa man chad sar pa la mi rtag pas nyen par gyur pa'i yid la byed pas steng du brdzi bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsod nams 'dod pas mgron du bos na kha tshar ma bcad pa man chad sar pa la mi rtag pas nyen par gyur pa'i yid la byed pas steng du brdzi bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one is invited as a guest by one who desires merit, one should step on the new uncut edge of the robe with the attention focused on impermanence, thinking It is impermanent, it is dangerous.

original: dus nam gyi tshe na brdzi bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: dus nam gyi tshe na brdzi bar bya zhe na /
translated: At what time should one step on it?

original: de'i phyir mgron du bos nas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mgron du bos nas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said having been invited as a guest.

original: tho 'tshams par byed pa'i bsam pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tho 'tshams par byed pa'i bsam pas ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not with the intention of harming,

original: 'on kyang bsod nams 'dod pas so //
analyzed: 'on kyang bsod nams 'dod pas so //
translated: but rather with the desire for merit.

original: ci zhig brdzi bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig brdzi bar bya zhe na /
translated: What should one step on?

original: de'i phyir sar pa la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sar pa la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said on the new [robe].

original: gos zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //🔽kha tshar ma bcad pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir ji srid kyi sgra dang 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: gos zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro // kha tshar ma bcad pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir ji srid kyi sgra dang 'brel pa ste /
translated: The term clothing is to be supplied.🔽The term uncut is connected with the term as long as in the verse.

original: ji srid du kha char ma bcad pa man chad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji srid du kha char ma bcad pa man chad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: as long as the cloth is uncut.

original: ci gang yang rung bas yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci gang yang rung bas yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it by any means?

original: de'i phyir mi rtag pas nyen par gyur pa'i yid la byed pas so zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi rtag pas nyen par gyur pa'i yid la byed pas so zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said: by the attention of one who is afflicted by impermanence.

original: kha ma bsgyur ba'i gos gyon pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: kha ma bsgyur ba'i gos gyon pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: The downfall is wearing uncut cloth.

original: // / gang du zhig byas na longs pa bzhir gtogs pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na ;
analyzed: // / gang du zhig byas na longs pa bzhir gtogs pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na ;
translated: Where is it that one becomes guilty of a thullaccaya offense?

original: de'i phyir ba ni po che rang gi ma yin pa dang / der smos pa la reg gam reg tu bcug na byed pa po yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ba ni po che rang gi ma yin pa dang / der smos pa la reg gam reg tu bcug na byed pa po yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: If one uses a valuable cloth that is not one's own, or one touches it or causes it to be touched, one becomes guilty of a thullaccaya offense.

original: gang du zhes bya ba'i dri ba 'di la reg gam reg tu bcug na zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: gang du zhes bya ba'i dri ba 'di la reg gam reg tu bcug na zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: In response to the question where? the phrase if one touches it or causes it to be touched is used.

original: ci zhig byas na zhes bya ba'i dri pha 'di la rin po che rang gi ma yin pa dang / der smos pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: ci zhig byas na zhes bya ba'i dri pha 'di la rin po che rang gi ma yin pa dang / der smos pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: The question what is it? is answered by the words that which is mentioned there.

original: der zhes bya ba'i sgras ni der smos pa la rin po cher bzung ste rin po che dang mnyam pa de zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba'i sgras ni der smos pa la rin po cher bzung ste rin po che dang mnyam pa de zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word there refers to the precious one mentioned there, meaning that which is equal to the precious one.

original: der rang la rang bzhin gyis dngos po nyid kyi phyir rang gi rin po che'i rang bzhin gyi cho ga rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba'i cho ga 'dir rang bzung ba nyid kyi phyir 'dir dag pa'i ltung byed la rang ma yin pa'i tshig tu byas so
analyzed: der rang la rang bzhin gyis dngos po nyid kyi phyir rang gi rin po che'i rang bzhin gyi cho ga rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba'i cho ga 'dir rang bzung ba nyid kyi phyir 'dir dag pa'i ltung byed la rang ma yin pa'i tshig tu byas so
translated: Since it is naturally a thing in itself, it is called the arrangement of the ritual of its own precious nature. Since it is grasped as itself in this ritual, it is called the word of what is not itself in the downfall of purity.

original: // der smos pa la zhes bya ba 'di la rang ma yin pa zhes bya ba rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: // der smos pa la zhes bya ba 'di la rang ma yin pa zhes bya ba rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Here, that which is mentioned there should be understood as what is not itself.

original: 'dir gnyis ka yang byed pa por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gnyis ka yang byed pa por rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, both should be understood as agents.

original: rang gi dang rang gi ma yin pa shin tu stobs dang ldan pa ni shin tu rgyags pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: rang gi dang rang gi ma yin pa shin tu stobs dang ldan pa ni shin tu rgyags pa'i gnas so //
translated: Very powerful self and non-self are the basis of great intoxication.

original: gang gi phyir rang gi shin tu rgyags pa'i gnas la bdag tu bya ba'i rin po cher smos pa la nyes byas su gtogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gi shin tu rgyags pa'i gnas la bdag tu bya ba'i rin po cher smos pa la nyes byas su gtogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Because of the great pride in one's own possessions, one should understand that it is a fault to call one's own possessions jewels.

original: rin po cher smos pa zhes bya ba de ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: rin po cher smos pa zhes bya ba de ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is meant by calling jewels one's own?

original: de'i phyir de ni g-yul du spyad pa'i mtshon cha dang rol mor spyad pa'i lag cha'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni g-yul du spyad pa'i mtshon cha dang rol mor spyad pa'i lag cha'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, They are weapons used in battle and instruments used for entertainment.

original: g-yul du dgos shing de 'brel ba'i mtshon cha ni g-yul du spyad pa'i mtshon cha'o //
analyzed: g-yul du dgos shing de 'brel ba'i mtshon cha ni g-yul du spyad pa'i mtshon cha'o //
