translated: Weapons that are necessary for and connected with battle are weapons used in battle.

original: @250b de bzhin du rol mor spyad pa yang ngo //
analyzed: @250b de bzhin du rol mor spyad pa yang ngo //
translated: Similarly, they are also used for entertainment.

original: de gnyis ji lta bu zhig gang gi byed pa po yin zhe na /🔽de'i phyir dgos pa'i phyir rung bar gyur pa ni dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ji lta bu zhig gang gi byed pa po yin zhe na / de'i phyir dgos pa'i phyir rung bar gyur pa ni dngos gzhi'o //
translated: What are those two like, and what is their function?

original: gyur pa ma yin pa ni nyes byas kyi'o //
analyzed: gyur pa ma yin pa ni nyes byas kyi'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, The proper use of them is the basis, and the improper use is a fault.🔽The proper use is the basis, and the improper use is a fault.

original: gtsug lag khang dang nye 'khor na 'dug pa la bdag gir bya ba dang ma 'brel par rdzas chud mi za bar bya ba'i sems kyis ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang dang nye 'khor na 'dug pa la bdag gir bya ba dang ma 'brel par rdzas chud mi za bar bya ba'i sems kyis ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: except for the thought of not wasting the substance, not connected with the appropriation of the monastery and its vicinity.

original: de gnyis gnas gang la yang rung ba na 'dug pa byed pa po yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis gnas gang la yang rung ba na 'dug pa byed pa po yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Is the agent of this action anyone who is in the monastery or its vicinity? No, it is not.

original: de'i phyir gtsug lag khang dang de'i nye 'khor na 'dug pa ni ma gtogs te zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtsug lag khang dang de'i nye 'khor na 'dug pa ni ma gtogs te zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: Therefore, the words “except for the one who is in the monastery and its vicinity” are stated.

original: ci sems gang yang rung bas 'di ma gtogs par sems gang yang rung ba de la 'di byed pa po yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci sems gang yang rung bas 'di ma gtogs par sems gang yang rung ba de la 'di byed pa po yin zhe na /
translated: Is the agent of this action anyone who has any thought, except for the one who is in the monastery and its vicinity?

original: de'i phyir bdag gir bya ba dang ma 'brel par rdzas chud mi za bar bya ba'i sems gang la yod pa de'i phyir 'di'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag gir bya ba dang ma 'brel par rdzas chud mi za bar bya ba'i sems gang la yod pa de'i phyir 'di'o //
translated: Therefore, the words “the thought of not wasting the substance, not connected with the appropriation” are stated.

original: gtsug lag khang dang de'i nye 'khor na 'dug pa ni ma gtogs te zhes bya ba 'di'i don to //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang dang de'i nye 'khor na 'dug pa ni ma gtogs te zhes bya ba 'di'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “except for the one who is in the monastery and its vicinity” is this.

original: de bskyang ba'i phyir reg pa dang reg tu bcug pa la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba de tsam bshad do //
analyzed: de bskyang ba'i phyir reg pa dang reg tu bcug pa la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba de tsam bshad do //
translated: It is not a transgression if he does not do so in order to protect his own life or his vows.

original: de la 'di ltar yongs su bskyang bar bya zhes bya ba ma bstan pas de rjod par byed pa ni /🔽de yal bar mi dor zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang na 'dug pa'am /
analyzed: de la 'di ltar yongs su bskyang bar bya zhes bya ba ma bstan pas de rjod par byed pa ni / de yal bar mi dor zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang na 'dug pa'am /
translated: The text does not explain how to protect the sick person, so the commentary supplies this information.

original: gtsug lag khang gi nye 'khor na 'dug pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi nye 'khor na 'dug pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The sick person should be placed in a temple or in the vicinity of a temple.

original: rin po che 'am rin po cher smos pa de yal bar mi dor te ;
analyzed: rin po che 'am rin po cher smos pa de yal bar mi dor te ;
translated: If the sick person is a precious person or a person who is considered precious, he should not be abandoned.

original: de bsrung ba'i phyir 'dod pa de thob par mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bsrung ba'i phyir 'dod pa de thob par mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that in order to protect him, one should not give up one’s desire to obtain what is necessary for his care.

original: bdag po las 'khyams par gyur na zhes bya ba shugs kyis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag po las 'khyams par gyur na zhes bya ba shugs kyis rtogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “if he is lost from the owner” is understood by implication.

original: bsrung ba'i don du 'dod pa thob par bya ba ji ltar de yang bar mi 'dor bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: bsrung ba'i don du 'dod pa thob par bya ba ji ltar de yang bar mi 'dor bar bya zhe na /
translated: How can one obtain what is necessary for his care without abandoning him?

original: de'i phyir zhag bdun nam brgyad du bsdu skyogs bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhag bdun nam brgyad du bsdu skyogs bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says, “One may keep it for seven or eight days.”

original: 'gro ba'i lam g-yogs su 'am lo ma'i tshogs dag gis g-yogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i lam g-yogs su 'am lo ma'i tshogs dag gis g-yogs par bya'o //
translated: Or it should be covered with a roof of grass or leaves.

original: bdag po rtags thams cad la ma bab par kho bo'i yin no zhe zer ba la sbyin par mi bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bdag po rtags thams cad la ma bab par kho bo'i yin no zhe zer ba la sbyin par mi bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: One should not give it to someone who says, “It is mine,” without the presence of all the signs of ownership.

original: rdzas de'i rtags gang yin pa de'i thog tu phebs par gyur pa'i don gyis ma phabs par mun sprul tsam du kho po'i yin no zhes zer ba de la gya tshom du sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rdzas de'i rtags gang yin pa de'i thog tu phebs par gyur pa'i don gyis ma phabs par mun sprul tsam du kho po'i yin no zhes zer ba de la gya tshom du sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: The meaning of “without the presence” is without the presence of the sign of that object. One should not give it away in a haphazard manner to someone who says, “It is mine,” merely on the basis of a vague recollection.

original: 'ongs par ma gyur na de'i 'og tu dge 'dun gyi mdzod du gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'ongs par ma gyur na de'i 'og tu dge 'dun gyi mdzod du gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If the owner does not appear, then after that it should be placed in the saṅgha’s treasury.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni bdag po'i 'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni bdag po'i 'o //
translated: “That” refers to the owner.

original: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni zhag bdun nam brgyad rnams las so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni zhag bdun nam brgyad rnams las so //
translated: “After that” means after seven or eight days.

original: 'dir dus yun ji srid du gzhug cing bcang bar zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir dus yun ji srid du gzhug cing bcang bar zhe na /
translated: How long should it be kept?

original: de'i phyir zla ba @251a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir zla ba @251a * //
translated: Therefore it is said,

original: drug gi mtha' tshun chad du bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: drug gi mtha' tshun chad du bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: “It should be kept up to the end of six months.”

original: dus de la yang bdag po ma 'ongs na de'i 'og tu gnag zhig bya ba de smos pa ni /
analyzed: dus de la yang bdag po ma 'ongs na de'i 'og tu gnag zhig bya ba de smos pa ni /
translated: If the owner does not come by that time, then what should be done after that is stated.

original: de'i phyir 'og tu ma 'ongs na sangs rgyas sam dge 'dun gyi ris gang nas rnyed pa der spyad du rung ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'og tu ma 'ongs na sangs rgyas sam dge 'dun gyi ris gang nas rnyed pa der spyad du rung ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is stated that if he does not come later, it is suitable to use it in the order of the Buddha or the Sangha from which it was obtained.

original: sa ris gang nas zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas sam dge 'dun gyis ris kyi yul gang gi nang nas so //
analyzed: sa ris gang nas zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas sam dge 'dun gyis ris kyi yul gang gi nang nas so //
translated: In which order means in which country of the order of the Buddha or the Sangha.

original: des zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas sam dge 'dun gyis so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas sam dge 'dun gyis so //
translated: By that means by the Buddha or the Sangha.

original: dgos pa'i phyir rung ba nyid la dngos po de'i tshig tu brjod pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: dgos pa'i phyir rung ba nyid la dngos po de'i tshig tu brjod pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: For the sake of necessity, it is not stated in the words of that thing.

original: mi rung ba nyid la 'di'i bya ba gang yin pa de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: mi rung ba nyid la 'di'i bya ba gang yin pa de brjod par bya ste /
translated: In the case of unsuitability, whatever action is to be done by that should be stated.

original: de rung ba nyid ma yin na des rung ba brtan pa nyo bar bya'o //
analyzed: de rung ba nyid ma yin na des rung ba brtan pa nyo bar bya'o //
translated: If that is not suitable, then by that a stable suitability should be purchased.

original: gal te de'i tshe bdag po 'ongs par gyur na rjes su gnang ba gsol te /
analyzed: gal te de'i tshe bdag po 'ongs par gyur na rjes su gnang ba gsol te /
translated: If the owner comes at that time, he should be requested for permission.

original: mi ster na sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi ster na sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If he does not give it, it should be given.

original: gal te de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni nyos pa nyid dang ma nyos par spyod pa'i gnas skabs su yang dgos par gyur pa nyid na'o //
analyzed: gal te de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni nyos pa nyid dang ma nyos par spyod pa'i gnas skabs su yang dgos par gyur pa nyid na'o //
translated: If at that time, that is, at the time of using what has been bought or what has not been bought, it becomes necessary.

original: mi ster na zhes bya ba ni rjes su gnang ba'o //
analyzed: mi ster na zhes bya ba ni rjes su gnang ba'o //
translated: If he does not give, he should be permitted.

original: sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rdzas de'o //
analyzed: sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rdzas de'o //
translated: He should be made to give that object.

original: gal te skyed slong na kho bo cag gis yongs su bskyangs pa gang yin pa de nyid drin che bar mi sems sam zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te skyed slong na kho bo cag gis yongs su bskyangs pa gang yin pa de nyid drin che bar mi sems sam zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If he asks for a reward, he should be told, “Do you not think that the one who is being supported by us is the one who has the greater obligation?”

original: skyed slong na zhes bya ba ni dgod pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: skyed slong na zhes bya ba ni dgod pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rnyed pa'o //
translated: If he asks for a reward, he is asking for a reason to be angry.

original: sngar rung ba nyid du gyur pa zhes gang smos pa de la gan la dgod par bya ba nyid yin zhe na ;
analyzed: sngar rung ba nyid du gyur pa zhes gang smos pa de la gan la dgod par bya ba nyid yin zhe na ;
translated: As for what was said earlier, “that which has already been made suitable,” what is it that should be made suitable?

original: de'i phyir brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it should be stated.

original: nor bu la sogs pa ni bdar ba dang / phug pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nor bu la sogs pa ni bdar ba dang / phug pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said that jewels and so on are to be tested and pierced.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mu tig dang bee d'urya la sogs pa dag bsdus pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mu tig dang bee d'urya la sogs pa dag bsdus pa'i don du'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes pearls, lapis lazuli, and so on.

original: 'dir gzhung kha cig las ni dge slong gis nor bu len na ni nyes byas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung kha cig las ni dge slong gis nor bu len na ni nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: In some texts, it says: “If a monk takes a gem, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: bdar ba len par byed na ltung byed do //
analyzed: bdar ba len par byed na ltung byed do //
translated: If he takes a gem that has been cut, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

original: nor bu ji lta ba bzhin du mi tig dang bee d'urya dang dung dang man shel dang byi ru dang dngul dang sa le sbram dang sbug dang rdo'i snying po dang / dmar po dang g-yas su 'khyil pa'i bar du yang rung ngam zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nor bu ji lta ba bzhin du mi tig dang bee d'urya dang dung dang man shel dang byi ru dang dngul dang sa le sbram dang sbug dang rdo'i snying po dang / dmar po dang g-yas su 'khyil pa'i bar du yang rung ngam zhes pa'o //
translated: Just as with a gem, so it is with a pearl, lapis lazuli, shell, quartz, coral, silver, gold, bronze, and red pearls.

original: gzhan las kyang dge slong gis nor bu len nam phug ba len na nyes byas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan las kyang dge slong gis nor bu len nam phug ba len na nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: In other texts, it says: “If a monk takes a gem or bronze, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: phug ba len par byed na ni ltung byed do //
analyzed: phug ba len par byed na ni ltung byed do //
translated: If he takes a bronze, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

original: nor bu ji lta ba bzhin du mu tig dang bee d'urya dang ji srid g-yas su 'khyil ba'i bar du yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nor bu ji lta ba bzhin du mu tig dang bee d'urya dang ji srid g-yas su 'khyil ba'i bar du yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Just as with a gem, so it is with a pearl, lapis lazuli, and so on, up to red pearls.”

original: de gnyis ka la yang ji ltar rigs par sbyar ba zhes bya bas gnyis ka bsdus pa yin no //🔽mgul rgyan dang gdu bu rgyan can dang dpung rgyan dang do shal dang @251b se mo dor gnas pa nyid du yang ngo zhes bya ba ni sa le sbram dang dngul las byas pa nyid gang zhig 'dir de la 'di lta bur 'dug pa'i ngo bo ma yin
analyzed: de gnyis ka la yang ji ltar rigs par sbyar ba zhes bya bas gnyis ka bsdus pa yin no // mgul rgyan dang gdu bu rgyan can dang dpung rgyan dang do shal dang @251b se mo dor gnas pa nyid du yang ngo zhes bya ba ni sa le sbram dang dngul las byas pa nyid gang zhig 'dir de la 'di lta bur 'dug pa'i ngo bo ma yin
translated: Both of these are included by the phrase “in whatever way is appropriate.”🔽“They are worn as necklaces, bracelets, armlets, and strings of precious stones.”

original: pa la 'di dag la dngos gzhi'i byed pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i don du bzung ba'o //
analyzed: pa la 'di dag la dngos gzhi'i byed pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i don du bzung ba'o //
translated: This is stated to show that they are not the primary action, even though they are made of gold and silver and are worn in this way.🔽“The lute, flute, panava, and sughoṣa are played.”

original: pi wang dang gling bu dang ba la ri dang ma h'a ti dang su gho sha ka rnams ni rgyud dang bcas pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba ni rung bar gyur pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba ste 'dir thams cad du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: pi wang dang gling bu dang ba la ri dang ma h'a ti dang su gho sha ka rnams ni rgyud dang bcas pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba ni rung bar gyur pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba ste 'dir thams cad du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This means that they are used properly. This should be applied to all of these.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis po wang len na rgyud dang cas pa len na ltung byed du 'gyur la rgyud med pa len na ltung ba nyes pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis po wang len na rgyud dang cas pa len na ltung byed du 'gyur la rgyud med pa len na ltung ba nyes pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If a fully ordained monk takes up a lute, it becomes a downfall if it has strings, a minor offense if it does not have strings.

original: pi wang ji lta ba bzhin du gling bu dang bal ri dang ma h'a ti dang su gho sha ka yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: pi wang ji lta ba bzhin du gling bu dang bal ri dang ma h'a ti dang su gho sha ka yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: As with a lute, so it is with a flute, a guitar, a vīṇā, and a sughoṣa.

original: dung dang rnga po che dang rnga pa ta ha dang rdza rnga rnams ni sgra 'byin na'o zhes bya ba ni rung bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: dung dang rnga po che dang rnga pa ta ha dang rdza rnga rnams ni sgra 'byin na'o zhes bya ba ni rung bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: Conches, drums, paṭaha drums, and clay drums are permissible if they make sound.

original: gzhan ni rgyud dang bcas pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba ni rung bar gyur pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar 'jug go //
analyzed: gzhan ni rgyud dang bcas pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba ni rung bar gyur pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar 'jug go //
translated: Others are permissible if they have no strings.

original: ral gri dang ral gri khyog po dang ral gri so gcig pa dang ma dung dang 'phang mdung dang lcags kyu rnams ni de nyid yin na'o zhes bya ba ni ral gri la sogs pa rnams kyi de dag nyid yin na ral gri la sogs pa rung pa
analyzed: ral gri dang ral gri khyog po dang ral gri so gcig pa dang ma dung dang 'phang mdung dang lcags kyu rnams ni de nyid yin na'o zhes bya ba ni ral gri la sogs pa rnams kyi de dag nyid yin na ral gri la sogs pa rung pa
translated: The sword, the curved knife, the single-edged razor, the conch, the spear, and the hook are suitable if they are just that.

original: nyid la rung ba nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyid la rung ba nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are suitable if they are just swords, etc.

original: mda' dang lcags mda' dang mda' phyed lcags las byas pa rnams ni mde'u dang bcas pa nyid yin na'o zhes bya ba ni rung ba nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽sku gzugs ni sku gdung dag bcas pa nyid yin na'o zhes bya ba ni gang gis 'di 'dra ba de ni mtshon par byed pa rnams so //🔽'dir so sor nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: mda' dang lcags mda' dang mda' phyed lcags las byas pa rnams ni mde'u dang bcas pa nyid yin na'o zhes bya ba ni rung ba nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro // sku gzugs ni sku gdung dag bcas pa nyid yin na'o zhes bya ba ni gang gis 'di 'dra ba de ni mtshon par byed pa rnams so // 'dir so sor nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: The arrow, the iron arrow, and the half-arrow made of iron are suitable if they have a head.🔽The image is suitable if it has relics.🔽The meaning is that it is suitable if it is complete and has the relics.

original: sku gdung dang bcas pa nyid yin no yongs su rdzogs pa nyid de la so sor nye bar gzhan pa nyid do //
analyzed: sku gdung dang bcas pa nyid yin no yongs su rdzogs pa nyid de la so sor nye bar gzhan pa nyid do //
translated: Here, the meaning is that it is suitable if it is complete and has the relics.

original: nye bar dgos pa nyid la 'di'i ngo bo nyid ltar sku gdung dang bcas pa'i sku gzugs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar dgos pa nyid la 'di'i ngo bo nyid ltar sku gdung dang bcas pa'i sku gzugs bstan pa'o //
translated: The essential nature of the offense is the same as before, except that here the image is one that contains relics.

original: rin po che'i rnag bzhin nyid la sku gdung dang bcas pa nyid ni kha na ma tho ba yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: rin po che'i rnag bzhin nyid la sku gdung dang bcas pa nyid ni kha na ma tho ba yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: If it is made of precious materials, but does not contain relics, it is a serious violation.

original: sku gdungs dang bcas pa ma yin na nyes byas so //
analyzed: sku gdungs dang bcas pa ma yin na nyes byas so //
translated: If it does not contain relics, it is a minor offense.

original: rin po che'i rnag bzhin ma yin pa nyid la sku gdung dang bcas pa nyid na ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: rin po che'i rnag bzhin ma yin pa nyid la sku gdung dang bcas pa nyid na ni nyes byas so //
translated: If it is not made of precious materials, but does contain relics, it is a minor offense.

original: sku gdung med pa nyid la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: sku gdung med pa nyid la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: If it does not contain relics, there is no offense.

original: 'dir lci ba yongs su spang ba'i don du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba 'dir rnams par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir lci ba yongs su spang ba'i don du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba 'dir rnams par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, in order to avoid the heavy offense, the mindfulness that is to be applied should be understood as follows:

original: mchod rten rin po che las byas pa la ni dgos pa nyid med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mchod rten rin po che las byas pa la ni dgos pa nyid med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: In the case of a stūpa made of precious materials, it is not that there is no need for care.

original: de bas na @252a * //
analyzed: de bas na @252a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: 'dir yang rin po che'i rnag bzhi dang sku gdung dang bcas pa nyid dag la ltung byed do //
analyzed: 'dir yang rin po che'i rnag bzhi dang sku gdung dang bcas pa nyid dag la ltung byed do //
translated: here too, if it is made of precious materials and contains relics, it is a serious offense.

original: gang yang rung ba gcig ma tshang na ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba rtogs par bya'o //🔽nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs dang sku gdung dang bcas pa nyid la ni de dag gi sku gdung dang bcas pa yang rung /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba gcig ma tshang na ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba rtogs par bya'o // nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs dang sku gdung dang bcas pa nyid la ni de dag gi sku gdung dang bcas pa yang rung /
translated: If any one of these is incomplete, it is a minor offense.🔽The images of the disciples and solitary enlightened ones, together with their relics,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku gdung dang bcas pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku gdung dang bcas pa yang rung ste /
translated: whether or not they are the relics of those disciples and solitary enlightened ones,

original: nyes byas su 'gyur ba nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: nyes byas su 'gyur ba nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: should be understood to be a minor offense.

original: sred med kyi bu la sogs pa'i gzugs rin po che las byas pa nyid ma yin pa sku gdung dang bcas pa nyid ni de dag gi rus pa dang bcas pa yang rung sangs rgyas kyi sku gdung dang bcas pa yang rung ste nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sred med kyi bu la sogs pa'i gzugs rin po che las byas pa nyid ma yin pa sku gdung dang bcas pa nyid ni de dag gi rus pa dang bcas pa yang rung sangs rgyas kyi sku gdung dang bcas pa yang rung ste nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the images of Narayana and so on are not made of precious substances, or if they are made of precious substances but are not images of the Buddha, or if they are images of the Buddha but are not made of precious substances.

original: rin po che las byas pa nyid yin na ni rdzas tsam gyi dbang las nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rin po che las byas pa nyid yin na ni rdzas tsam gyi dbang las nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are made of precious substances, then it is a minor offense due to the value of the materials.

original: de la ston pa'i 'du shes nye bar gzhag na nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni sku gzugs de dag la ston pa'i 'du shes nye bar bzhag ste /
analyzed: de la ston pa'i 'du shes nye bar gzhag na nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni sku gzugs de dag la ston pa'i 'du shes nye bar bzhag ste /
translated: This means that if one places the idea of the Teacher in front of those images,

original: reg gam reg tu bcug pa ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: reg gam reg tu bcug pa ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: there is no offense in touching them or causing them to be touched.

original: nor bu mching bu dang sogs ma'i phreng ba dang mchu sgreng dang rdza rnga kha cig pa dang gzhu dang mda' ltar bcos pa rnams ni phyed nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nor bu mching bu dang sogs ma'i phreng ba dang mchu sgreng dang rdza rnga kha cig pa dang gzhu dang mda' ltar bcos pa rnams ni phyed nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those fashioned like a cat’s eye gem, a garland, a beak, a one-sided clay drum, a bow, or an arrow are half.

original: mda' ltar bcos pa zhes bya ba ni ltos la sogs pa dang sbyar bas mda' rnam pa nyid du nye bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: mda' ltar bcos pa zhes bya ba ni ltos la sogs pa dang sbyar bas mda' rnam pa nyid du nye bar gyur pa ste /
translated: Those fashioned like an arrow are half because they are connected with the word “like” in the root text.

original: shing bu la sogs pa dag las ltong tsam btod cing 'ol byi tsam mda' 'dra ba byas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shing bu la sogs pa dag las ltong tsam btod cing 'ol byi tsam mda' 'dra ba byas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that they are made from sticks and so on, with a hole bored through them like an arrow, and with a notch cut in one end like a bow.

original: 'dir mching bu la sogs pa'i tshig ni dpe tsam du zad de /
analyzed: 'dir mching bu la sogs pa'i tshig ni dpe tsam du zad de /
translated: Here the words “cat’s eye gem” and so on are merely examples.

original: sa las byas pa'i nor du bdag kyang phyed nyid de nyes byas su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sa las byas pa'i nor du bdag kyang phyed nyid de nyes byas su rig par bya'o //
translated: And if it is made of earth, it is half a fault.

original: gser gyi stegs bu ni mi rung ba nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gser gyi stegs bu ni mi rung ba nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not proper to use gold.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu nyid ni mkho ba'i yo byad du gyur pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu nyid ni mkho ba'i yo byad du gyur pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: This kind is not proper to use as a necessary article.

original: gang zhig 'di la stegs bu la sogs pa nye bar mkho pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig 'di la stegs bu la sogs pa nye bar mkho pa'o //
translated: What is necessary for this is a platform, etc.

original: mi rung ba nyid la grub pas thams cad du gyur pa'i yongs su grub pa'i don la'o //
analyzed: mi rung ba nyid la grub pas thams cad du gyur pa'i yongs su grub pa'i don la'o //
translated: It is not proper to use it, because it is established as not proper. The meaning of “established” is “all-pervading.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las dge slong gser gyi stegs bu la 'dug na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las dge slong gser gyi stegs bu la 'dug na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, in some texts it is said that if a bhikṣu sits on a gold platform, it is a fault.

original: 'jigs par gyur na rang gi la mi gnod na dge 'dun gyi dang mchod rten gyi dbyig dang gser sbas sam khyer te 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhung kha cig las 'dir sbas nas khyer te 'gro bar bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'jigs par gyur na rang gi la mi gnod na dge 'dun gyi dang mchod rten gyi dbyig dang gser sbas sam khyer te 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhung kha cig las 'dir sbas nas khyer te 'gro bar bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: If there is danger, if it does not harm oneself, one should hide or take the wealth and gold of the saṅgha or stūpa and go. In some texts it is said that one should hide it here and take it and go.

original: gzhan du ni dge slong gis 'dun gyi mi zad pa'i gter khyer te /
analyzed: gzhan du ni dge slong gis 'dun gyi mi zad pa'i gter khyer te /
translated: Otherwise, a monk may carry the Sangha's inexhaustible treasure to a layman or novice.

original: khyim pa dang dge tshul dag la byin pa dang de dag gis khyer ste bros @252b nas /
analyzed: khyim pa dang dge tshul dag la byin pa dang de dag gis khyer ste bros @252b nas /
translated: If they carry it and flee,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽khyim pa yid ches pa ma yin pa la khyim pa'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / khyim pa yid ches pa ma yin pa la khyim pa'am /
translated: the Bhagavan said:

original: dge tshul la dge 'dun gyi mi zad pa'i gter rnams lag tu sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge tshul la dge 'dun gyi mi zad pa'i gter rnams lag tu sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: Do not give the Sangha's inexhaustible treasure into the hands of a layman or novice who is not trustworthy.

original: gal te yid ches par gyur na ni sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te yid ches par gyur na ni sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If they become trustworthy, then give it to them.

original: 'on te yid ches par ma gyur na dge slong rang gis khyer te 'gro bar bya zhing gang gi tshe gtsug lag khang de nyid na gnas pa yin na de'i tshe de nyid du sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te yid ches par ma gyur na dge slong rang gis khyer te 'gro bar bya zhing gang gi tshe gtsug lag khang de nyid na gnas pa yin na de'i tshe de nyid du sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If they are not trustworthy, then the monk should carry it himself. If he lives in that very monastery, then at that time he should give it to them.

original: 'on te gtsug lag khang pa zhig na gnas pa ma yin na gtsug lag khang de nyid du gzhag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te gtsug lag khang pa zhig na gnas pa ma yin na gtsug lag khang de nyid du gzhag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If he does not live in that monastery, then he should keep it in that very monastery.

original: der gnyis ka ltar yang ji ltar nye bar dgos par gyur pa rtogs pa phyir 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: der gnyis ka ltar yang ji ltar nye bar dgos par gyur pa rtogs pa phyir 'thad pa yin no //
translated: In this case, it is reasonable to understand that both are necessary.

original: de bas na de gnyis ka yang 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de gnyis ka yang 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, both are included in this.🔽If it does not harm oneself, means if it is not harmful to oneself to conceal what should be concealed for the sake of the Saṅgha or a stūpa, then one should not do it.

original: rang gi la mi gnod na zhes bya ba ni gal te dge 'dun nam mchod rten gyi sba par bya ba la bdag nyid kyi don la mi sba par khyer ba dang ma khyer bar gnod par gyur na ni de lta bu mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don
analyzed: rang gi la mi gnod na zhes bya ba ni gal te dge 'dun nam mchod rten gyi sba par bya ba la bdag nyid kyi don la mi sba par khyer ba dang ma khyer bar gnod par gyur na ni de lta bu mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don
translated: The meaning is that it should not be done.

original: to // rang gi la zhes bya ba ni chos dang ldan pa de'i'o //
analyzed: to // rang gi la zhes bya ba ni chos dang ldan pa de'i'o //
translated: One's own means that of the one who possesses the Dharma.

original: gang zhig med par lus gnas pa'am chos sgrub pa la gnod par 'gyur ba rmongs pa'i yo byad la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba shugs kyis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig med par lus gnas pa'am chos sgrub pa la gnod par 'gyur ba rmongs pa'i yo byad la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba shugs kyis shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood by implication that it is not for the sake of confused articles that harm the body or the practice of the Dharma.

original: dge 'dun gyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the Saṅgha,

original: 'dir gzhung ni der dge slong rnams kyis dge 'dun gyi mi zad pa'i gter rnams khyer ba dang / de dag gi lhung bzed dang chos gos dang 'khyams nas skabs de dge slong dag gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni der dge slong rnams kyis dge 'dun gyi mi zad pa'i gter rnams khyer ba dang / de dag gi lhung bzed dang chos gos dang 'khyams nas skabs de dge slong dag gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: de ltar mi bya ste gang zag ni phongs par 'gyur gyi dge 'dun ni mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir dge slong gis dang por rang gi lhung bzed dang chos gos bskur bar bya zhing gal te bsrung bar nus na phyis dge 'dun gyi la yang 'bad par bya'o
analyzed: de ltar mi bya ste gang zag ni phongs par 'gyur gyi dge 'dun ni mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir dge slong gis dang por rang gi lhung bzed dang chos gos bskur bar bya zhing gal te bsrung bar nus na phyis dge 'dun gyi la yang 'bad par bya'o
translated: “Do not do that. The individual will be poor, but the Saṅgha will not be. Therefore, a monk should first give his own bowl and robes. If he can protect them, later he should also strive for the Saṅgha’s.”

original: // mchod rten gyi la yang zhes bya ba ni de yang gang du sbas nas 'gro ba klog pa las der gsungs pa ring ba nyid kyi phyir 'dir ma brtags so //
analyzed: // mchod rten gyi la yang zhes bya ba ni de yang gang du sbas nas 'gro ba klog pa las der gsungs pa ring ba nyid kyi phyir 'dir ma brtags so //
translated: “Also the stūpa’s” means that since it is far away, it is not considered here.

original: byed par gyur pa gang gis sbas nas sam khyer te 'gro zhe na /
analyzed: byed par gyur pa gang gis sbas nas sam khyer te 'gro zhe na /
translated: By what means does one hide and go?

original: de'i phyir dad pa can gyis te 'di pa'i rab tu byung ba ma yin pa la 'di bzung ba zhes bya ba 'og nas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dad pa can gyis te 'di pa'i rab tu byung ba ma yin pa la 'di bzung ba zhes bya ba 'og nas shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood from the following.🔽A novice should do it, because he has faith in the vows themselves and has made them limitless.

original: dge tshul gyis so zhes bya ba ni sdom pa nyid la dad pas de'i gnas las mtha' yas par byas pa nyid 'dis ni dad pa can zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge tshul gyis so zhes bya ba ni sdom pa nyid la dad pas de'i gnas las mtha' yas par byas pa nyid 'dis ni dad pa can zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: This shows that one who has faith should do it.

original: med na rang gis so zhes bya ba ni /🔽de gnyis gcig kyang med na rang gis sbas sam @253a * //
analyzed: med na rang gis so zhes bya ba ni / de gnyis gcig kyang med na rang gis sbas sam @253a * //
translated: If neither is available, one should do it oneself.

original: khyer te 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyer te 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: If neither of those two is available, one should conceal it oneself or carry it and go.

original: der bsko bar bya ba ni /
analyzed: der bsko bar bya ba ni /
translated: One should appoint someone there.

original: sba ba dang bskur bar bya ste 'dzin par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sba ba dang bskur bar bya ste 'dzin par sbyor ba'o //
translated: One should conceal it and appoint someone to guard it.

original: der bsko ba yang 'di dang shin tu zhan pa nyid kyi phyir 'gro ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: der bsko ba yang 'di dang shin tu zhan pa nyid kyi phyir 'gro ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Since the one appointed there is much weaker than the one who has faith, he should go.🔽If one is separated from it, one should give it.

original: bral na sbyin no zhes bya ba ni 'dir bral na sbas pa'am khyer ba de nyid du sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: bral na sbyin no zhes bya ba ni 'dir bral na sbas pa'am khyer ba de nyid du sbyin pa'o //
translated: If one is separated from it, one should give it to the one who concealed it or carried it.

original: bru ba yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sbas te khyer nas ba de bzhin du dad pa can nam /
analyzed: bru ba yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sbas te khyer nas ba de bzhin du dad pa can nam /
translated: The same applies to digging.

original: dge tshul gyis bru ba'o //
analyzed: dge tshul gyis bru ba'o //
translated: Just as one carries off having hidden, so too a faithful one or a novice digs.

original: ji srid du de gnyis med na rang gis so //
analyzed: ji srid du de gnyis med na rang gis so //
translated: As long as those two do not exist, one should do it oneself.

original: mi ma yin pa'i gnas na gnas te de dag gi bsod nams kyis byung ba rin po che'i rang bzhin gyis gzhi dang them skas la sogs pa la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni de dang 'dra ba'i 'jig rten sgrub par byed pa'i bsod nams
analyzed: mi ma yin pa'i gnas na gnas te de dag gi bsod nams kyis byung ba rin po che'i rang bzhin gyis gzhi dang them skas la sogs pa la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni de dang 'dra ba'i 'jig rten sgrub par byed pa'i bsod nams
translated: There is no offense if one is in a place inhabited by nonhumans and the stairs and so on are made of precious substances arisen from the merit of those nonhumans.

original: ni 'dir rig par bya ste gzhan rnams la ni ma yin no //🔽zan gyi phyir snod gzhan med na rin po che la sogs pa yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ni 'dir rig par bya ste gzhan rnams la ni ma yin no // zan gyi phyir snod gzhan med na rin po che la sogs pa yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: The merit that creates such a world should be understood here, but not the merit of others.🔽If one has no other vessel for food, one may use precious substances and so on.🔽The word also indicates that if one has no other vessel for food, one may use precious substances and so on.

original: yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni skyon med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di med pa la gzhan med na zhes bya pa'i gnas na gal te de dag gi bsod nams kyis byung ba'i de rnams kyi /
analyzed: yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni skyon med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di med pa la gzhan med na zhes bya pa'i gnas na gal te de dag gi bsod nams kyis byung ba'i de rnams kyi /
translated: If one has no other vessel for food, one may use precious substances and so on.

original: rin po che'i rang bzhin la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyeg pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rin po che'i rang bzhin la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyeg pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no fault in the nature of jewels.

original: 'dug pa'i phyir gnas mal yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dug pa'i phyir gnas mal yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: And also bedding, because it is used.

original: yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni skyon med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di med pa la gzhan med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rjes bsnyeg pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni skyon med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di med pa la gzhan med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rjes bsnyeg pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word also is stated because it is a continuation of the phrase, if there is no fault, etc.

original: 'dir gzhung ni ko lpags kyi gzhi las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni ko lpags kyi gzhi las /
translated: Here is the text of the basis of training on leather:

original: dge slong dag lha dang klu'i gnas dag tu 'gro ba na der rin po che'i rang bzhin gyi gdan rnams rnyed par gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong dag lha dang klu'i gnas dag tu 'gro ba na der rin po che'i rang bzhin gyi gdan rnams rnyed par gyur te /
translated: Monks who go to the abodes of gods and nagas find cushions made of precious substances.

original: de rnams la 'dug par mi byed cing /
analyzed: de rnams la 'dug par mi byed cing /
translated: They do not sit on them.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavan said,

original: de dag ni sems can de rnams kyi bsod nams las byung ba yin pas de rnams la 'dug dpar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni sems can de rnams kyi bsod nams las byung ba yin pas de rnams la 'dug dpar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Since they arise from the merit of those sentient beings, you should sit on them.”

original: gal te yang gzhan la med pa zhes bya ba 'dir mi 'dod na de ltar yang 'di ni rigs par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gal te yang gzhan la med pa zhes bya ba 'dir mi 'dod na de ltar yang 'di ni rigs par gyur pa ste /
translated: If you do not accept that the absence of another is the basis of the expression “this,” then this is reasonable:

original: de bas na brten pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na brten pa'o //
translated: “Therefore, it is dependent.”

original: bzhon pas 'gro bar bya'o /
analyzed: bzhon pas 'gro bar bya'o /
translated: “One should go by means of a vehicle.”

original: chos dang ldan pa'i chos nyid kyi dbang nyid kyis so ;
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i chos nyid kyi dbang nyid kyis so ;
translated: “By the power of the nature of things that is endowed with the Dharma.”

original: / de la yang cha sgeg pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis mi bya'o //
analyzed: / de la yang cha sgeg pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis mi bya'o //
translated: “And one should not do it by means of the power of one’s own body that is endowed with beauty.”🔽“One should not do it by means of someone other than an old or sick person.”

original: rgas pa dang na ba dag las gzhan pas mi bya ba ni ko lpags kyi phran tshegs rnams las 'di skad ces gsungs te /
analyzed: rgas pa dang na ba dag las gzhan pas mi bya ba ni ko lpags kyi phran tshegs rnams las 'di skad ces gsungs te /
translated: In the Minor Points on Leather, it says:

original: chos nyan du gzhug pa'i phyir rin po che las byas pa'i seng ge'i khri la mi rtag pas nyes par gyur pa'i yid la byed pas 'dug par bya'o @253b zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos nyan du gzhug pa'i phyir rin po che las byas pa'i seng ge'i khri la mi rtag pas nyes par gyur pa'i yid la byed pas 'dug par bya'o @253b zhes bya ba la /
translated: “In order to make someone listen to the Dharma, one should sit on a lion throne made of precious substances, with a mental focus on the faults of impermanence.”

original: chos bsgrag pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'dug cing nyan pa po rnams la chos bsgrags par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don la brten nas gnas mal gyi bslab pa'i gzhi la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: chos bsgrag pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'dug cing nyan pa po rnams la chos bsgrags par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don la brten nas gnas mal gyi bslab pa'i gzhi la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The phrase “for the purpose of proclaiming the Dharma” means that the Buddha taught the rules on seats and beds and so on in dependence on the purpose of proclaiming the Dharma to those who are seated and listening.

original: de la sogs pa'i rdzas kyang zhes bya ba'i mtha' can 'dir drangs pa'o //
analyzed: de la sogs pa'i rdzas kyang zhes bya ba'i mtha' can 'dir drangs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “and so on” at the end of the verse refers to other such things.🔽The text continues:

original: 'dir gzhung ni de nas khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyis thos nas rin po che sna bzhi las byas pa'i seng ge'i khri bshams pa dang dge slong de dag de la mi 'khod nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni de nas khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin gyis thos nas rin po che sna bzhi las byas pa'i seng ge'i khri bshams pa dang dge slong de dag de la mi 'khod nas /
translated: Then the householder Anathapindada prepared lion thrones made of the four precious substances, but the monks did not sit on them.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said:

original: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag go snyam du bsams nas de la 'dug nas chos bshad par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag go snyam du bsams nas de la 'dug nas chos bshad par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Think that all conditioned things are impermanent and then sit on them and teach the Dharma.”

original: khyim du de bshams pa dang gser dang dngul gyis spras pa dril bu g-yer kha gshibs pa'i gos dag la khyim pa'i yin no snyam du shes par byas nas kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khyim du de bshams pa dang gser dang dngul gyis spras pa dril bu g-yer kha gshibs pa'i gos dag la khyim pa'i yin no snyam du shes par byas nas kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having understood that the householders' robes are those set up in the home, which are woven with gold and silver and are draped with small golden bells, one should sit there.

original: kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mi rtag pas nyen par gyur pa yid la byed pas 'dug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i rjes snyeg pa'i phyir ro snyam du shes par byas nas zhes bya ba ni khyim pa'i yin no snyam du shes par byas nas so //
analyzed: kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mi rtag pas nyen par gyur pa yid la byed pas 'dug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i rjes snyeg pa'i phyir ro snyam du shes par byas nas zhes bya ba ni khyim pa'i yin no snyam du shes par byas nas so //
translated: The word also is to be understood as following the phrase one should sit there, having brought to mind the impermanence of compounded phenomena.🔽Here, the text is as follows: The faithful brahmins and householders set up in their homes robes woven with gold and silver and draped with small golden bells.

original: 'dir gzhung ni bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can rnams kyis khyim gyi nang du gser gyis spras pa gser gyi dril bu g-yer khas gshibs pa'i gos dag bshams pa dang / dge slong dag de la mi 'khod nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can rnams kyis khyim gyi nang du gser gyis spras pa gser gyi dril bu g-yer khas gshibs pa'i gos dag bshams pa dang / dge slong dag de la mi 'khod nas /
translated: When the monks did not sit on them,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: the Blessed One said:

original: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag go snyam du bsams te /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag go snyam du bsams te /
translated: One should sit there, having contemplated that all compounded phenomena are impermanent.

original: sbyin pa po rnams kyis sbyin par bya ba'i chos rnams la yongs su longs spyod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa po rnams kyis sbyin par bya ba'i chos rnams la yongs su longs spyod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The donors should enjoy the objects of giving.

original: de la nor bus spras pa gser dang dngul gyis brgyan pa dag la yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la nor bus spras pa gser dang dngul gyis brgyan pa dag la yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: There, even those adorned with jewels, gold, and silver are said to be those.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni seng ge'i khri de la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni seng ge'i khri de la'o //
translated: There means on that lion throne.

original: de lta bu'i gos dag la 'dug pa 'di ni de'u re mi rtag pas nyen par gyur pa yin no snyam pa'i yid la byed pas 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gos dag la 'dug pa 'di ni de'u re mi rtag pas nyen par gyur pa yin no snyam pa'i yid la byed pas 'dug par bya'o //
translated: One should sit there with the thought, This is impermanent, and so is the danger.

original: 'di ltar seng ge'i khri'i cho ga la grub pa med de dngos su yang bye brag 'di la khyad par gyi gzhung yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar seng ge'i khri'i cho ga la grub pa med de dngos su yang bye brag 'di la khyad par gyi gzhung yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no rule for the lion throne, and there is no special text for this.

original: 'di bstan pa'i phyir mdo 'di byas so //
analyzed: 'di bstan pa'i phyir mdo 'di byas so //
translated: This is taught in this sutra.

original: de dag grub par bya'o 'do zhes bya ba ni seng ge'i khri la gos rnam pa de lta bu bshams pa de dag go //
analyzed: de dag grub par bya'o 'do zhes bya ba ni seng ge'i khri la gos rnam pa de lta bu bshams pa de dag go //
translated: Those should be accomplished means those various kinds of cloth arranged on the lion throne.

original: khyim pa dang dge tshul med na sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs la ston pa'i 'du shes nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyis chos dang ldan pa'i don gyi dbang nyid kyis reg pa la mi rung ba med do @254a * //
analyzed: khyim pa dang dge tshul med na sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs la ston pa'i 'du shes nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyis chos dang ldan pa'i don gyi dbang nyid kyis reg pa la mi rung ba med do @254a * //
translated: If there are no householders or novices, there is no fault in touching the image of the Buddha, because one has the perception of the Teacher.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dir rin po che yang sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs brjod par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dir rin po che yang sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs brjod par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Here, the precious image of the Buddha is meant.

original: de'i rdzas la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs de'i rdzas dang rgyan la sogs pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i rdzas la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs de'i rdzas dang rgyan la sogs pa la yang ngo //
translated: Also, its substances means also the substances and ornaments of that image of the Buddha.

original: rgyan gdags pa brten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la 'dir gzhung ni de lta bas na dge slong gis rgyan dang rkang rgyan gdags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rgyan gdags pa brten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la 'dir gzhung ni de lta bas na dge slong gis rgyan dang rkang rgyan gdags par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not wear ornaments means that in this case, the text says, “Therefore, a monk should not wear ornaments or anklets.

original: 'dogs na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dogs na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If he wears them, he becomes guilty of an offense.

original: de bzhin du tshon sna lnga'i sngags skud gdags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshon sna lnga'i sngags skud gdags par mi bya'o //
translated: Similarly, he should not wear a five-colored mantra thread.

original: 'dogs na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dogs na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If he wears it, he becomes guilty of an offense.”

original: rgyan 'dogs pa 'di la rgyan de thams cad ni dpe tsam yin gyi 'di thams cad bcang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyan 'dogs pa 'di la rgyan de thams cad ni dpe tsam yin gyi 'di thams cad bcang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ston par byed pa'o //
translated: This ornament is merely an example; it is not to be worn.

original: 'di ni rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not naturally reprehensible.

original: de bas na de bsrung ba'i don du srung skud 'di tshon lnga'i rang bzhin can ni mi bya bar shes par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de bsrung ba'i don du srung skud 'di tshon lnga'i rang bzhin can ni mi bya bar shes par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not to be understood that this protection cord, which is of five colors, is not to be made for the purpose of protecting that.

original: phran tshegs dag las de la sogs pa 'dir rung ba zhes bya ba'i phyir mthar 'di drangs pa'o //
analyzed: phran tshegs dag las de la sogs pa 'dir rung ba zhes bya ba'i phyir mthar 'di drangs pa'o //
translated: In the Ksudraka Collection, it is said, “That and so forth are suitable here,” and so this is cited at the end.

original: ma mo las kyang nyan thos kyis kyang dor na zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ma mo las kyang nyan thos kyis kyang dor na zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In the Mātṛkā, it says, “If it is discarded by the śrāvakas.”

original: rgyan bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyan bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: “The ornament is to be worn.”

original: rgyan rnam pa ji lta bu zhig ce na /🔽de yi phyir gdags su mi rung ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyan rnam pa ji lta bu zhig ce na / de yi phyir gdags su mi rung ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: What kind of ornament?🔽Therefore, it is said, “it is not suitable to be designated.”

original: gdags par mi 'os pa dang mi rung ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gdags par mi 'os pa dang mi rung ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not suitable to be designated; it is not suitable.

original: rang bzhin gang las byas she na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gang las byas she na /
translated: What is the nature of the material from which they are made?

original: de'i phyir ro nye'am zangs ma'am ra gan nam khar ba'am rgya skyegs kyi tshigs ma'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir ro nye'am zangs ma'am ra gan nam khar ba'am rgya skyegs kyi tshigs ma'am /
translated: Therefore it says, “made from bone, ivory, or horn,

original: shing ngam rdo 'am sa 'am ba so 'am rva dag rnams las byas pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: shing ngam rdo 'am sa 'am ba so 'am rva dag rnams las byas pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: or from wood, stone, clay, or bamboo.”

original: 'di'i gzhung ni gzhung kha cig las dge slong gis gser dang dngul dang bee d'urya dad shel gyi rang bzhin las byas pa'i rgya rnams bcang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i gzhung ni gzhung kha cig las dge slong gis gser dang dngul dang bee d'urya dad shel gyi rang bzhin las byas pa'i rgya rnams bcang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Some texts say, “A monk should not wear rings made from gold, silver, beryl, or crystal.

original: sor gdub kyi rgyan yang bcang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: sor gdub kyi rgyan yang bcang bar mi bya'o //
translated: He should not wear finger rings.

original: 'on kyang 'dir rgyan ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir rgyan ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: However, here there are five types of ornaments:

original: ra gan las byas pa dang zangs ma las byas pa dang / khar ba las byas pa dang ba so las byas pa dang rva las byas ba'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ra gan las byas pa dang zangs ma las byas pa dang / khar ba las byas pa dang ba so las byas pa dang rva las byas ba'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: made from brass, copper, pewter, clay, or horn.”

original: gzhan du ni dge slong gis ji srid gser las byas pa'i bar du bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ni dge slong gis ji srid gser las byas pa'i bar du bcang bar bya'o //
translated: In other texts it says, “A monk may wear rings made from any material up to gold.

original: 'on kyang rgyan rnam pa brgyad po ro nye dang zangs dang ra gan dang khar ba dang rgya skyegs kyi tshigs ma dang shing dang rdo dang sa las byas pa bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyan rnam pa brgyad po ro nye dang zangs dang ra gan dang khar ba dang rgya skyegs kyi tshigs ma dang shing dang rdo dang sa las byas pa bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: However, the eight ornaments should be made of tin, copper, brass, bronze, lac, wood, stone, or clay.

original: de la rin po che @254b las gzhan pa'i rdzas kyi dpe yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus nas byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rin po che @254b las gzhan pa'i rdzas kyi dpe yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus nas byas pa yin no //
translated: Here, the substance other than precious substances is an example.

original: rtags ni dge 'dun gyi la ni dbus su 'khor lo //
analyzed: rtags ni dge 'dun gyi la ni dbus su 'khor lo //
translated: The sign of the Saṅgha’s is a wheel in the middle,

original: ngos gnyis su ri dags /
analyzed: ngos gnyis su ri dags /
translated: with two mountains on the sides,

original: 'og tu gtsug lag khang gi bdag po'i ming bri'o //
analyzed: 'og tu gtsug lag khang gi bdag po'i ming bri'o //
translated: and below, the name of the owner of the monastery is written.

original: gang zag gi la ni rus pa'i keng rus sam mgo'i thod pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag gi la ni rus pa'i keng rus sam mgo'i thod pa'o //
translated: The individual’s is a skeleton or a skull.🔽One should not shave the head with a razor.

original: so mangs kyis skra bshad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni longs pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir rnam pa 'di 'jug pa dngos po'i rnam par yang 'dir dngos po zhes bya ba 'di zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: so mangs kyis skra bshad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni longs pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir rnam pa 'di 'jug pa dngos po'i rnam par yang 'dir dngos po zhes bya ba 'di zhugs pa'o //
translated: Here, the word “thing” refers to the state of being an object of enjoyment. This form of engagement is also an engagement with the thing that is the object.

original: de ni dpe'o zhes bya ba ni so mangs zhes bya ba 'di ni gzhan sgrub par byed pa'i dpe yin te /
analyzed: de ni dpe'o zhes bya ba ni so mangs zhes bya ba 'di ni gzhan sgrub par byed pa'i dpe yin te /
translated: This is the example that proves the other.

original: gzhan gyis kyang mgo'i skra bshad pas mgo bshad par mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang mgo'i skra bshad pas mgo bshad par mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should not explain the head by explaining the hair of the head.

original: me long gis bzhin blta bar mi bya'o //🔽chu yan chad kyis so zhes bya ba ni tha na chu yan chad kyis kyang ste /
analyzed: me long gis bzhin blta bar mi bya'o // chu yan chad kyis so zhes bya ba ni tha na chu yan chad kyis kyang ste /
translated: One should not look at one's face in a mirror.🔽One should not look at one's face in water, etc.🔽The meaning is that one should not look at one's face in water, etc.,

original: chu yan chad nas til mar dang mar la sogs pa'i rdzas gzhan gyi bar man chad kyis kyang blta bar mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chu yan chad nas til mar dang mar la sogs pa'i rdzas gzhan gyi bar man chad kyis kyang blta bar mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: from water up to other substances such as sesame oil, butter, etc.🔽There is no offense if it is just for the purpose of examining water, or for the purpose of seeing moles, wrinkles, or gray hair, or for the purpose of remembering past signs.

original: chu brtag pa'i ched nyid dang rma dad gnyer ma dang skra dkar blta ba dang snga phyi'i mtshan ma bzung ba la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni chos dang ldan pa'i don gyi rgyu mtshan nyid gtso bo 'di yin te /
analyzed: chu brtag pa'i ched nyid dang rma dad gnyer ma dang skra dkar blta ba dang snga phyi'i mtshan ma bzung ba la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni chos dang ldan pa'i don gyi rgyu mtshan nyid gtso bo 'di yin te /
translated: This is the primary reason for the purpose of the Dharma.

original: 'dir mig gi dri ma la sogs pa la yang don yod par dgongs pas gnang du rung ba 'phangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir mig gi dri ma la sogs pa la yang don yod par dgongs pas gnang du rung ba 'phangs pa'o //
translated: Here, it is proper to allow the use of eye medicine, etc., because it is intended to have a purpose.

original: 'phral ris gsum bsten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'phral ris gsum bsten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not apply the three colors to the body.

original: 'dir gzhung ni phyogs de la 'di ni dper tsa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni phyogs de la 'di ni dper tsa ma yin te /
translated: Here, the text is just an example of that position.

original: de ltar rigs can gyi cha ni rang gis byas pa'am gzhan gyis byas pa rnam par 'byed pa bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rigs can gyi cha ni rang gis byas pa'am gzhan gyis byas pa rnam par 'byed pa bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the part of the class should not be distinguished as made by oneself or made by another.

original: de bas na dge slong gis 'phral ris gsum bsten par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dge slong gis 'phral ris gsum bsten par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that a monk should not apply the three colors to the body.

original: gi wang gis bsku ba bsten par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gi wang gis bsku ba bsten par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not apply a paste of realgar.

original: dri dag gis kyang mi bya'o zhes bya ba yang bsku bar mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dri dag gis kyang mi bya'o zhes bya ba yang bsku bar mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should not apply perfumes either.

original: gso ba'i ched du ni gi wang gis bsku ba bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gso ba'i ched du ni gi wang gis bsku ba bstan par bya'o //
translated: One should apply a paste of realgar for the purpose of healing.

original: gang zhig dris pas rjes su gnang ba de la gso ba'i ched nyid ma gtogs par gzhan ni khongs su bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig dris pas rjes su gnang ba de la gso ba'i ched nyid ma gtogs par gzhan ni khongs su bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: That which is allowed when asked should be understood to be included for the purpose of healing only.

original: bsod nams 'dod pas rkang pa gnyis la lus bsku ba'i dris skud pa bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams 'dod pas rkang pa gnyis la lus bsku ba'i dris skud pa bsten par bya'o //
translated: One who desires merit should apply the fragrant oil to the feet.

original: de'i mdun du dor bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i mdun du dor bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not discard it in front of him.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni sbyin bdag bsod nams 'dod pa de la cho ga gang yang 'di skud pa dang 'brel pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni sbyin bdag bsod nams 'dod pa de la cho ga gang yang 'di skud pa dang 'brel pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In front of him means in front of the donor who desires merit. There is no rule that this oil should be applied to the feet.

original: de nyid brjod par bya @255a * //
analyzed: de nyid brjod par bya @255a * //
translated: That should be stated.

original: te ; de dag bskus pa dge 'dun gyi nang du 'du bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: te ; de dag bskus pa dge 'dun gyi nang du 'du bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those who are anointed should not enter the Saṅgha.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni dri dag gis so //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni dri dag gis so //
translated: Those means the fragrant oils.

original: bskus pa zhes bya ba ni byugs pa'o //
analyzed: bskus pa zhes bya ba ni byugs pa'o //
translated: Anointed means smeared.

original: khyim bdag la chos bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag la chos bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not teach the Dharma to householders.

original: khyim dag tu 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: khyim dag tu 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not go to their houses.

original: mjug tu khrus bya'o //
analyzed: mjug tu khrus bya'o //
translated: One should bathe at the end.

original: de dag blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should accept those.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni dri de dag go //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni dri de dag go //
translated: Those means those fragrant oils.

original: pheng ba rgyu dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: pheng ba rgyu dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang blang bar bya'o //
translated: One should also accept the cloth and thread.

original: mchod rten la dbul bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mchod rten la dbul bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should offer them to a stupa means

original: dri dang phreng ba rgyu blangs pa de dag go //
analyzed: dri dang phreng ba rgyu blangs pa de dag go //
translated: that one should offer those perfumes and garlands that one has gathered.

original: su'i mchod rten la yin zhe na /
analyzed: su'i mchod rten la yin zhe na /
translated: To whose stupa?

original: de'i phyir nyan thos kyi la yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyan thos kyi la yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, even to a stupa of a disciple.

original: sangs rgyas kyi 'ba' zhig la dbul bar ma zad kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi 'ba' zhig la dbul bar ma zad kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should not only offer to a stupa of a Buddha.

original: sbyin par byed pa mngon par ma dad na mgo logs sam rkang pa logs su 'o zhes bya ba ni mchod rten la dbul ba sbyin par byed pa mngon par ma dad na rang gi mgo logs kyi sngas sam rkang pa logs kyi rten mar gzhag par bya'o
analyzed: sbyin par byed pa mngon par ma dad na mgo logs sam rkang pa logs su 'o zhes bya ba ni mchod rten la dbul ba sbyin par byed pa mngon par ma dad na rang gi mgo logs kyi sngas sam rkang pa logs kyi rten mar gzhag par bya'o
translated: If the one who is making the offering is not devoted, one should place the perfumes and garlands on one's own head or feet.

original: // ji ltar zhe na de'i phyir sgo'i byang tang ma yin par ro zhes bya ba smos so /
analyzed: // ji ltar zhe na de'i phyir sgo'i byang tang ma yin par ro zhes bya ba smos so /
translated: How? Therefore, it says, not on the threshold.

original: 'dir gzhi gang la dbul ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir gzhi gang la dbul ba yin zhe na /
translated: Here, one might ask, Where should one place the perfumes and garlands?

original: de'i phyir rtsig pa zhes bya ba smos te phreng ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtsig pa zhes bya ba smos te phreng ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it says, on a wall, that is, on a fence.

original: de la dmigs kyis bsal bar gyur pa'i cho ga gzhan brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs kyis bsal bar gyur pa'i cho ga gzhan brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, another rite should be stated, which is an exception to that.

original: der khab bam tsher ma btsugs pa la phreng ba brgyus pa dag dpyang bar bya'o zhes bya ba der zhes bya ba ni rtsig pa'i ngos bstan pa la ste phyed brkos pa la 'jug pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: der khab bam tsher ma btsugs pa la phreng ba brgyus pa dag dpyang bar bya'o zhes bya ba der zhes bya ba ni rtsig pa'i ngos bstan pa la ste phyed brkos pa la 'jug pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: There, a rosary should be hung on a pin or a thorn.  There indicates the wall surface that is taught, and means inserted into a half-dug hole.

original: tsher ma btsugs pa la zhes bya ba ni phyed btsugs pa la'o //
analyzed: tsher ma btsugs pa la zhes bya ba ni phyed btsugs pa la'o //
translated: On a pin or a thorn means on a half-inserted [pin or thorn].

original: mig la phan pa'i dri zhim po dus dus su bsnam par bya'o zhes bya ba ni cho ga 'di ni gnyis ka dang 'brel par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mig la phan pa'i dri zhim po dus dus su bsnam par bya'o zhes bya ba ni cho ga 'di ni gnyis ka dang 'brel par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should smell the fragrant eye-beneficial [incense] from time to time. This rite should be known as connected with both [the wall and the rosary].

original: bram ze srad bu thogs pa bsten par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bram ze srad bu thogs pa bsten par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not rely on a brahmin wearing a string.

original: sngags skud kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni sngags skud thogs pa bsten par mid bya'o zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngags skud kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni sngags skud thogs pa bsten par mid bya'o zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Also a mantra thread.  Also a mantra thread should be connected as one should not rely on one wearing a mantra thread.

original: byas pa nyid la ni gso ba'i phyir rjes su gnang ba la brtan nas gnas kyi bye brag bstan pa ni gso ba'i phyir ni dpung ba g-yon par ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: byas pa nyid la ni gso ba'i phyir rjes su gnang ba la brtan nas gnas kyi bye brag bstan pa ni gso ba'i phyir ni dpung ba g-yon par ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: For the sake of healing, he should rely on the permission and teach the distinctions of the place. For the sake of healing, he should wear the mantra thread on his left arm.

original: sngags skud thogs pa yang bsten par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sngags skud thogs pa yang bsten par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: He should also wear the mantra thread.

original: gar bab bab tu ni mi dor zhes bya ba ni sos par gyur nas sngags skud de'o //🔽gal te lhag ma dang bcas par gyur na chos gos kyi tha ma'am /
analyzed: gar bab bab tu ni mi dor zhes bya ba ni sos par gyur nas sngags skud de'o // gal te lhag ma dang bcas par gyur na chos gos kyi tha ma'am /
translated: He should not discard it at will.🔽If it becomes worn, he should attach it to the end of his Dharma robe,

original: ska rags la gdags so zhes bya ba la /🔽gal te lhag @255b ma dang bcas par gyur na zhes bya ba ni gnang ngo //🔽gal te ma gyur na ka ba'am /🔽rtsig pa'i gseb tu gzhug ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ska rags la gdags so zhes bya ba la / gal te lhag @255b ma dang bcas par gyur na zhes bya ba ni gnang ngo // gal te ma gyur na ka ba'am / rtsig pa'i gseb tu gzhug ces bya ba la /
translated: or to his belt.🔽If it becomes worn, he should attach it to the end of his Dharma robe,🔽or to his belt.🔽If it becomes worn, he should attach it to the end of his Dharma robe,

original: gal te ma gyur na zhes bya ba ni lhag ma dang bcas par ro //
analyzed: gal te ma gyur na zhes bya ba ni lhag ma dang bcas par ro //
translated: or to his belt.🔽If it becomes worn, he should attach it to the end of his Dharma robe,

original: rtsig pa'i gseb tu zhes bya ba ni de'i nang du'o //
analyzed: rtsig pa'i gseb tu zhes bya ba ni de'i nang du'o //
translated: or to his belt.

original: gar dang glu dang rol mo kun du spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gar dang glu dang rol mo kun du spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not engage in dance, song, or music.

original: bslab par mi bya'o ;
analyzed: bslab par mi bya'o ;
translated: One should not train in them.

original: / bzlas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: / bzlas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not recite them.

original: lta ba'i phyir 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i phyir 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not go to see them.🔽One should not allow a nun to dance.

original: dge slong ma kun du gar byed du mi gzhug go zhes bya ba ni gar nas brtsams te dge slong mas mi bya'o //🔽dge slong ma gar byed du mi gzhug go zhes bya ba yan chad kyi sgra 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma kun du gar byed du mi gzhug go zhes bya ba ni gar nas brtsams te dge slong mas mi bya'o // dge slong ma gar byed du mi gzhug go zhes bya ba yan chad kyi sgra 'jug pa'o //
translated: One should not allow a nun to sing.

original: ston pa'i yon tan yang dag par bsgrag pa dang / rgyun chags gsum pa gdon pa la dbyangs kyi nga ro bya'o zhes bya ba ni ston pa'i yon tan bsgrag pa dang / rgyun chags gsum pa gdon pa las gzhan pa'i dbyangs kyi nga ro bsgyur ba la /
analyzed: ston pa'i yon tan yang dag par bsgrag pa dang / rgyun chags gsum pa gdon pa la dbyangs kyi nga ro bya'o zhes bya ba ni ston pa'i yon tan bsgrag pa dang / rgyun chags gsum pa gdon pa las gzhan pa'i dbyangs kyi nga ro bsgyur ba la /
translated: One should sing in order to proclaim the qualities of the Teacher and to chant the three collections.

original: glu rgyang gi khongs su gtogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: glu rgyang gi khongs su gtogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that singing is included in dancing.

original: de dag dben pa'i phyogs su bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag dben pa'i phyogs su bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should train in them in a secluded place.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni dbyangs kyi nga ro de dag dben pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni dbyangs kyi nga ro de dag dben pa'o //
translated: “In them” refers to those songs. “Secluded” means alone.

original: tho 'tshams pa dang kun du rtse ba dang / kun du ca co 'don pa dang / rgod pa dang / dregs pa dang / lus brdeg pa dag mi bya'o //
analyzed: tho 'tshams pa dang kun du rtse ba dang / kun du ca co 'don pa dang / rgod pa dang / dregs pa dang / lus brdeg pa dag mi bya'o //
translated: be arrogant, or beat one’s body.🔽One should not move one’s body or speech with a boisterous attitude.

original: rgod pa'i bsam pas lus dang ngag gi rnam par 'gyur ba mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir gzhung ni ko lpags kyi gzhi las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: rgod pa'i bsam pas lus dang ngag gi rnam par 'gyur ba mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir gzhung ni ko lpags kyi gzhi las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said in the Chapter on Leather:

original: dge slong gis mchil lham gzung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis mchil lham gzung bar mi bya'o //
translated: “Monks should not wear shoes.

original: lag 'gros mkhan rab tu byung ba zhig rkang khrus sar de'i chu snod gzhag te rkang pa gnyis bkrus nas kha chus bkang ste /
analyzed: lag 'gros mkhan rab tu byung ba zhig rkang khrus sar de'i chu snod gzhag te rkang pa gnyis bkrus nas kha chus bkang ste /
translated: A certain bird-keeper went forth and placed his water vessel in a foot-washing place. After washing his feet, he filled his mouth with water,

original: rma bya'i 'gros kyis 'dug pa dang drug sde dag gis mthong nas de rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: rma bya'i 'gros kyis 'dug pa dang drug sde dag gis mthong nas de rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: and sat down with the gait of a peacock. The group of six saw him and said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa la rol mo med par dge slong gar byed de /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa la rol mo med par dge slong gar byed de /
translated: “The venerable one dances like a monk without music.

original: de dag gi khas glu blangs pas rol mo'i glu brtsams pa'i skabs de dge slong dag gis gsol pa na /
analyzed: de dag gi khas glu blangs pas rol mo'i glu brtsams pa'i skabs de dge slong dag gis gsol pa na /
translated: When the monks reported this to the Blessed One,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag ci'i phyir dgod par gyur ces smras pa ldang / de rnams kyis smras pa 'di la bgad du ci zhig yod /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag ci'i phyir dgod par gyur ces smras pa ldang / de rnams kyis smras pa 'di la bgad du ci zhig yod /
translated: They said, “What is there to laugh about?”

original: khyed rnams kyis mthong ngam dge slong rol mo med kyang gar byed pa zhes bya ba'i skabs 'di nas /
analyzed: khyed rnams kyis mthong ngam dge slong rol mo med kyang gar byed pa zhes bya ba'i skabs 'di nas /
translated: “Did you see the monk dancing without music?”

original: ji srid du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong de la dri ba mdzad de dge slong bsam pa gang gis 'di ltar byas /🔽btsun pa gnas mal bskyab pa'i don cung zad dang dgod @256a * //
analyzed: ji srid du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong de la dri ba mdzad de dge slong bsam pa gang gis 'di ltar byas / btsun pa gnas mal bskyab pa'i don cung zad dang dgod @256a * //
translated: The Blessed Buddha asked the monk, “Monk, why did you do that?”

original: pa'i bsam pa cung zad kyis so //
analyzed: pa'i bsam pa cung zad kyis so //
translated: “Venerable, I was thinking of protecting the bedding and of laughing a little.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “The Blessed One said,

original: gnas mal bskyab pa'i ched gang yin pa de la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gnas mal bskyab pa'i ched gang yin pa de la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: ‘There is no offense for one who is thinking of protecting the bedding.

original: dgod pa'i bsam pas byas pa la ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: dgod pa'i bsam pas byas pa la ni nyes byas so //
translated: But if one does it with the intention of laughing, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.’”

original: drug sde dag la smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag la smras pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the group of six monks,

original: bsam pa gang gis khyed kyis de ltar byas /
analyzed: bsam pa gang gis khyed kyis de ltar byas /
translated: “Why did you do that?”

original: btsun pa bsdad pa'i bsam pa cung zad dag dang / dgod pa'i bsam pa cung zad kyis bgyis so //
analyzed: btsun pa bsdad pa'i bsam pa cung zad dag dang / dgod pa'i bsam pa cung zad kyis bgyis so //
translated: The Venerable said, I had a slight intention to sit down and a slight intention to laugh.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: bsdad pa'i bsam pa dag gang yin pa de la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: bsdad pa'i bsam pa dag gang yin pa de la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for one who has the intention to sit down.

original: gang zhig dgod pa'i bsam pas byas pa de la nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽gang zhig 'dir rtsom pa gcig par gyur pa nyid la yang rigs mi mthun pas bar du chod pa dag la ltung ba dang ltung ba med pa gcig tu bstan pa'i phyir 'dres pa ni char sdom mo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang zhig dgod pa'i bsam pas byas pa de la nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no // gang zhig 'dir rtsom pa gcig par gyur pa nyid la yang rigs mi mthun pas bar du chod pa dag la ltung ba dang ltung ba med pa gcig tu bstan pa'i phyir 'dres pa ni char sdom mo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: But for one who does it with the intention to laugh, there is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽Here, in order to show that even in the case of a single action, when interrupted by dissimilar actions, there is both an offense and no offense, it is said: The mixed is summarized by the parts.

original: cha shas kyis 'dres pa nyid la rigs mi mthun pa'i cha rnams kyis 'dir rigs mi mthun par bar du gcod pa nyid kyi dbang gis tha dad pa thams cad rigs mthun pa'i cha rnams cha gcig pa nyid kyis mngon par 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: cha shas kyis 'dres pa nyid la rigs mi mthun pa'i cha rnams kyis 'dir rigs mi mthun par bar du gcod pa nyid kyi dbang gis tha dad pa thams cad rigs mthun pa'i cha rnams cha gcig pa nyid kyis mngon par 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: In the case of a mixture by parts, all the dissimilar parts here are considered to be of the same type by the power of the similarity of the parts, due to the interruption by dissimilar parts.

original: cha gcig pa nyid la de nyid la 'jug pa gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: cha gcig pa nyid la de nyid la 'jug pa gcig pa nyid do //
translated: The same is true of the single part.

original: 'dir rigs gzhan nyid kyis tha dad pa'i dngos po'o //🔽'dir rtsom pa gcig par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'dir rigs gzhan nyid kyis tha dad pa'i dngos po'o // 'dir rtsom pa gcig par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Here, the difference is due to the difference in the species.🔽Here, the difference is due to the difference in the beginning.🔽Here, the difference is due to the difference in the interruption.

original: bar du gcod pa nyid med pa la yang gcig nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: bar du gcod pa nyid med pa la yang gcig nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The interruption is of two kinds:

original: bar chad 'ga' zhig ni dman pa ste /
analyzed: bar chad 'ga' zhig ni dman pa ste /
translated: inferior and superior.

original: gang zhig med pas de bas na nges par gnas pa dang lta ba dang sprugs pa la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: gang zhig med pas de bas na nges par gnas pa dang lta ba dang sprugs pa la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: The inferior is that which is not present when the action is performed, such as the action of eating.🔽The superior is that which is present when the action is performed, such as the action of eating.

original: snod brgyud pas zas kyi bya ba mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snod brgyud pas zas kyi bya ba mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
