original: gar gyi bdag nyid ma yin pa'i gzhan thams cad ni bong ba la sogs pa 'phen pa dang / lus kyi rtsed mor gyur pa g-yo ba'i rtsed mo gzhan thams cad la yongs su bzung ba 'dir rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gar gyi bdag nyid ma yin pa'i gzhan thams cad ni bong ba la sogs pa 'phen pa dang / lus kyi rtsed mor gyur pa g-yo ba'i rtsed mo gzhan thams cad la yongs su bzung ba 'dir rig par bya'o //
translated: Everything else that is not dance is included here, such as throwing clods of earth, and all other kinds of play that are bodily movements and games.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las //
translated: The text of the Vinaya states:

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong chab ma lags pa dngos po ldeg ma la rtse bar bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽de lta bu la byed du bcug pa ni de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni gang du 'dir char par gyur pa la chu las gzhan pa'i rdzas la kha na ma tho bar smos pa de lta bur gyur pa'i chu dang / de las gzhan pa'i rdzas dag @260b la 'dzag tu 'jug pa'i rgyu de dang 'dra bar rang gis byas pa ltar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong chab ma lags pa dngos po ldeg ma la rtse bar bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no // de lta bu la byed du bcug pa ni de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni gang du 'dir char par gyur pa la chu las gzhan pa'i rdzas la kha na ma tho bar smos pa de lta bur gyur pa'i chu dang / de las gzhan pa'i rdzas dag @260b la 'dzag tu 'jug pa'i rgyu de dang 'dra bar rang gis byas pa ltar blta bar bya'o //
translated: “Reverend, if a monk who is not a water-monk plays in water, what is he guilty of?” “He is guilty of a wrong-doing.”🔽“The same is true of causing someone else to do it.”🔽In the same way that it is a downfall to play in water, it is a downfall to cause someone else to play in water.

original: rengs pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur bar byed du bcug pa la yang ltung byed do //
analyzed: rengs pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur bar byed du bcug pa la yang ltung byed do //
translated: “The same is true of causing someone to do what results in a downfall.”

original: nyes byas su gyur pa la ni nyes byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyes byas su gyur pa la ni nyes byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “The same is true of causing someone to do what results in a wrong-doing.”

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pas byed du bcug na byed du bcug pa dang byed pa po gnyis ka la kha na ma tho ba dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pas byed du bcug na byed du bcug pa dang byed pa po gnyis ka la kha na ma tho ba dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one causes one who is fully ordained to do it, then both the one who causes and the one who does it have a downfall, like the one who causes and the one who kills.

original: de bas na skyes par rig phar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na skyes par rig phar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood as follows.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
translated: Here, the text of the Questions of Revata is as follows:

original: rengs pa'i bsams pa la ji lta ba bzhin du rengs su bcug pa'i bsam pa la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rengs pa'i bsams pa la ji lta ba bzhin du rengs su bcug pa'i bsam pa la yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as with the intention to paralyze, so it is with the intention to paralyze.

original: rtse ba'i bsam pa la ji lta ba bzhin du rtser 'jug pa'i bsam pa la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rtse ba'i bsam pa la ji lta ba bzhin du rtser 'jug pa'i bsam pa la yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as with the intention to play, so it is with the intention to engage in play.

original: dga' ba'i bsam pa la ji lta ba bzhin du dgar 'jug pa'i bsam pa la yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dga' ba'i bsam pa la ji lta ba bzhin du dgar 'jug pa'i bsam pa la yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Just as with the intention to delight, so it is with the intention to engage in delight.

original: ji bsam pa gang yang rung bas de las gzhan pa'i yul las skyes pa'i bya ba rnams rjes su bsgrub pa la kha na ma tho ba 'di rnams yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ji bsam pa gang yang rung bas de las gzhan pa'i yul las skyes pa'i bya ba rnams rjes su bsgrub pa la kha na ma tho ba 'di rnams yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are these downfalls for following the actions of those born in other realms, as one wishes?

original: de'i phyir dgod pas dga' ba nyams su myong bar bya ba'i 'dun pas so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dgod pas dga' ba nyams su myong bar bya ba'i 'dun pas so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, with the intention of experiencing the joy of laughter.

original: ji srid du dga' ba'i ngo bo med par 'dun pa 'di mi 'grub pas de srid du 'dir 'di ni mthar ro //
analyzed: ji srid du dga' ba'i ngo bo med par 'dun pa 'di mi 'grub pas de srid du 'dir 'di ni mthar ro //
translated: Since this intention does not cease as long as the nature of joy does not cease, it is the last of these.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las dge slong gis bum pa'i sbyor bas chus 'thor na thams cad du ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las dge slong gis bum pa'i sbyor bas chus 'thor na thams cad du ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, some texts state that if a monk sprinkles water with a vase, he commits a downfall in all cases.🔽Therefore, there is no offense for one who desires to cool a crossing, etc.

original: de'i phyir sim par 'dod pas rgal ba la sogs pa la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni nub pa dang ma nub pa dag la sogs pa'i sgras 'phangs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sim par 'dod pas rgal ba la sogs pa la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni nub pa dang ma nub pa dag la sogs pa'i sgras 'phangs pa'o //
translated: There is also no offense if one is crossing a river, etc.,

original: rgyal slob pa thad ka'am ltag 'og tu rtsol ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyal slob pa thad ka'am ltag 'og tu rtsol ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: upwards or downwards.

original: ltag 'og tu zhes bya ba ni srid du'o //
analyzed: ltag 'og tu zhes bya ba ni srid du'o //
translated: Upwards means upstream.

original: thad kar ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: thad kar ni ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one crosses a river directly.

original: grang bar 'dod pas tsha ba dag la ri mo 'dod pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni grang zhing ngad las par 'dod pas ni nyi ma la sogs tsha bar gyur pa'i chu dag la ri mo 'dod par byed pa ltung ba med do //
analyzed: grang bar 'dod pas tsha ba dag la ri mo 'dod pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni grang zhing ngad las par 'dod pas ni nyi ma la sogs tsha bar gyur pa'i chu dag la ri mo 'dod par byed pa ltung ba med do //
translated: The downfall is incurred by one who desires cold and fresh water, who desires heat for one who desires it, such as the sun.

original: chu la rtse ba'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: chu la rtse ba'i ltung byed do /
translated: The downfall is incurred by one who plays in water.

original: // / ci zhig byas nas 'jug pa gang bud med dang lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / ci zhig byas nas 'jug pa gang bud med dang lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the downfall incurred by one who sleeps in the same sleeping place as a woman?

original: de'i phyir bad med dang lhan cig gnas gcig tu gnyid log na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bad med dang lhan cig gnas gcig tu gnyid log na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “If one sleeps in the same sleeping place as a woman.”

original: lhan cig ces bya ba ni gnyis ka dag kyang lhan cig gnyid log pa las 'da' bar byed na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lhan cig ces bya ba ni gnyis ka dag kyang lhan cig gnyid log pa las 'da' bar byed na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Together” means that both sleep together. The meaning is that one passes the night.

original: dus gang gi tshe gnyid log pa na zhe na /🔽de'i @261a * //
analyzed: dus gang gi tshe gnyid log pa na zhe na / de'i @261a * //
translated: At what time does one sleep?

original: phyir mtshan mo'o zhes smos so //
analyzed: phyir mtshan mo'o zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said: “At night.”

original: ci mtshan mo thams cad kyi skad cig gang yang rung ba la'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci mtshan mo thams cad kyi skad cig gang yang rung ba la'am zhe na /
translated: Is it at any moment of the night?

original: de'i phyir mthar ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthar ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “at the end.”

original: ci mtshan mo'i mtha'i mdun rol du ltung ba med dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci mtshan mo'i mtha'i mdun rol du ltung ba med dam zhe na /
translated: Is there no offense before the end of the night?

original: de'i mdun rol du ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i mdun rol du ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, “Before that, there is an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: gang zhig 'dir stobs dang mi ldan pa'i ma ning la sogs pa dang / dud 'gro la sogs pa rnams la so sor stobs dang ldan pa nyid la yang nyed la yang nyes byas yin na ni spyi po tshod gang yang rung ba dang ldan pa'i mthu med pa la sogs pa der shes par bya 'am zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig 'dir stobs dang mi ldan pa'i ma ning la sogs pa dang / dud 'gro la sogs pa rnams la so sor stobs dang ldan pa nyid la yang nyed la yang nyes byas yin na ni spyi po tshod gang yang rung ba dang ldan pa'i mthu med pa la sogs pa der shes par bya 'am zhe na /
translated: If it is an offense of wrong conduct for those who are not strong, such as neuters and so on, and animals and so on, who are not able to do it, and for those who are able to do it, then is it understood that it is an offense of wrong conduct for those who are not able to do it, such as those who are not of the right age and so on?

original: de'i phyir bya gag gi tshad ni de byed pa nyid kyi mtha'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bya gag gi tshad ni de byed pa nyid kyi mtha'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The measure of a chicken is the limit of its ability.”

original: gzhan yang de byed pa nyid ni nyes byas byed pa mtha'o zhes bya ba mtha' yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan yang de byed pa nyid ni nyes byas byed pa mtha'o zhes bya ba mtha' yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Moreover, the limit of its ability is the limit of the offense of wrong conduct. The meaning is that it is the limit.

original: bud med dang lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: bud med dang lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung byed do /
translated: The second downfall is a downfall that is a result of sexual intercourse with a woman.

original: // / gang la spangs par byed pa'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / gang la spangs par byed pa'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the offense that is to be abandoned?

original: de'i phyir bzhad gad bya ba'i bsam pas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bzhad gad bya ba'i bsam pas kyang rung ste /
translated: Therefore, even with the intention to joke,

original: dang bar 'dod pas 'jigs pa'i rgyu nye bar bsgrub par sngon du btang ba 'jigs par byed pa che ge mo zhig ces dge slong la gzhan gyis kyang go bar byed na 'jigs pa ma skyes kyang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dang bar 'dod pas 'jigs pa'i rgyu nye bar bsgrub par sngon du btang ba 'jigs par byed pa che ge mo zhig ces dge slong la gzhan gyis kyang go bar byed na 'jigs pa ma skyes kyang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: if someone else makes a monk understand by saying, “I will set forth the cause of fear for one who desires faith,” even if fear does not arise,🔽this is the offense that is to be abandoned.

original: shes par gyur pa'i 'jug pa byed pa 'di ni 'jug pa 'di shes pa yin te /
analyzed: shes par gyur pa'i 'jug pa byed pa 'di ni 'jug pa 'di shes pa yin te /
translated: This is the offense that is to be abandoned.🔽There is no arising of fear from this,

original: 'di la 'jigs pa bskyed pa 'di las 'byung ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i blo yod pa la 'jigs pa'i 'dun pa la go skabs yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la 'jigs pa bskyed pa 'di las 'byung ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i blo yod pa la 'jigs pa'i 'dun pa la go skabs yod pa ma yin no //
translated: and there is no opportunity for the intention to fear in one who has the understanding that there is no arising of fear from this.

original: de bas na 'jigs par 'dun pas zhes bya ba ni bye brag go //
analyzed: de bas na 'jigs par 'dun pas zhes bya ba ni bye brag go //
translated: Therefore, the intention to fear is the distinction.

original: 'jigs pa'i rgyu mtshan yid du 'ong ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo la sogs pa la nye bar bsgrub pa sngon du 'gro bas go bar byed na 'jigs pa'i kha na ma tho ba'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i rgyu mtshan yid du 'ong ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo la sogs pa la nye bar bsgrub pa sngon du 'gro bas go bar byed na 'jigs pa'i kha na ma tho ba'o //
translated: The fearsome is the sin of commission, when one causes another to do something that is not good, such as something that is not beautiful, etc.

original: 'dir gzhung ni yid du mi 'ong ba'i gzugs rnams nye bar sgrub par byed pa de nag po dang kha dog nag por ston pa de nag por snang ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni yid du mi 'ong ba'i gzugs rnams nye bar sgrub par byed pa de nag po dang kha dog nag por ston pa de nag por snang ba'o //
translated: Here, the text is: “The inauspicious forms are the black, the black-appearing, and the black-showing.”

original: 'di lta ste dper na yi dgas dang sha za dang grum bum dang lus srul po'i gzugs can de lta bu de rnams kyis ni rung ba dang / de rnams kyis ni gsod par gyur pa dang / de rnams kyis ni srog gcod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na yi dgas dang sha za dang grum bum dang lus srul po'i gzugs can de lta bu de rnams kyis ni rung ba dang / de rnams kyis ni gsod par gyur pa dang / de rnams kyis ni srog gcod par 'gyur te /
translated: For example, it is like the forms of hungry ghosts, cannibals, and demons. They are the ones who kill, and they are the ones who take life.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i rnam grangs gzhan yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i rnam grangs gzhan yang shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that there are other such categories.

original: 'dir yang de lta bu'i gzugs can zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang de lta bu'i gzugs can zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, too, it is like the forms of those who are like that, and so on.

original: lhag ma 'jigs pa'i rgyu nye bar bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma 'jigs pa'i rgyu nye bar bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The rest of the fearsome should be supplied.

original: sngon du 'gro ba @261b zhes bya ba 'di la go bar byed pa na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sngon du 'gro ba @261b zhes bya ba 'di la go bar byed pa na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Here, preliminary is twofold:

original: don dang go bar bya ba la'o //
analyzed: don dang go bar bya ba la'o //
translated: that which is understood and that which causes understanding.

original: de la don go bar byed pa gang la zhes bya ba 'di la 'jigs par byed pa zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de la don go bar byed pa gang la zhes bya ba 'di la 'jigs par byed pa zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: Among them, that which is understood is stated in this case, to whom?

original: ji ltar 'jigs par go bar byed pa go bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jigs par go bar byed pa go bar byed ce na /
translated: How does one understand the cause of understanding?

original: de'i phyir che ge mo zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir che ge mo zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, so and so is stated.

original: gang la go bar byed ces bya ba'i dri ba 'di la dge slong la zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gang la go bar byed ces bya ba'i dri ba 'di la dge slong la zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In this question, to whom is it understood? To a monk is stated.

original: ci bdag nyid kyis de lta bu go bar byed pa la 'jigs pa'i kha na ma tho ba zhes bya ba 'di la gzhan gyis kyang zhes bya ba smos so //🔽ci ma skyes pa la yang go bar bya zhes bya ba'i 'jigs pa la kha na ma tho ba 'di yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci bdag nyid kyis de lta bu go bar byed pa la 'jigs pa'i kha na ma tho ba zhes bya ba 'di la gzhan gyis kyang zhes bya ba smos so // ci ma skyes pa la yang go bar bya zhes bya ba'i 'jigs pa la kha na ma tho ba 'di yin zhe na /
translated: Is it only when one understands in this way by oneself that there is the offense of fear? In this case, by another is stated.

original: de'i phyir 'jigs pa ma skyes kyang ngo zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jigs pa ma skyes kyang ngo zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Is it also understood when not arisen? In this case, even if the fear is not arisen is stated.

original: 'jigs pa'i rgyu ci 'dra ba zhig nye bar bsgrub pa la kha na ma tho ba ci 'dra bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i rgyu ci 'dra ba zhig nye bar bsgrub pa la kha na ma tho ba ci 'dra bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What sort of cause of fear is to be established, and what sort of sin is there?

original: de'i phyir yid du mi 'ong ba la ni dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yid du mi 'ong ba la ni dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore he says: The actual basis is in regard to what is unpleasant.

original: 'dir yid du mi 'ong ba dpes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir yid du mi 'ong ba dpes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, in order to illustrate what is unpleasant, he says:

original: 'di lta ste dper na yi dgas dang sha za dang grum bum dang lus srul po'i gzugs la ba nag po dang sol ba dang ka ba tshig pa lta bu dang / seng ge dang stag dang gung dang / mtsha' dang gzig dang wa'i skad lta bu bshang ba dang gci ba dang rva dang de'i ze ba'i dri lta bu seg dang re phyar ba'i reg pa lta bu bdag nyid sgrogs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na yi dgas dang sha za dang grum bum dang lus srul po'i gzugs la ba nag po dang sol ba dang ka ba tshig pa lta bu dang / seng ge dang stag dang gung dang / mtsha' dang gzig dang wa'i skad lta bu bshang ba dang gci ba dang rva dang de'i ze ba'i dri lta bu seg dang re phyar ba'i reg pa lta bu bdag nyid sgrogs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: For example, it is like the form of a hungry ghost, a flesh-eater, a hermaphrodite, or a leper, like black cloth, charcoal, or a burnt stump; like the voice of a lion, tiger, leopard, hyena, or panther; like the smell of feces, urine, or a swamp; like the touch of a thorn or a saw.

original: 'dir thams can du sgra dang dri dang reg bya rnams la yi dgas dang / sha za dang grum bum dang lus srul po yod do zhes sgrogs shing go bar byed pa 'di la 'dir so sor rjes su sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir thams can du sgra dang dri dang reg bya rnams la yi dgas dang / sha za dang grum bum dang lus srul po yod do zhes sgrogs shing go bar byed pa 'di la 'dir so sor rjes su sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the announcement and understanding of the existence of hungry ghosts, piśācas, kumbhāṇḍas, and pūtanas in all sounds, smells, and tactile objects is to be understood as a specific application here.

original: seng ge la sogs pa'i sgra la sogs pa rnams la yi dgas la sogs par grags pas go bar byed na dngos gzhi sta gzhan rnams la ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: seng ge la sogs pa'i sgra la sogs pa rnams la yi dgas la sogs par grags pas go bar byed na dngos gzhi sta gzhan rnams la ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If the announcement and understanding of hungry ghosts, etc. in the sounds, etc. of lions, etc. is not the actual basis, then it is in other things.

original: yid du 'ong ba la ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni yid du 'ong ba'i rgyu nye bar bsgrub pa sgrogs na nyes byas so //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba la ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni yid du 'ong ba'i rgyu nye bar bsgrub pa sgrogs na nyes byas so //
translated: If it is pleasant, there is an offense for establishing the cause of what is pleasant, there is an offense.

original: gang gi phyir 'di la 'jigs pa'i rgyu yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di la 'jigs pa'i rgyu yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin te /
translated: Because here the cause of fear is not complete,

original: gang gi phyir 'di la shin tu yid 'byung bar byed pa nyid ma yin zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di la shin tu yid 'byung bar byed pa nyid ma yin zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: because here there is not the utmost disgust.

original: 'dir yid du 'ong ba dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir yid du 'ong ba dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, in order to show an example of what is pleasant,🔽he says:

original: 'di lta ste dper na lha dang klu dang dri za dang gnod sbyin dang mi'am ci dang lto 'phye chen po gzugs nor can dang tshong dpon dang ded dpon la sogs pa lta bu /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na lha dang klu dang dri za dang gnod sbyin dang mi'am ci dang lto 'phye chen po gzugs nor can dang tshong dpon dang ded dpon la sogs pa lta bu /
translated: For example, like gods, nagas, gandharvas, yakshas, kinnaras, mahoragas, wealthy people, merchants, caravan leaders, etc.

original: pi wang la sogs pa'i sgra lta bu'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: pi wang la sogs pa'i sgra lta bu'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like the sound of a veena, etc.

original: 'dir sogs pa'i sgras ni gling bu dang @262a * //
analyzed: 'dir sogs pa'i sgras ni gling bu dang @262a * //
translated: Here, the word etc. includes flutes,

original: pa la ri dang ma hva ti dang su go sha lta bu rnams kyang bsdu'o //
analyzed: pa la ri dang ma hva ti dang su go sha lta bu rnams kyang bsdu'o //
translated: palala, mahavati, sugosa, etc.🔽Like the smell of aloes, sandalwood, saffron, and tamala leaf,🔽like the touch of silk, cotton, wool, gauze, dukulara, and kotikata cloth.

original: aa ka ru dang tsan dan dang gur gum dang / ta ma la'i lo ma'i dri lta bu dang / dar dang ras yug chen dang be'u sas dang dar la dang du ku la'i ras dang / ko tam ba'i ras kyi reg pa lta bu rnams nyid sgrogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni ji srid lha la sogs pa 'di na yod do zhes sgrogs shing zhes bya ba 'di la 'dir thams cad du sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: aa ka ru dang tsan dan dang gur gum dang / ta ma la'i lo ma'i dri lta bu dang / dar dang ras yug chen dang be'u sas dang dar la dang du ku la'i ras dang / ko tam ba'i ras kyi reg pa lta bu rnams nyid sgrogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni ji srid lha la sogs pa 'di na yod do zhes sgrogs shing zhes bya ba 'di la 'dir thams cad du sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: This is proclaimed. This is to be known as applied everywhere here, up to proclaiming that gods, etc. exist here.

original: 'dir lha la sogs pa smos pa ni mtshon pa tsam yin te shin tu che ba'i yi dgas la sogs pa rnams kyang 'dir bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir lha la sogs pa smos pa ni mtshon pa tsam yin te shin tu che ba'i yi dgas la sogs pa rnams kyang 'dir bsdus pa'o //
translated: Here, the mention of gods and so on is just an illustration, since even very large hungry ghosts and so on are included here.

original: ci 'dir 'dug pa thams cad la khan ma tho ba 'di yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dir 'dug pa thams cad la khan ma tho ba 'di yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is this downfall incurred by all who are present here?

original: de'i phyir skyo bar bya ba'i ched nyid ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skyo bar bya ba'i ched nyid ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “except for the purpose of discouraging.”

original: 'jug pa 'di la rnam pa 'di lta bu dag ma gtogs par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jug pa 'di la rnam pa 'di lta bu dag ma gtogs par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that except for these kinds of situations, this downfall does not occur.

original: gang gi phyir 'jug pa 'di las 'jug pa gzhan ni kha na ma tho ba de bas na de'i phyir skyo bar bya ba'i ched du sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang / yi dgas kyi gtam la sogs pa ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba smos so //🔽sngas par byed pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jug pa 'di las 'jug pa gzhan ni kha na ma tho ba de bas na de'i phyir skyo bar bya ba'i ched du sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang / yi dgas kyi gtam la sogs pa ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba smos so // sngas par byed pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: Since this downfall does not occur in any other situation, therefore, for the purpose of discouraging, there is no downfall in teaching about hell beings, animals, and ghosts.🔽The root text says, “The root downfall of boasting.”

original: // / ci zhig byas na sped pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / ci zhig byas na sped pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the root downfall of boasting?

original: de'i phyir rab tu byung ba 'di pa dbang ba'i lhung bzed dang / chos gos dang dra ba dang phor bu dang ske rags la sogs pa dge slong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad sped du bcug na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rab tu byung ba 'di pa dbang ba'i lhung bzed dang / chos gos dang dra ba dang phor bu dang ske rags la sogs pa dge slong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad sped du bcug na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If a fully ordained monk hides the requisites of a monk, such as the begging bowl, robes, needle case, water filter, belt and so on, that are his own and are permitted by the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i rab tu byung ba 'di pa dbang ba'i lhung bzed la sogs pa de dag dge slong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad tshad dang ldan pa rung ba rang gis sbed du 'jug na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i rab tu byung ba 'di pa dbang ba'i lhung bzed la sogs pa de dag dge slong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad tshad dang ldan pa rung ba rang gis sbed du 'jug na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if a fully ordained monk hides those requisites of a monk, such as the begging bowl, that are his own and are permitted by the Buddha, they are the proper measure for the requisites of a monk.

original: rab tu byung ba 'di pa zhes bya ba smos pa ni de slong dang dge slong ma dang dge slob ma dang dge tshul dang dge tshul ma dang zhes bya ba thams cad ni rab tu byung ba 'di ba'i gang zag rnams nye bar bsdu ba'i don du'o
analyzed: rab tu byung ba 'di pa zhes bya ba smos pa ni de slong dang dge slong ma dang dge slob ma dang dge tshul dang dge tshul ma dang zhes bya ba thams cad ni rab tu byung ba 'di ba'i gang zag rnams nye bar bsdu ba'i don du'o
translated: The term fully ordained monk is stated because all fully ordained monks, nuns, female novices, male novices and female novices are included.

original: // ci dus gang yang rung ba la ma byas pa 'di dag la yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: // ci dus gang yang rung ba la ma byas pa 'di dag la yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are these not done at any time?

original: de'i phyir phan par 'dod pas ni ma grogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phan par 'dod pas ni ma grogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, one who desires benefit should not do that.

original: 'dis ltung ba med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ltung ba med pa kho na yin no //
translated: Thus, this is only a downfall without evil consequence.

original: sbed pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: sbed pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: The downfall is not concealing.

original: // / gang la byin pas nye bar 'tsho ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /🔽de'i phyir dge slong la gos blangs pa med par byin pa nges gnang ba med par spyod na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: // / gang la byin pas nye bar 'tsho ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na / de'i phyir dge slong la gos blangs pa med par byin pa nges gnang ba med par spyod na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: What is the downfall that is using what was given to another?🔽Therefore, it is said: “If a monk uses without permission what was given to another monk without his having received it.”

original: thams cad khyad @262b thams cad du byin pa'i dge slong gis gos gang la sbyin pa de rjes su gnang ba med par yongs su longs spyod pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad khyad @262b thams cad du byin pa'i dge slong gis gos gang la sbyin pa de rjes su gnang ba med par yongs su longs spyod pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: “If a monk who was given a robe uses it without permission.”

original: rang gi blos nye bar 'tsho ba la khan ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi blos nye bar 'tsho ba la khan ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: This downfall is incurred by one’s own mind.

original: gzhan gyi blos ni sbom po ste 'dir ma byin par len pa nye bar 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi blos ni sbom po ste 'dir ma byin par len pa nye bar 'brel pa'o //
translated: If it is by the mind of another, it is a serious violation, because it is connected with taking what is not given.

original: de bas na ma byin pa la kha na ma tho ba 'di bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na ma byin pa la kha na ma tho ba 'di bskyed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this downfall is incurred by taking what is not given.

original: 'di rang gi blo la nyes pa med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'di rang gi blo la nyes pa med pa kho na yin no //
translated: This is not a fault in one’s own mind.

original: gzhan gyi la di ni bdag gi yin no snyam du 'khrul par 'gyur ba'i go ba grub pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi la di ni bdag gi yin no snyam du 'khrul par 'gyur ba'i go ba grub pa'o //
translated: The idea that “this is mine” is a mistake.

original: rang gi blo 'khrul par gyur pas 'di dang gzhan la yang nye bar sbyor ba la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: rang gi blo 'khrul par gyur pas 'di dang gzhan la yang nye bar sbyor ba la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in applying this to other things, because one’s mind is mistaken.

original: gos dang yo byad lhag ma rnams la yang thog ma nyid du 'dir kha na ma tho ba 'di ram par gnas pa yin no //🔽lhung bzed la ni yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: gos dang yo byad lhag ma rnams la yang thog ma nyid du 'dir kha na ma tho ba 'di ram par gnas pa yin no // lhung bzed la ni yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
translated: As for the other garments and articles, the fault is obvious from the start.🔽But in the case of the alms bowl, the fault is only obvious when it is full.

original: lhung bzed chung ba la ni na smad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed chung ba la ni na smad par rig par bya'o //
translated: And in the case of a small alms bowl, the fault is obvious when it is half full.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las /🔽btsun pa re zhig dge slong la lhung bzed dang chos gos sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las / btsun pa re zhig dge slong la lhung bzed dang chos gos sbyin par bya ste /
translated: Here is the text of the Vinaya:

original: de'i 'og tu slar 'phrog par byed cing longs spyod par byed na ltung ba cir 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu slar 'phrog par byed cing longs spyod par byed na ltung ba cir 'gyur //
translated: “Lord, if a monk gives his alms bowl and robes to someone, and then takes them back and uses them again, what is the offense?”

original: ltung byed do //
analyzed: ltung byed do //
translated: “It is a pāyattika offense.”

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis lhung bzed dam chos gos dge slong gzhan dang gzhan la 'tsho ba'i yo byad du byin nas 'phrog par byed na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis lhung bzed dam chos gos dge slong gzhan dang gzhan la 'tsho ba'i yo byad du byin nas 'phrog par byed na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: Venerable, if a monk gives a begging bowl or Dharma robes to another monk as requisites for livelihood and then steals them, what is the offense?

original: nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is a wrong action.

original: 'dir snga ma la lhung bzed dang chos gos las gzhan ma bzung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir snga ma la lhung bzed dang chos gos las gzhan ma bzung ba'o //
translated: Here, the former is not held to be other than a begging bowl or Dharma robes.

original: 'di la ni nyes pa med pas ma bzung ba zhes gsungs ba zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la ni nyes pa med pas ma bzung ba zhes gsungs ba zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Since there is no fault here, it is said to be not held.

original: phyi ma ni bzung bas 'di la ni nyes byas su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni shes byed do //
analyzed: phyi ma ni bzung bas 'di la ni nyes byas su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni shes byed do //
translated: The latter is held, so it is said to be a wrong action. This is the explanation.

original: phyi ma la lhung bzed dam chos gos zhes bya ba 'di lhung bzed dam chogs gos las gzhan pa zhes bya ba nyams pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma la lhung bzed dam chos gos zhes bya ba 'di lhung bzed dam chogs gos las gzhan pa zhes bya ba nyams pa'o //
translated: In the latter, the phrase “a begging bowl or Dharma robes” is a corruption of “other than a begging bowl or Dharma robes.”

original: de'i rjes su gnang ba med pa zhes bya ba ni gang la byin pa de'i rjes su gnang ba so sor bzung nas zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su gnang ba med pa zhes bya ba ni gang la byin pa de'i rjes su gnang ba so sor bzung nas zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'o //
translated: The phrase “without his permission” means “without the permission of the one to whom they were given.” The phrase “after accepting them individually” is a summary.

original: ci bsam pa gang yang rung bas spyod pa la 'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci bsam pa gang yang rung bas spyod pa la 'am zhe na /
translated: If one asks, Is it the case that there is no offense if one uses it for any purpose whatsoever?

original: de'i phyir gal te gzhi des de dag dga' bar mi 'gyur na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te gzhi des de dag dga' bar mi 'gyur na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, If they are not pleased by that basis.

original: de zhes bya ba ni gang la byin pa des yid ches pas longs spyod pa la ltung ba med ces bya'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni gang la byin pa des yid ches pas longs spyod pa la ltung ba med ces bya'o //
translated: That refers to the one to whom it was given. If they are not pleased means if they do not enjoy using it as they wish.

original: byin pas nye bar 'tsho ba'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: byin pas nye bar 'tsho ba'i ltung byed do /
translated: The downfall is called “living by giving.”

original: // / ci zhig byas na skur pa 'debs ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /🔽de'i phyir skur pa 'debs par 'dod pas dge slong la 'du shes bsgyur te /
analyzed: // / ci zhig byas na skur pa 'debs ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na / de'i phyir skur pa 'debs par 'dod pas dge slong la 'du shes bsgyur te /
translated: If one asks, “What is the downfall of slander?”

original: dge 'dun lhag mas @263a * //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag mas @263a * //
translated: Therefore it is said, If one wishes to slander, one changes one’s perception of the monk and says to a layperson, ‘The monk is guilty of a defeating offense.’

original: skur pa rjod na'o zhes bya ba smos te /🔽dge 'dun ltag ma'i ltung bas skur pa 'debs pas skur pa 'debs pa gang yin pa de'i 'dun pas shes par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skur pa rjod na'o zhes bya ba smos te / dge 'dun ltag ma'i ltung bas skur pa 'debs pas skur pa 'debs pa gang yin pa de'i 'dun pas shes par rig par bya'o //
translated: The downfall is called “slander.”

original: ci dngos su skur pa 'debs pa kho na la yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci dngos su skur pa 'debs pa kho na la yin nam zhe na /
translated: If one asks, “Is it only when one actually slanders that there is a downfall?”

original: de'i phyir bag tsam gyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bag tsam gyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “Even if it is just a joke.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
translated: Here, the text of the treatise states:

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis bslab pa stsal ba tsam gyis dge 'dun lhag mas skur pa 'debs par byed na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis bslab pa stsal ba tsam gyis dge 'dun lhag mas skur pa 'debs par byed na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: “Venerable! If a monk merely gives a teaching, does he commit an offense of disparaging the Saṅgha?”

original: ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽skur pa 'debs pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no // skur pa 'debs pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: “He commits an offense of wrong conduct.”🔽The offense of disparaging the Saṅgha.

original: // / sngar lam du 'gro ba la bud med byed pa po nyid do //
analyzed: // / sngar lam du 'gro ba la bud med byed pa po nyid do //
translated: The woman is the agent.

original: gang zhes smos pa de ci gzhan gang yang rung ba la de byed pa po yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhes smos pa de ci gzhan gang yang rung ba la de byed pa po yin nam zhe na /
translated: What is meant by “he” in the root text? Does it refer to anyone at all?

original: de'i phyir 'dod pas lam du 'gro na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod pas lam du 'gro na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the root text states, “if he goes on the road out of desire.”

original: rang dgar lam du 'gro na ste /
analyzed: rang dgar lam du 'gro na ste /
translated: If he goes on the road out of his own desire.

original: gzhan dbang gis ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dbang gis ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It does not refer to someone who is forced to go.

original: lam ji srid du 'gro ba la yin zhe na /
analyzed: lam ji srid du 'gro ba la yin zhe na /
translated: How far does one have to go on the road?

original: de'i phyir rgyang grags re rer ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyang grags re rer ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the root text states, “each krośa.”

original: ltung byed nyid la 'dir byed pa po nyid ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba bye brag ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ltung byed nyid la 'dir byed pa po nyid ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba bye brag ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir rtogs pa'o //
translated: Here, the agent is not specified as “this one” in regard to the offense itself, so it is understood.

original: de'i phyir re re nyid ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni rgyang grags kyi phyed re rer ni bud med kyi nyes byas kyi byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir re re nyid ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni rgyang grags kyi phyed re rer ni bud med kyi nyes byas kyi byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, “each” means that the agent of the offense of a nun is each half-league.

original: rgyang grags re rer rig pa'i skyes pa med par bud med dang lhan cig tu rang dgar lam du 'gro ba la spros pa ni shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyang grags re rer rig pa'i skyes pa med par bud med dang lhan cig tu rang dgar lam du 'gro ba la spros pa ni shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the elaboration is that a nun may not travel on the road alone with a man, but with a woman.

original: ci bud med kyi gnas skabs thams cad dge slong gi gnas skabs rnams la byed pa po nyid yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci bud med kyi gnas skabs thams cad dge slong gi gnas skabs rnams la byed pa po nyid yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is the agent of all the circumstances of a nun the circumstances of a monk?

original: de'i phyir bsel byed pa ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsel byed pa ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “except for the one who is begging.”

original: dge slong de nyid ces bya ba 'di la 'dir nye bar gnas pa nyid kyi phyir rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong de nyid ces bya ba 'di la 'dir nye bar gnas pa nyid kyi phyir rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Here, it should be understood that “that very monk” is the one who is present.

original: de ltar yang shugs kyis te /
analyzed: de ltar yang shugs kyis te /
translated: In that way, it is understood by implication.

original: gang gi dbang gis nyes pa 'di ma bskyed pa zhes bya ba rigs pa nyid du de 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi dbang gis nyes pa 'di ma bskyed pa zhes bya ba rigs pa nyid du de 'gyur ro //
translated: It is reasonable to say, By whose power this fault is not generated.

original: des lam nor pa la lam du 'jug par byed pa yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des lam nor pa la lam du 'jug par byed pa yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Also, one who causes one who has entered a wrong path to enter a path means

original: de zhes bya ba ni dge slong ngo //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni dge slong ngo //
translated: that refers to a monk.

original: mi nus pa khrid pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni khrid par mi nus pa zhes bya ba ltung ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dor nas zhes bya ba 'di ltar 'di bsel byed pas rtsom pa'i don du 'di'o //
analyzed: mi nus pa khrid pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni khrid par mi nus pa zhes bya ba ltung ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dor nas zhes bya ba 'di ltar 'di bsel byed pas rtsom pa'i don du 'di'o //
translated: Also, one who leads one who is unable to do so means one who leads one who is unable to do so, having abandoned the opposite of a downfall, as in having thus made this one a sweeper, for the purpose of undertaking this.

original: bud med dang lhan cig lam du 'gro ba'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: bud med dang lhan cig lam du 'gro ba'i ltung byed do /
translated: The downfall is incurred by traveling on a road with a woman.

original: // / gang la rku na ma dang lhan cig 'gro ba'i @263b ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / gang la rku na ma dang lhan cig 'gro ba'i @263b ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one travels with a mother, what is the downfall?

original: de'i phyir grong 'joms par byed pa'i chom rkun dag gam sho gam 'dral ba'i tshong pa dag dang lhan cig 'gro ba la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir grong 'joms par byed pa'i chom rkun dag gam sho gam 'dral ba'i tshong pa dag dang lhan cig 'gro ba la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, If one travels with thieves who plunder a village or with merchants who evade customs duties.

original: 'dod pas lam du 'gro na'o zhes bya ba thams cad la 'di sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pas lam du 'gro na'o zhes bya ba thams cad la 'di sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied to all of the above.

original: 'dod par byed cing 'jug pa zhes bya ba 'di la yongs su gyur par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod par byed cing 'jug pa zhes bya ba 'di la yongs su gyur par rig par bya'o //
translated: “One who is desirous” means one who is engaged in sexual activity.

original: zol pa dag dang rku thabs su rab tu byung ba dag de dang lhan cig 'gro ba la ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zol pa dag dang rku thabs su rab tu byung ba dag de dang lhan cig 'gro ba la ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “One who is deceitful” and “one who is a thief” means one who has gone forth deceitfully.

original: 'dir yang 'dod pas lam du 'gro na'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bstan pa thams cad sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang 'dod pas lam du 'gro na'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bstan pa thams cad sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: “One who is desirous” and so forth should be applied to all of the above.

original: 'dir rgyang grags re rer ni nyes byas zhes bya ba thob pa'i gnas la nyes byas zhes smos pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rgyang grags re rer ni nyes byas zhes bya ba thob pa'i gnas la nyes byas zhes smos pa 'di yin te /
translated: Here, “at every krośa” means that a minor offense is incurred at every place where one could arrive.

original: de'i don du so sor nyes byas so //🔽rkun ma dang lhan cig lam du 'gro ba'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: de'i don du so sor nyes byas so // rkun ma dang lhan cig lam du 'gro ba'i ltung byed do /
translated: This is because a minor offense is incurred for each of those.🔽The twenty-first downfall is a serious violation.

original: // / ci nyi shu ma lon par bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa'i ltung byed la byed pa po nyid gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: // / ci nyi shu ma lon par bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa'i ltung byed la byed pa po nyid gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the agent of the downfall of giving full ordination to someone who is less than twenty years old?

original: de'i phyir shes gtso bo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes gtso bo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is called “preeminence of cognition.”

original: 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the preeminent agent of discernment.🔽The twenty years of age rule applies to full ordination.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba la lo nyi shu ma lon pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa gang la byed pa po nyid ces bya ba 'di la bsnyen par rdzogs par zhes 'og nas ston to //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba la lo nyi shu ma lon pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa gang la byed pa po nyid ces bya ba 'di la bsnyen par rdzogs par zhes 'og nas ston to //
translated: This is what is being taught here: “The agent of full ordination is the preceptor.”

original: yan lag gang gis bsnyen par rdzogs she na /
analyzed: yan lag gang gis bsnyen par rdzogs she na /

original: de'i phyir smos pa ni mkhan po nyid kyis so zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir smos pa ni mkhan po nyid kyis so zhes bya ba ste /

original: 'o na 'dir bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa thams cad dbang du byed pa ltung ba'i bshad pa dang dge 'dun no //
analyzed: 'o na 'dir bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa thams cad dbang du byed pa ltung ba'i bshad pa dang dge 'dun no //
translated: But in this case, all those who perform the full ordination are included, as well as the explanation of the downfalls and the saṅgha.

original: de bas na 'gal tshabs dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na 'gal tshabs dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhe na /

original: 'on kyang bden mod kyi nyes byas gcig tu byas te ltung byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang bden mod kyi nyes byas gcig tu byas te ltung byed do //
translated: But still, it is a single offense of wrong conduct, and then a downfall.

analyzed: de bas na nyes byas 'gyod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba 'di la ltung byed kyi bshad pa mi bzung ba kho na mkhan po la ltung byed du 'gyur te /
translated: In this case, the master incurs a downfall, but the explanation of a downfall does not apply to this.

original: lhag ma la ni nyes byas zhes bya bar rab tu 'byed pa las mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma la ni nyes byas zhes bya bar rab tu 'byed pa las mngon par 'dod pa'o //

original: de'i phyir 'dir 'di dag gis nyes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir 'di dag gis nyes pa ste /

analyzed: dge slong gis sbom po'i phyir bsnyen par rdzogs par byas na'o zhes bya ba ni ltung byed ces sbyar ro //
translated: If a monk gives full ordination for the sake of a heavy offense, he incurs a downfall.

original: gang zag de la bsnyem par ma rdzogs la dge slong de rnams kyang gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i mdo las mkhan po nyid kyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di bca' ba mdzad do //
analyzed: gang zag de la bsnyem par ma rdzogs la dge slong de rnams kyang gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i mdo las mkhan po nyid kyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di bca' ba mdzad do //
translated: The sutra states that the person is not fully ordained and the monks who ordained him should be expelled.

original: 'di ni gleng gzhi las shes pa yin te mkhan po 'phags pa mood gal gyi bu @264a * //
analyzed: 'di ni gleng gzhi las shes pa yin te mkhan po 'phags pa mood gal gyi bu @264a * //
translated: This is known from the introduction. The master is the noble Maudgalyayana.

original: chen pos lo bco brgyad lon pa rnams la bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di brtags pa'o //
analyzed: chen pos lo bco brgyad lon pa rnams la bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di brtags pa'o //
translated: The great one, having considered the one who has eighteen years, has the power of full ordination.🔽He should not fail to ask him about the eighteen years.

original: des de la lon pa nyid mi dri bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la des zhes bya ba ni mkhan po'o //🔽de la zhes bya ba ni bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba la'o //
analyzed: des de la lon pa nyid mi dri bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la des zhes bya ba ni mkhan po'o // de la zhes bya ba ni bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba la'o //

original: rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni lo nyi shu lon pa nyid mi dri bar mi bya ste dri ba kho nar bya'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni lo nyi shu lon pa nyid mi dri bar mi bya ste dri ba kho nar bya'o //

original: gzhan gyis kyang mi bya'o zhes bya ba la mkhan po las gzhan bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa po dag gis kyang bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa de la mi dri bar mi bya'o //

translated: The one who is to be fully ordained should not fail to be asked about the eighteen years by those who are to give him full ordination, other than the preceptor.

original: nges par mi shes par de bsnyen par rdzogs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /🔽de zhes bya ba ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: nges par mi shes par de bsnyen par rdzogs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la / de zhes bya ba ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa'o //
translated: He should not be fully ordained without being asked about the eighteen years.

original: mi shes par de bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mi shes par de bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: He, the one who is to be fully ordained, should not be fully ordained without being asked about the eighteen years.

original: gang zhig 'di rnams la smad par bya ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang zhig 'di rnams la smad par bya ba zhes bya ba ni /

original: 'di ni de'i bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i bsdu ba yin no //

analyzed: cig shos la ni lon par 'du shes pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: gal te mi shes pa la sogs par gyur na de ltar yang grags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: 'dir byed pa po rnams lha 'du shes yongs su ma rdzogs pa nyid yin yang grags pa'o //

analyzed: ji ltar nyi shu ma lon pa zhing nyid yin yang zhe na /

analyzed: yang dag par len par byed pa'i yid kyi dbang gis zhing nyid yin te te 'on te /

analyzed: cho ga 'di mi shes na mkhan pos ma dris pa 'am dge 'dun gyis kyang ma dris par gyur na dus de la gtogs pa ni ma grags pa zhes gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: 'on 'di la tshar bcad pa'i blos yang dag par gnas pa ma yin no zhe na /

original: 'on kyang zhing nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhing nyid do //

original: de la skye ba yang yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la skye ba yang yod par 'gyur te /

analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'du shes nyid yod pa la yang zhing nyid do //

analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan du na bdag ni dge slong ngo snyam du dge 'dun gyi nang du gtogs pa rku thabs su gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is not generated by the power of the rite, because

analyzed: shes na ni de zhig go zhes bya ba ni lo nyi shu ma lon pa bsnyen par rdzogs pa la lo nyi shu ma lon par shes na de la sngar sdom pa 'chags pa de zhig go //
translated: If one knows that one has not completed twenty years, then the former vow is destroyed.

original: ci cho ga de la gcig tu zad dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci cho ga de la gcig tu zad dam zhe na /
translated: Is that rite only for that?

original: de'i phyir gal te skyes pa na ma lon pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te skyes pa na ma lon pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “If one knows that one has not completed twenty years.”

original: des zhes bya ba ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni shes pa'o //
translated: “By that” means by knowing.

original: skyes pa na ma lon pa'i 'o zhes bya ba ni shes na ni yod pa nyid nyams pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa na ma lon pa'i 'o zhes bya ba ni shes na ni yod pa nyid nyams pa'o //
translated: “If one knows that one has not completed twenty years,” then the existence is destroyed.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa thob pa la ni nyams pa nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa thob pa la ni nyams pa nyid do //
translated: If one obtains the complete, then the destruction itself.

original: ci dang po mngal gyi sgo nas btsas pa de nas brtsams te zla ba lhag pa med par so sor bgrang ba la bsnyen par rdzogs pa thob pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang po mngal gyi sgo nas btsas pa de nas brtsams te zla ba lhag pa med par so sor bgrang ba la bsnyen par rdzogs pa thob pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it not that one obtains full ordination by counting each month without remainder, beginning from the birth at the door of the womb?

original: de'i phyir mngal na gnas pa dang shol gyi zla ba dag dang yang bcas te'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mngal na gnas pa dang shol gyi zla ba dag dang yang bcas te'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “Including the months in the womb and the months of delay.”

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa nyid la de gnyis ka brten par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa nyid la de gnyis ka brten par bya ba ma yin no //

analyzed: ltung ba de dang brten pas bsnyen par rdzogs par ma grags pas shes par bya ba rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that one who is not known to be fully ordained because of relying on that downfall.

analyzed: mngal na gnas pa'i zla ba dag dang shol gyi zla ba lhag pa dang @265a * //

analyzed: bcas te / de'o lo nyi shu nyid brtsi bar bya'o //
