original: lo ma lon par bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: lo ma lon par bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: The downfall is for one who is not yet twenty years old and is fully ordained.

original: // gang las sa rko ba'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // gang las sa rko ba'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: From what is the offense of digging the earth?

original: de'i phyir rko 'am rkor bcug pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rko 'am rkor bcug pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “if one digs or has it dug.”

original: rko ba ni rang gis so //
analyzed: rko ba ni rang gis so //
translated: Digging is done by oneself.

original: rkor bcug pa ni gzhan la'o //
analyzed: rkor bcug pa ni gzhan la'o //
translated: Having it dug is done by another.

original: gang zhig de tsam zhig gis tha dad par bya ba gang yin pa la 'bras bu nyid kyis rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig de tsam zhig gis tha dad par bya ba gang yin pa la 'bras bu nyid kyis rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: That which is to be distinguished by just that much is established by its result.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni lan re btab pa la bya ba tha dad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni lan re btab pa la bya ba tha dad par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this should be understood as a different action for each instance.

original: 'byin pa la ni so sor 'gugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byin pa la ni so sor 'gugs pa'o //
translated: The one who digs or has it dug is the one who instigates the digging.

original: 'bad pa gzhan rab tu bsgrubs pas 'gugs pa tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: 'bad pa gzhan rab tu bsgrubs pas 'gugs pa tha dad pa'o //
translated: The one who instigates the digging is the one who makes the effort to have it dug.

original: gang zhig rko 'am rkor bcug pa la zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig rko 'am rkor bcug pa la zhe na /
translated: What if one digs or has it dug in a place that is not a field?

original: de'i phyir sa'i sa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sa'i sa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “in a field that is earth.”

original: sa'i rang bzhin gyis sa yin gyi bye ma dang rdo thal rgyu dang rdo la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa'i rang bzhin gyis sa yin gyi bye ma dang rdo thal rgyu dang rdo la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is a field that is earth by nature, not by nature sand, gravel, stone, etc.

original: ci 'di dag thams cad du ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'di dag thams cad du ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is this not so in all cases?

original: de'i phyir lag gi blas rgyu skar gyi sbyor bas rung bar byed pa med na thur ma sor bzhi tsam btsugs pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir lag gi blas rgyu skar gyi sbyor bas rung bar byed pa med na thur ma sor bzhi tsam btsugs pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it is said, “except when the astrologer, the one who knows the stars, declares it to be a favorable time.”

original: sa'i sa ji lta bu zhig la kha na ma tho ba ji lta bur 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sa'i sa ji lta bu zhig la kha na ma tho ba ji lta bur 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What kind of earth field is there in which there is a sin of a certain kind?

original: de'i phyir gal te rang bzhin can de yin na dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te rang bzhin can de yin na dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “if it is naturally a field, then it is a basic one.”

original: 'brel bar gyur pa'i gnas skabs rigs ma yin pa la nyes byas 'di zhes bya ba shugs kyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'brel bar gyur pa'i gnas skabs rigs ma yin pa la nyes byas 'di zhes bya ba shugs kyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood by implication that this is a minor offense in a situation that is not conducive.

original: ma 'brel par gyur pa'i gnas skabs la ni ltung ba med pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'brel par gyur pa'i gnas skabs la ni ltung ba med pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no downfall in a situation that is not conducive.

original: rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ni ji lta bu zhig yin rang bzhin can ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni ji lta bu zhig yin zhe na //
analyzed: rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ni ji lta bu zhig yin rang bzhin can ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni ji lta bu zhig yin zhe na //
translated: What is a natural offense? What is a non-natural offense?

original: de'i phyir snga ma shos ni zla ba gsum lon pa'i 'thas pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir snga ma shos ni zla ba gsum lon pa'i 'thas pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The first is the natural offense after three months.”

original: 'thas pa zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa nyams pa rnams la dang po nyid yan lag rnams la 'brel pa khas len par 'dod pa de lta bur gyur pa 'dod pa rnams la zhes bya ba shugs kyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'thas pa zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa nyams pa rnams la dang po nyid yan lag rnams la 'brel pa khas len par 'dod pa de lta bur gyur pa 'dod pa rnams la zhes bya ba shugs kyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The natural offense is the first offense for those who wish to accept the limbs of the vow after the connection has been lost. It should be understood by implication that this refers to those who are natural offenders.

original: gang gi phyir ma 'brel par gyur pa nyid la 'brel pa nyid nyams pas kyang cung zad kyang nyams par gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma 'brel par gyur pa nyid la 'brel pa nyid nyams pas kyang cung zad kyang nyams par gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: Because even when the connection is lost, there is no loss of anything at all.

original: ci ste gang nas brtsams nas 'brel par gyur pa nyid rtogs par bya'o /
analyzed: ci ste gang nas brtsams nas 'brel par gyur pa nyid rtogs par bya'o /
translated: But from what point on is it to be understood that it is related?

original: gang nas brtsams te sar pa nyid dgod pa dang lhan cig tu so sor smra ba sngon gyi rang bzhin can la ji tsam du de'i rnam pa'i dus la de tsam so sor gnas pa 'di rtogs par bya'am zhe na /
analyzed: gang nas brtsams te sar pa nyid dgod pa dang lhan cig tu so sor smra ba sngon gyi rang bzhin can la ji tsam du de'i rnam pa'i dus la de tsam so sor gnas pa 'di rtogs par bya'am zhe na /
translated: From what point on is it to be understood that it is related to the new earth, and that it remains separate as long as it is in that state?

original: de'i phyir gal te char chu zhod na'o zhes bya ba smos so//
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te char chu zhod na'o zhes bya ba smos so//
translated: Therefore, if it rains, he says.

original: @265b dus gzhan gyi tshe zla ba du lon na rang bzhin can du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: @265b dus gzhan gyi tshe zla ba du lon na rang bzhin can du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: At what time, other than that, does it become natural?

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyi tshe na drug go //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyi tshe na drug go //
translated: Therefore, after six days.

original: rtsig pa la ni sa nyid ma yin par shes par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtsig pa la ni sa nyid ma yin par shes par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not understand that the wall is not earth.

original: 'dis ni khang thog kyang sa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni khang thog kyang sa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: By this, one should understand that the roof is also earth.

original: sa phung yang 'brel pa la 'dir sa gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sa phung yang 'brel pa la 'dir sa gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: And the pile of earth is related to the earth, but not to another earth.

original: 'thas par gyur na ni sa'i gong bu nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'thas par gyur na ni sa'i gong bu nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when it becomes solid, it becomes a mass of earth.

original: sa phung gal te steng gi cha ni 'thas pa 'og gi cha'i yan lag ma 'thas par gyur na de ni sa nyid ma yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sa phung gal te steng gi cha ni 'thas pa 'og gi cha'i yan lag ma 'thas par gyur na de ni sa nyid ma yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: If the upper part of a pile of earth were to harden and the lower part were not to harden, it should be understood that it is not earth.

original: snga ma 'thas par gyur na ni mtshungs pa rnams la mtshan nyid rnams la rab tu byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: snga ma 'thas par gyur na ni mtshungs pa rnams la mtshan nyid rnams la rab tu byung ba nyid do //
translated: If the former hardens, then the characteristics are fully present in the similar ones.

original: 'dus pa dag la ni shas che bas mtshan nyid dag rab tu 'byed pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dus pa dag la ni shas che bas mtshan nyid dag rab tu 'byed pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the case of collections, the characteristics are distinguished by predominance.🔽In the case of the characteristics, the substance's own characteristic is established by the predominance of the part of the substance's characteristic, even if other substances are present.

original: mtshan nyid dag la zhes bya ba ni rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid rigs mi mthun pa'i rdzas yod par gyur kyang rdzas kyi mtshan nyid gang gi cha shas che ba nyid ni de rnams kyis tshogs pa 'di gzhag pa yin te bsten pa yin no zhes bya🔽ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dag la zhes bya ba ni rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid rigs mi mthun pa'i rdzas yod par gyur kyang rdzas kyi mtshan nyid gang gi cha shas che ba nyid ni de rnams kyis tshogs pa 'di gzhag pa yin te bsten pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that the collection of those is established, that is, relied upon.

original: gang gi phyir sal sogs pa 'dus ba dag la rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid rnams ni mang ba nyid kyis rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sal sogs pa 'dus ba dag la rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid rnams ni mang ba nyid kyis rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Because in the case of collections such as earth, the substance's own characteristics are established by predominance.

original: de'i phyir nyung du gzhan yod pa'i rdzas nyid la ni phal che ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni tshig pa rnams la thams cad nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyung du gzhan yod pa'i rdzas nyid la ni phal che ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni tshig pa rnams la thams cad nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the substance that is less is the majority.

original: de'i phyir 'dir rko ba dang rkor bcug pa dag la dngos gzhi kho na ste zhes bya ba ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir rko ba dang rkor bcug pa dag la dngos gzhi kho na ste zhes bya ba ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, here it is not the case that only the one who digs and the one who makes dig have the actual basis.

original: tshig pa nyid ni nyams pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshig pa nyid ni nyams pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning is that it is not so.🔽The burning of the earth itself should be known as the burning.

original: sa nyid tshig pa nyid ni nyams pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa nyid tshig pa nyid ni nyams pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the burning of the earth itself should be known as the burning.

original: smin pa nyid ni sa nyid ma yin zhes bya ba 'dis byas par bya'o //
analyzed: smin pa nyid ni sa nyid ma yin zhes bya ba 'dis byas par bya'o //
translated: This should be done by saying that the ripening itself is not the earth.

original: nyams pa nyid la ni phyed nyid do zhes bya ba ni phyed nyid de nyes byas byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyams pa nyid la ni phyed nyid do zhes bya ba ni phyed nyid de nyes byas byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Half is in the burning itself. The meaning is that half is the one who makes the transgression.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las sa tshig pa rko na nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las sa tshig pa rko na nyes byas so //
translated: Here the text is: If one digs the burning earth, it is a minor offense.

original: rkor 'jug na nyes bya so //
analyzed: rkor 'jug na nyes bya so //
translated: If one makes dig, it is a minor offense.

original: rnam par nyams pa yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par nyams pa yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The same applies to the degeneration of the wholesome roots.🔽The earth, the wall, the plaster, and the floor are half of the second.

original: sa zhag dang dogs dang rtsig pa dang de'i skyang nul grugs pa dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni phyed nyid do zhes sbyar ro //🔽dus gang gi tshe skyang nul zhes bya ba'i sgra brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sa zhag dang dogs dang rtsig pa dang de'i skyang nul grugs pa dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni phyed nyid do zhes sbyar ro // dus gang gi tshe skyang nul zhes bya ba'i sgra brjod pa'o //
translated: The word “and” indicates that the time of the plastering is also half of the second.🔽The earth, the wall, the plaster, and the floor are half of the second.

original: rdo thal rgyu dang bye ma la sogs pa shas che ba yang ngo zhes bya ba yang phyed nyid do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rdo thal rgyu dang bye ma la sogs pa shas che ba yang ngo zhes bya ba yang phyed nyid do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The word “and” indicates that the time of the plastering is also half of the second.🔽The gift of nectar is the gift of medicine.

original: bdud rtsi'i sbyin pas rdzas lhag ma dag la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras bsnyegs so //🔽bya ba dag kyang ngo @266a * //
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i sbyin pas rdzas lhag ma dag la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras bsnyegs so // bya ba dag kyang ngo @266a * //
translated: The word “etc.” indicates the remaining gifts.

original: zhes bya ba yang phyed nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yang phyed nyid do //
translated: The word “and” indicates that the gift of medicine is also half of the second.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: de'i phyir phur pa 'byin pa dang ri mo 'dren pa dang sa'i phye ma 'dren pa'i lci ba 'gogs pa dang 'dam bskyod pa dang / de dang 'brel pa'i phru ba la sogs pa 'degs pa dang 'jigs pa'i bdag nyid kyi tsha sgo dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phur pa 'byin pa dang ri mo 'dren pa dang sa'i phye ma 'dren pa'i lci ba 'gogs pa dang 'dam bskyod pa dang / de dang 'brel pa'i phru ba la sogs pa 'degs pa dang 'jigs pa'i bdag nyid kyi tsha sgo dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “also the lifting of a stake, drawing a picture, stopping the flow of mud, stirring mud, and lifting a pot and so on that is connected with that, and the burning of a fire that has the nature of fear.”

original: phur pa btab pa ni ltung byed du 'gyur la zhes bya ba 'di la bzung bas 'dir bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phur pa btab pa ni ltung byed du 'gyur la zhes bya ba 'di la bzung bas 'dir bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, it should be understood that “lifting a stake” is a downfall through holding.

original: sa'i phye ma 'dren pa'i lci ba 'gogs pa de ni sa'i phye ma 'dren pa la nyes byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa'i phye ma 'dren pa'i lci ba 'gogs pa de ni sa'i phye ma 'dren pa la nyes byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Stopping the flow of mud” means that there is an offense for stopping the flow of mud.

original: de dang 'brel pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'dam rdzab dang 'brel pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'dam rdzab dang 'brel pa bstan pa'o //
translated: “That which is connected with that” refers to the teaching on that which is connected with mud.

original: ci bsam pa gang yang rung bas 'dir de dag spyad na de'i mthar thug kha na ma tho ba rdzogs pa'am chung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci bsam pa gang yang rung bas 'dir de dag spyad na de'i mthar thug kha na ma tho ba rdzogs pa'am chung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one engages in any of these with any intention, does the downfall become complete or incomplete?

original: de'i phyir 'dir gzhig pa'i blo dang ldan na de'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir gzhig pa'i blo dang ldan na de'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, here, if one has a concealing mind, that is,

original: 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po yin no //
translated: perception is the principal factor.

original: sa la zhes bya ba 'di la yang de 'dir 'jug pa bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sa la zhes bya ba 'di la yang de 'dir 'jug pa bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: In this case, on the ground should be understood as teaching the entry into this.

original: gang gi phyir sba ba'i blos phur bu dbyung ba la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams la 'di ni kha na ma tho ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sba ba'i blos phur bu dbyung ba la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams la 'di ni kha na ma tho ba'o //
translated: Because of a concealing mind, in actions such as pulling out a stake, this is a downfall.

original: de'i phyir bgrang ba dang shod dgod pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir bgrang ba dang shod dgod pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni //
translated: Therefore, there is no offense in the intention to count, to recite, and so forth.

original: gang la rnam par sbed pa 'di lta bu'i 'di lta ste pur bu dbyung ba'i glags med pa der cho ga 'di la zhes bya ba rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang la rnam par sbed pa 'di lta bu'i 'di lta ste pur bu dbyung ba'i glags med pa der cho ga 'di la zhes bya ba rig par bya'o //
translated: Where there is no opportunity to pull out a stake, and so forth, in that case, this rule should be understood.

original: sa rko ba'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: sa rko ba'i ltung byed do /
translated: The downfall is called digging the ground.

original: // / ha cang bslang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: // / ha cang bslang bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not dig too deeply.

original: mgron du bos pa'i khyim du gdugs tshod bskul pa de med na 'gror rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mgron du bos pa'i khyim du gdugs tshod bskul pa de med na 'gror rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one is invited to a house, and the meal is not there, it is suitable to go.

original: rung zhes bya ba ni 'dir slong ba'i rnam pa nyid kyi phyir mi rung bar shes par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rung zhes bya ba ni 'dir slong ba'i rnam pa nyid kyi phyir mi rung bar shes par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: “It is proper” means that it is not improper because it is a form of begging.

original: bya bar gyur pa dus las yol bar khas blangs pa bcag pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya bar gyur pa dus las yol bar khas blangs pa bcag pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one does not break one’s promise to eat at a proper time.

original: gang du bdag gis gdugs bskul bar mi nus kyi rang gis dus shes nas shog shig ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang du bdag gis gdugs bskul bar mi nus kyi rang gis dus shes nas shog shig ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “When one is unable to inform the householder, one should go after informing oneself of the proper time.”

original: dus las yol du byed na brims shig ces bsgo ba yang ngo zhes bya ba ni zhu ba'i don byas pa nyid gyi phyir rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dus las yol du byed na brims shig ces bsgo ba yang ngo zhes bya ba ni zhu ba'i don byas pa nyid gyi phyir rig par bya'o //
translated: “If one is going to be late, one should inform the householder.” This is to be understood as the meaning of the request.

original: de med na zhes bya ba ni dus las yol du dogs pa de med na'o //
analyzed: de med na zhes bya ba ni dus las yol du dogs pa de med na'o //
translated: “If there is no such reason” means if there is no reason to fear being late.

original: gdugs tshod ma bskul ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gdugs tshod ma bskul ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: “If one does not inform the householder of the time” means

original: 'dir gdugs tshod bskul ba'i khyim du ste /
analyzed: 'dir gdugs tshod bskul ba'i khyim du ste /
translated: in the house where one is to eat.

original: der 'gror rung ba ni dus las yol du byed pa yod srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der 'gror rung ba ni dus las yol du byed pa yod srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is proper to go there because it is possible that one will be late.

original: dus las yol du byed na brims shig ces @266b bsgo ba yang ngo zhes bya ba ni mgron du bos pa'i khyim du son pa na gdugs tshod yol du byed na /
analyzed: dus las yol du byed na brims shig ces @266b bsgo ba yang ngo zhes bya ba ni mgron du bos pa'i khyim du son pa na gdugs tshod yol du byed na /
translated: If it is past noon, then distribute the meal.

original: gdugs tshod brims shig ces bskul du rung ba nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: gdugs tshod brims shig ces bskul du rung ba nyid yin pa'o //
translated: This is the proper procedure when one has arrived at the house of an invited householder, if it is past noon.

original: tshig 'bru de nyid ma yin pa la gus par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshig 'bru de nyid ma yin pa la gus par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not respect the very words that are not the Buddha's.

original: tshig gang rnams la sngags nyid kyis bsdu ba mdzad pa de rnams la de nyid kyi phyir bsdu ba sngags kyis des pa'i skabs la brjod pas 'di ni me 'jug par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig gang rnams la sngags nyid kyis bsdu ba mdzad pa de rnams la de nyid kyi phyir bsdu ba sngags kyis des pa'i skabs la brjod pas 'di ni me 'jug par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The very words that the Buddha himself collected, because of that very fact, are the occasion for the collection by the Buddha. This should be understood as the ignition of the fire.

original: don de go bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don de go bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: For the purpose of understanding that meaning,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshig 'bru gang du gsungs pa de nyid ma gtogs pa de las gzhan la gus par mi bya ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshig 'bru gang du gsungs pa de nyid ma gtogs pa de las gzhan la gus par mi bya ste /
translated: one should not respect anything other than the very words that the Blessed One spoke.

original: tshig 'du de nyid kyis don de nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: tshig 'du de nyid kyis don de nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: That very meaning should not be expressed by those very words.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa de'i 'dod pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa de'i 'dod pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should not desire that perfection.

original: 'dir gzhung ni stan dag ci ba der gyis shig / tshe dang ldan pa khyed kyi ci bde ba zhes bya ba ni bdag gis mi shes kyi 'di ltar stan dag ni khyed kho na'i phyir bshams so zhes zer ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni stan dag ci ba der gyis shig / tshe dang ldan pa khyed kyi ci bde ba zhes bya ba ni bdag gis mi shes kyi 'di ltar stan dag ni khyed kho na'i phyir bshams so zhes zer ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: gal te de skad zer na ci bder brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no /
analyzed: gal te de skad zer na ci bder brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no /
translated: “If they say that, say ‘Whatever is comfortable.’”

original: de lta bur gyur pa thams cad la 'di rnam par gzhag pa de'i phyir thams cad du zhes bya ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa thams cad la 'di rnam par gzhag pa de'i phyir thams cad du zhes bya ba shes pa'o //
translated: Since this is the case for all, it is understood to be “in every way.”

original: so sor mgron du bos pa bdag gir bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: so sor mgron du bos pa bdag gir bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: “One should take the invitation of the individual.”

original: 'di mi rung bar shes par mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di mi rung bar shes par mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should not think this is inappropriate.

original: dge 'dun na mgron du bos pa ni de'i khongs su gtogs pas mgron du bos pa nyid do //
analyzed: dge 'dun na mgron du bos pa ni de'i khongs su gtogs pas mgron du bos pa nyid do //
translated: When the Saṅgha is invited, since it is included in that, it is invited itself.

original: spyan drangs pa yod na khas blang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: spyan drangs pa yod na khas blang bar mi bya ste /
translated: If there is an invitation, one should not accept it.

original: de lta bas na mgron du bos pa ma yin pa nyid la dge 'dun gyis so sor mgron du bos pa bdag gir bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na mgron du bos pa ma yin pa nyid la dge 'dun gyis so sor mgron du bos pa bdag gir bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Saṅgha should take possession of the invitation of an individual who is not invited.

original: tshul 'di lta bu bya bar 'dod pa la 'brel pa'i don du gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: tshul 'di lta bu bya bar 'dod pa la 'brel pa'i don du gsungs pa ni /
translated: This rule is stated for the purpose of connection in the case of one who wishes to act in this way:

original: dge 'dun dang bcas te mgron du bos pa yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dge 'dun dang bcas te mgron du bos pa yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “Even if the Saṅgha is invited, the individual should not be relied upon.”

original: dge 'dun spyan drangs pa yod na gang zag gis kyang mngon par mi brten pa ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun spyan drangs pa yod na gang zag gis kyang mngon par mi brten pa ni khyad par ro //
translated: The difference is that if the Saṅgha is invited, the individual should not be relied upon.

original: ji ltar gtsug lag khang gi kha zas ni gang zag mgron du bos pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dis zhes bya ba'i cho ga 'di'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gtsug lag khang gi kha zas ni gang zag mgron du bos pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dis zhes bya ba'i cho ga 'di'o //
translated: Just as the food of the monastery is not for the individual who is not invited, in the same way, by this rule,

original: dus thams cad du yang zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun nam gang zag ji srid 'tsho'i bar du mgron du bos na yang bdag gir bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dus thams cad du yang zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun nam gang zag ji srid 'tsho'i bar du mgron du bos na yang bdag gir bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: at all times, even if the Saṅgha or the individual is invited for as long as one lives, it should be taken possession of.

original: ci zhig byas nas mgron du gnyer ba las ring du 'dug pa'am ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig byas nas mgron du gnyer ba las ring du 'dug pa'am ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is done by the one who is invited to stay for a long time or to commit a downfall?

original: de'i phyir tshig rnam par gzhag pa @267a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig rnam par gzhag pa @267a * //
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: med par mgron du gnyer ba dang ldan pa la /
analyzed: med par mgron du gnyer ba dang ldan pa la /
translated: If one invites without establishing the words,🔽later, one should eat the food prepared after the four months are complete,

original: phyis gzhan nam yang dang yang du 'am dus kyi mgron du gnyer bar ma byas pa zla ba bzhi pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'og tu bshams pa zos na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phyis gzhan nam yang dang yang du 'am dus kyi mgron du gnyer bar ma byas pa zla ba bzhi pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'og tu bshams pa zos na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: not having invited others or repeatedly inviting others.

original: gang zhig dus 'di tsam du rtag pa nyid du nges pa rnam par gzhag nas khyad par du dge 'dun gyi sgo nas mgron du gnyer bar byed pa rab tu spyar ba'i mgron du gnyer bar byas pa'am /
analyzed: gang zhig dus 'di tsam du rtag pa nyid du nges pa rnam par gzhag nas khyad par du dge 'dun gyi sgo nas mgron du gnyer bar byed pa rab tu spyar ba'i mgron du gnyer bar byas pa'am /
translated: If one establishes the time as definite for just this time and invites the Saṅgha in particular, then the invitation is applied.

original: nye bar spyan drangs par gyur pa 'di lta bur gyur ba'i mgron du bos pa'i 'og tu dge 'dun la gzhan du byas pa nyid la gang zag la byas pas dge 'dun la byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: nye bar spyan drangs par gyur pa 'di lta bur gyur ba'i mgron du bos pa'i 'og tu dge 'dun la gzhan du byas pa nyid la gang zag la byas pas dge 'dun la byas pa nyid do //
translated: If one invites or invites near in this way, then after the invitation, if one does it for the Saṅgha in another place, it is done for the Saṅgha, not done for the individual.

original: yang dang yang du'am shin tu don nyid kyis mgron du bos pa byas pa ni zla ba bzhi'i mthar thug pa'i 'og tu bshams pa rnam par gzhag pa byas pa ni mgron du gnyer bar byas pa kha zas su byas pa za bar byed pa la zhes bya🔽ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang dang yang du'am shin tu don nyid kyis mgron du bos pa byas pa ni zla ba bzhi'i mthar thug pa'i 'og tu bshams pa rnam par gzhag pa byas pa ni mgron du gnyer bar byas pa kha zas su byas pa za bar byed pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Repeatedly or with very good reason, he is invited as a guest. The arrangement of the food is made after the end of the four months. The meaning of the words is: he who is invited as a guest, who has eaten the food, and who is eating the food.

original: mgron du gnyer ba las lhag par gnas pa'i kha na ma tho ba 'di dang mgron du ma bos pa'i don du kha zas bsod pa'i kha na ma tho ba'i cho ga 'di gnyis kyi bye brag rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mgron du gnyer ba las lhag par gnas pa'i kha na ma tho ba 'di dang mgron du ma bos pa'i don du kha zas bsod pa'i kha na ma tho ba'i cho ga 'di gnyis kyi bye brag rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The distinction between this offense of staying on after the invitation and the offense of eating good food without being invited should be understood.

original: rtag tu mgron du bos pa las gzhan du zhes bya ba 'di la nges par rnam par gzhag pa med par zhes bya ba bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: rtag tu mgron du bos pa las gzhan du zhes bya ba 'di la nges par rnam par gzhag pa med par zhes bya ba bsdu ba'o //
translated: The words other than the regular invitation in the verse should be understood to mean without a fixed rule.

original: dngos su ni zla ba bzhi'i 'og tu rnyed pa la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba de la 'di bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: dngos su ni zla ba bzhi'i 'og tu rnyed pa la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba de la 'di bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: The purpose of this rule is to show that there is no offense in obtaining food after the four months.

original: gzhan dag gis so sor mgron du gnyer ba zhes bya ba de la gzhan du zhes bya ba de'i 'di bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis so sor mgron du gnyer ba zhes bya ba de la gzhan du zhes bya ba de'i 'di bsdu ba'o //
translated: Others call it “individual invitation.” “

original: 'dir kha zas bsod pa la mngon par brten pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir kha zas bsod pa la mngon par brten pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Here there is no reliance on excellent food.

original: de bas na kha zas tha mal pa la yang 'dir yongs su rdzogs pa la kha na ma tho ba byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na kha zas tha mal pa la yang 'dir yongs su rdzogs pa la kha na ma tho ba byed pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, even with ordinary food, there is a complete offense here.

original: 'dir gzhung ni bsdu ba bstan pa las dge slong zla ba bzhi'i bar du mgron du bos pa las cung zad lhag par ro myong bar byed na so sor mgron du bos pa dang / rtag tu mgron du bos pa ma gtogs par thams cad du ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bsdu ba bstan pa las dge slong zla ba bzhi'i bar du mgron du bos pa las cung zad lhag par ro myong bar byed na so sor mgron du bos pa dang / rtag tu mgron du bos pa ma gtogs par thams cad du ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the text is taught in the Vinaya: “If a monk, having been invited for four months, experiences the taste of more than a little, it is a downfall for all except in the case of individual invitation and perpetual invitation.”

original: rnam par rig byed la ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba 'di ni sbyor ba la nyes byas so zhes bya ba de'i spros pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed la ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba 'di ni sbyor ba la nyes byas so zhes bya ba de'i spros pa yin te /
translated: Here, the offense is a minor offense for informative action. This is an elaboration of the statement that there is an offense for preparation.

original: 'dir rnam par rig byed ces bya ba 'di ni zla ba bzhi las lhag par bshams pa'i zan gyi phyir nye bar 'gro ba yang yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir rnam par rig byed ces bya ba 'di ni zla ba bzhi las lhag par bshams pa'i zan gyi phyir nye bar 'gro ba yang yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, “indicative” should be understood as referring to going to the house of a layperson for the sake of food prepared for more than four months.

original: nad pa la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni nad pa'i phyir blangs pa dang za ba ni @267b nyes pa med do //🔽'dir gzhung ni zhu ba dag las mi na bar blangs te za na blangs pa la ni nyes byas la /
analyzed: nad pa la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni nad pa'i phyir blangs pa dang za ba ni @267b nyes pa med do // 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba dag las mi na bar blangs te za na blangs pa la ni nyes byas la /
translated: There is no offense for the sick.

original: zos pa la ni ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa de nyid mdo 'dir bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: zos pa la ni ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa de nyid mdo 'dir bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The text here is the same as that cited in the Questions of Upāli, which states that there is an offense of wrong conduct for accepting food from a layperson who is not sick and a serious offense for eating it.🔽From a relative.

original: nye du las kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni sbyin bdag nye du las blangs te zos pa la yang ltung ba med do //🔽'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las khyim bdag de de'i phu nu 'am /
analyzed: nye du las kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni sbyin bdag nye du las blangs te zos pa la yang ltung ba med do // 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las khyim bdag de de'i phu nu 'am /
translated: There is no offense if the food is accepted from a relative layperson and eaten.

original: bu tsha'am bu sring yin na de dag las ro myong bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bu tsha'am bu sring yin na de dag las ro myong bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The text here is the same as that cited in the Questions of Upāli, which states that if the layperson is a relative, such as a brother, son, or sister, then it is permissible to eat the food.

original: rnam par 'khyams pa las snga ma ni tha dad pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'khyams pa zhes bya ba khyim par babs pa las snga ma zhes bya ba de dge slong nyid ni tha dad pa nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'khyams pa las snga ma ni tha dad pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'khyams pa zhes bya ba khyim par babs pa las snga ma zhes bya ba de dge slong nyid ni tha dad pa nyid yin pa'o //
translated: The one called “wandering” is a householder. The former is a monk. That is different.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las tshe dang ldan pa la gang dgos pa de khyer cig ces dge slong la bstabs par gyur pa las dge slong de rnam par 'khyams par gyur cing de dang bsnyen par rdzogs par bgyid na /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las tshe dang ldan pa la gang dgos pa de khyer cig ces dge slong la bstabs par gyur pa las dge slong de rnam par 'khyams par gyur cing de dang bsnyen par rdzogs par bgyid na /
translated: Here is the text: “The venerable one should take what is needed.” The monk was served. The monk wandered. He was fully ordained with him.

original: dge slong des cho ga snga ma de nyid kyis ro myang bar bgyi 'am /
analyzed: dge slong des cho ga snga ma de nyid kyis ro myang bar bgyi 'am /
translated: Should that monk taste with the very same former rite?

original: gal te yang stobs par byed na ni ro myang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te yang stobs par byed na ni ro myang bar bya ba'o //
translated: If he is able to serve, he should taste.

original: stobs par mi byed na ni ro myang bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: stobs par mi byed na ni ro myang bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If he is not able to serve, he should not taste.

original: de ni ma bstabs pa'i nyes pa byed pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'khyams pa'i 'og tu mgron du bos pa la bsod pa slong ba'i kha na ma tho ba byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni ma bstabs pa'i nyes pa byed pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'khyams pa'i 'og tu mgron du bos pa la bsod pa slong ba'i kha na ma tho ba byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means that after wandering, one commits the fault of begging for good food at the invitation.

original: mdun rol du yang gang gis ma bstabs pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mdun rol du yang gang gis ma bstabs pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In front, by whom it is not served,

original: zla ba bzhi'i 'og 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi zla ba bzhi ma tshang ba'i mdun rol du yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zla ba bzhi'i 'og 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi zla ba bzhi ma tshang ba'i mdun rol du yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means that it is not only in the last four months, but also in front of the four months that are not complete.

original: bza' bar bya ba'i dngos po gang gis mgron du bos pa de slong ngam zan ma bstabs pa'i nyes pa byed pa nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: bza' bar bya ba'i dngos po gang gis mgron du bos pa de slong ngam zan ma bstabs pa'i nyes pa byed pa nyid yin pa'o //
translated: By whatever thing that is to be eaten, by which one is invited as a guest, one commits the fault of begging or not serving.

original: mgron du gnyer ba las ring du 'dug pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: mgron du gnyer ba las ring du 'dug pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: The fourth downfall is to stay away from an invitation.

original: // / bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa spong ba'i ltung byed la byed pa po gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: // / bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa spong ba'i ltung byed la byed pa po gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the agent of the downfall of rejecting the precepts?

original: de'i phyir shes gtso bo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes gtso bo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “the principal one,”

original: 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: the one who is the chief in terms of perception.

original: gang la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po yin zhe na /
translated: With regard to what is he the chief in terms of perception?

original: de'i phyir mngon par shes pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon par shes pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said: “in the very clear knowledge.”

original: mngon par shes pa nyid gang la zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa nyid gang la zhe na /
translated: With regard to what is he the very clear knowledge?

original: de'i phyir smra ba po la'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir smra ba po la'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said: “in the speaker.”

original: des gang la mngon par shes pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: des gang la mngon par shes pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: With regard to what is he the speaker?

original: de'i phyir bslab pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bslab pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “in the training.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni yang dag @268a * //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni yang dag @268a * //
translated: Here, the text is:

original: pa kho nar byis pa glen pa mi gsal ba mi mkhas pa dag yin na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: pa kho nar byis pa glen pa mi gsal ba mi mkhas pa dag yin na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “If they are childish, foolish, unclear, and unskilled, there is no offense.”

original: 'dir cho ga 'di rnam par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir cho ga 'di rnam par gnas pa yin te /
translated: Here, this rule is established:

original: mngon du byas pa la drang srong gis ye shes kyis 'dul ba mngon par shes pa nyid la yid ches pa las nye bar thos pa la 'dir 'du shes dag pa ste /
analyzed: mngon du byas pa la drang srong gis ye shes kyis 'dul ba mngon par shes pa nyid la yid ches pa las nye bar thos pa la 'dir 'du shes dag pa ste /
translated: In the clear knowledge of the sage’s wisdom, the clear knowledge is trusted. In the oral tradition, here the perception is pure.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Not otherwise.

original: de'i phyir de rnams la gcig tu kha na ma tho ba mi skyed pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams la gcig tu kha na ma tho ba mi skyed pa ste /
translated: Therefore, they do not generate a single offense,

original: gzhan 'ga' zhig la ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan 'ga' zhig la ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: but it should be understood that this is not the case for others.

original: gal te byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: If you say that he is the agent,

original: de'i phyir / dge slong gis khyed kyis 'di la bslab par bya'o zhes brjod pa na 'am bsgo ba ni mi slob pa zhes rgyu'i dngos po des go bar byed pa la mi shes pa nyid sgrogs par byed pa'i tshig brjod na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / dge slong gis khyed kyis 'di la bslab par bya'o zhes brjod pa na 'am bsgo ba ni mi slob pa zhes rgyu'i dngos po des go bar byed pa la mi shes pa nyid sgrogs par byed pa'i tshig brjod na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then the text says, “When a monk says, ‘You should train in this,’ or ‘You should be instructed in this,’ he proclaims his own ignorance by these words that make known his status as the cause.”

original: brjod pa na'am zhes bya ba ni bslab pa la zhes bya ba 'dis skabs kyis so sor gnas pa'i 'brel pa can du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: brjod pa na'am zhes bya ba ni bslab pa la zhes bya ba 'dis skabs kyis so sor gnas pa'i 'brel pa can du rig par bya'o //
translated: “Or” in the phrase “when he says or” is used in the sense of “in this training,” which is connected with the word “abide.”

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba las gsungs pa las te /
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba las gsungs pa las te /
translated: “In this” means in the Vinaya,

original: mdo sde las gsungs pa ni nyes byas kyi'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo sde las gsungs pa ni nyes byas kyi'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said in the sūtras that the training in the Vinaya is a minor offense.

original: bsgo ba na zhes bya ba ni brjod pa la'o //
analyzed: bsgo ba na zhes bya ba ni brjod pa la'o //
translated: “When he is instructed” means when he is told.

original: 'di la khyod kyis bslab par bya'o zhes mos par byas na'o //
analyzed: 'di la khyod kyis bslab par bya'o zhes mos par byas na'o //
translated: One should have conviction in this and train in it.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las /
translated: Here, some texts state:

original: 'dul ba dang nye bar gyur pa'i mdo sde rnams bzhag nas 'di skad ces smra bar byed de /
analyzed: 'dul ba dang nye bar gyur pa'i mdo sde rnams bzhag nas 'di skad ces smra bar byed de /
translated: Having set aside the Vinaya and the sūtras that are close to it, one should say,🔽I should not train in this.

original: bdag gis 'di la bslab par mi bya'o zhes zer na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gis 'di la bslab par mi bya'o zhes zer na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one says that, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de bas na 'di brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is stated.

original: gang gis 'di ltar brjod pa zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis 'di ltar brjod pa zhe na /
translated: By whom is this stated?

original: dge slong zhes smos pas so //
analyzed: dge slong zhes smos pas so //
translated: By the one who is called a monk.

original: rnam pa gang gis mi shes pa srid pa nyid kyis phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis mi shes pa srid pa nyid kyis phyir zhe na /
translated: By what aspect is it said that one does not know?🔽Therefore, it is stated:

original: de'i phyir mi slob bo zhes rgyu'i dngos po des go bar byed pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi slob bo zhes rgyu'i dngos po des go bar byed pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: One who does not train in this training

original: bdag gis bslab pa 'di la mi slob bo zhes de skad zer ba ste /
analyzed: bdag gis bslab pa 'di la mi slob bo zhes de skad zer ba ste /
translated: means one who says, I do not train in this training.

original: gang gi phyir khyod mi shes pa nyid sgrogs par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyod mi shes pa nyid sgrogs par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it that one proclaims one's own ignorance?🔽Therefore, it is stated:

original: de'i phyir go bar byed pa la zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir go bar byed pa la zhes smos te /
translated: To one who understands.

original: gang gi phyir khyod mi shes pa de'i phyir kho bo mi slob po zhes go bar byed pa la mi shes pa nyid sgrogs par byed pa'i tshig gang yin pa de brjod na kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyod mi shes pa de'i phyir kho bo mi slob po zhes go bar byed pa la mi shes pa nyid sgrogs par byed pa'i tshig gang yin pa de brjod na kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: If you say that word which proclaims ignorance, you will incur this offense.🔽The Sutra states: “There is an offense for one who says, ‘I will not train in this,’ but it is not a downfall.”

original: mdo sde las gsungs pa la ni nyes byas kyi'o zhes bya ba yang mngon par shes pa nyid la zhes bya ba 'di'i mthar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba la @268b sogs pa brjod par gyur pa la ji srid du tshig brjod pa la nyes byas kyi byed🔽pa po nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mdo sde las gsungs pa la ni nyes byas kyi'o zhes bya ba yang mngon par shes pa nyid la zhes bya ba 'di'i mthar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba la @268b sogs pa brjod par gyur pa la ji srid du tshig brjod pa la nyes byas kyi byed pa po nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This should be added to the end of the statement, “I will not train in clairvoyance.”🔽The meaning is: As long as you say those words, you incur the offense of not training.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las /🔽'dul ba dang ldan pa dag ma gtogs pa mdo sde dag las 'di skad ces kho bo 'di la mi slob po zhes zer na nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las / 'dul ba dang ldan pa dag ma gtogs pa mdo sde dag las 'di skad ces kho bo 'di la mi slob po zhes zer na nyes byas so //
translated: Here is the text of a question and answer:🔽“Except for those who possess the Vinaya, if one says, ‘I will not train in this’ in the sutras, there is an offense.

original: gzhan mdo sde nyid bzhag pa 'di las mngon par brten pa shes pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan mdo sde nyid bzhag pa 'di las mngon par brten pa shes pa yin no //
translated: This is known as relying on the sutras themselves.”

original: bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa spang ba'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: bslab pa la nye bar 'jog pa spang ba'i ltung byed do /
translated: This is the downfall through violating the rules of training.

original: // / ci zhig byas na 'jug pa gang la nyan rna las gyur pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / ci zhig byas na 'jug pa gang la nyan rna las gyur pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the downfall through listening?

original: de'i phyir dge slong dag rtsod par gyur pa dge slong dag dang gros byed pa na nyan pa'i phyir rna gtod na ste nye bar zhi bar 'dod pas ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong dag rtsod par gyur pa dge slong dag dang gros byed pa na nyan pa'i phyir rna gtod na ste nye bar zhi bar 'dod pas ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “If a monk, when the monks are discussing, turns his ear to listen, except if he wishes to pacify the dispute.”

original: yul gyi don gcig la brten pa'i rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba dag mang po zhig yod mod kyi /
analyzed: yul gyi don gcig la brten pa'i rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba dag mang po zhig yod mod kyi /
translated: Although there are many disputants and opponents who rely on the same object,

original: 'on kyang rigs gnyis yin pa'i phyir dge slong dag ces gnyis kyi tshig tu byas so //
analyzed: 'on kyang rigs gnyis yin pa'i phyir dge slong dag ces gnyis kyi tshig tu byas so //
translated: nevertheless, since there are two types, it says “monks,” in the dual.

original: rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba'i dge slong gang yin pa de dag la dge slong rnams kyis sdum pa gang yin pa de la rna gtod pa'i don du rtse gcig tu byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba'i dge slong gang yin pa de dag la dge slong rnams kyis sdum pa gang yin pa de la rna gtod pa'i don du rtse gcig tu byed pa'o //
translated: The monks who are the disputants and opponents are the monks who are the mediators.

original: ci rna gtod pa thams cad la yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci rna gtod pa thams cad la yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it a downfall for all who turn their ears to listen?

original: de'i phyir nye bar zhi bar 'dod pas ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar zhi bar 'dod pas ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the root text states, “except when one wishes to pacify them.”

original: rna gtod cing nyan pa dor nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rna gtod cing nyan pa dor nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should avoid listening with the intention of criticizing.

original: 'dir gang la kha na ma tho ba ji lta bur 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir gang la kha na ma tho ba ji lta bur 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Here, what is the offense and what is its nature?

original: de'i phyir sgra thos pa la ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra thos pa la ni nyes byas so //
translated: The root text states, “The offense is a minor offense for hearing the words,🔽but a downfall for understanding the meaning.”

original: don la ni dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba ni sgra'i don go nas don so sor rig pa'o //
analyzed: don la ni dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba ni sgra'i don go nas don so sor rig pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the words is understood when one comprehends the meaning.

original: de bas na 'dir sbyor ba thob pa ni sgra so sor rig pa dang 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'dir sbyor ba thob pa ni sgra so sor rig pa dang 'brel pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the application of this rule is connected with the comprehension of the words.

original: dngos gzhi'i ltung ba na smad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i ltung ba na smad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The downfall is not incurred when one is criticized.

original: ci don gang yang rung ba kho nas dngos gzhir 'gyur ram zhe na /🔽de'i phyir 'khrug long bya ba la /
analyzed: ci don gang yang rung ba kho nas dngos gzhir 'gyur ram zhe na / de'i phyir 'khrug long bya ba la /
translated: Does the downfall occur for any meaning at all?

original: gzhol bas so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhol bas so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text states, “When one is intent on creating a disturbance.”

original: don gzhan gyi dbang nyid du son cing shes pa'i 'og tu rkang pa dang se gol dang lud pa'i sgra dag gis go bar mi byed na nges par ltung ba 'byin pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: don gzhan gyi dbang nyid du son cing shes pa'i 'og tu rkang pa dang se gol dang lud pa'i sgra dag gis go bar mi byed na nges par ltung ba 'byin pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If one does not make oneself understood by the sound of one's feet, fingersnap, or by coughing, after having understood the meaning of another, one is necessarily guilty of a transgression.

original: gal te nor ba dang zhi bar 'dod pa ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gal te nor ba dang zhi bar 'dod pa ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: But,he says,if one is mistaken, or if one wishes to be tranquil, it is not a transgression.

original: nye bar thos pa las don gzhan mngon du byas te nye bar 'brel par bya'o //
analyzed: nye bar thos pa las don gzhan mngon du byas te nye bar 'brel par bya'o //
translated: One should make oneself understood by another, but not by a sound that is different from the one that one has understood.

original: dus gang gi tshe na shes par 'gyur ba cung zad 'dir bsdad par bya ste /
analyzed: dus gang gi tshe na shes par 'gyur ba cung zad 'dir bsdad par bya ste /
translated: One should wait a little, thinking, At what time will he understand?

original: da ltar shes pa'i 'og tu rkang pa'i ting sgra la sogs pas bsdad par bya'o //
analyzed: da ltar shes pa'i 'og tu rkang pa'i ting sgra la sogs pas bsdad par bya'o //
translated: One should wait until he understands, after having made a sound with one's feet, fingersnap, etc.

original: @269a * // gal te ma yin na gang las nges par ltung bar byed pa la ltung bar 'gyur ba ni ltung ba ni ltung ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: @269a * // gal te ma yin na gang las nges par ltung bar byed pa la ltung bar 'gyur ba ni ltung ba ni ltung ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: If one does not do so, and if he understands, one is guilty of a transgression, because one has produced a transgression.

original: gal te nor par gyur tam zhi bar 'dod pas ni ma gtogs te /
analyzed: gal te nor par gyur tam zhi bar 'dod pas ni ma gtogs te /
translated: But,he says,if one is mistaken, or if one wishes to be tranquil, it is not a transgression.

original: nye bar mi gnas par gyur pa'i tshe gcig pa'i sbyin par mi 'gyur bzhi ba la don du gnyer ba'am zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: nye bar mi gnas par gyur pa'i tshe gcig pa'i sbyin par mi 'gyur bzhi ba la don du gnyer ba'am zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: The meaning of “one who is seeking” is the meaning of “one who is in need.”

original: /'thab gcugs mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni rten du gyur pa la cho ga snga ma rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir gzhan zhes bya ba'i rkyen to //
analyzed: /'thab gcugs mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni rten du gyur pa la cho ga snga ma rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir gzhan zhes bya ba'i rkyen to //
translated: “Do not quarrel” means that the condition “another” is established as the previous rite for one who is a basis.

original: mi stobs pa nyid kyis thob pa la tshig 'di'o //
analyzed: mi stobs pa nyid kyis thob pa la tshig 'di'o //
translated: This verse is for one who has attained by the power of a human being.

original: mnyan par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'thab mo'o //
analyzed: mnyan par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'thab mo'o //
translated: “Do not listen” means a dispute.

original: de byed pa la nye bar bskor te 'dug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de byed pa la nye bar bskor te 'dug par mi bya'o //
translated: Do not sit in a circle with one who does that.

original: nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir mi 'bad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa la'o //
analyzed: nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir mi 'bad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa la'o //
translated: Do not be lazy about striving for peace, which is to say, about a dispute.

original: nyan rna las gyur pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: nyan rna las gyur pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: This is the downfall of disharmony.

original: // / gang la mi smra bar 'gro ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / gang la mi smra bar 'gro ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the downfall of going away without speaking?

original: de'i phyir gsol ba la sogs pa'i las la 'dus pa dge slong la ma smras par 'gro na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsol ba la sogs pa'i las la 'dus pa dge slong la ma smras par 'gro na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “If, without speaking to the assembled monks, one goes away from the rite of invitation, etc.”

original: gsol pa la sogs pa'i las la zhes bya ba ni gsol ba 'ba' zhig dang gsol ba dang gnyis dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las la yang dgag dbye'i bdag nyid can gyi las la'o //
analyzed: gsol pa la sogs pa'i las la zhes bya ba ni gsol ba 'ba' zhig dang gsol ba dang gnyis dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las la yang dgag dbye'i bdag nyid can gyi las la'o //
translated: In the rite of asking permission, etc. means in the rite of asking permission alone, in the rite of asking permission and two other proclamations, and in the rite of asking permission and four proclamations.

original: rab tu byung ba la ltos pa zhu ba la sogs pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba la ltos pa zhu ba la sogs pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not refer to the rite of asking permission, etc. in the rite of going forth.

original: 'dus pa zhes bya ba ni zhugs pa la'o //🔽dge 'dun 'dus pa la ma dris par ro //
analyzed: 'dus pa zhes bya ba ni zhugs pa la'o // dge 'dun 'dus pa la ma dris par ro //
translated: In the assembly means in the rite of entering.🔽Without asking the Saṅgha means without asking the Saṅgha that is present.

original: dge slong la ma dris par 'gro na'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge slong la ma dris par 'gro na'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Without asking a monk means without asking a monk.

original: dge slong la ma smras par zhes bya ba ni lta ba yang dag par bsgrub pa'i don du ma yin no //
analyzed: dge slong la ma smras par zhes bya ba ni lta ba yang dag par bsgrub pa'i don du ma yin no //
translated: Without telling a monk means without telling a monk for the purpose of establishing a view.

original: 'on kyang tshogs pa bsgrub pa'i don du 'dun pa 'bul ba ltar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang tshogs pa bsgrub pa'i don du 'dun pa 'bul ba ltar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: However, it should be understood that it is like offering a request for the purpose of establishing a group.

original: thag ji srid du song na 'gro pa'i cha de kha na ma tho ba cir 'gyur zhe na /🔽de'i phyir thos pa'i nye 'khor las 'das na dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: thag ji srid du song na 'gro pa'i cha de kha na ma tho ba cir 'gyur zhe na / de'i phyir thos pa'i nye 'khor las 'das na dngos gzhi'o //
translated: What is the offense if one goes beyond a certain distance?

original: mdun rol du ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: mdun rol du ni nyes byas so //
translated: Therefore, if one goes beyond the vicinity of the place where one hears the sound of the recitation of the Prātimokṣa, it is a pārājika.🔽If one goes beyond the vicinity of the place where one sees the assembly, it is a sthūlātyaya.

original: don med pa dang mi rigs pas 'gro ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: don med pa dang mi rigs pas 'gro ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “Without reason and without propriety” means:

original: dgos pa med pa dang mi rigs pa'i tshul gyis dgos par 'gro na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa dang mi rigs pa'i tshul gyis dgos par 'gro na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one goes without a reason or in an improper manner, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gsol ba byas pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsol ba byas pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Only when one has requested” means:

original: 'dir gzhung ni las kyi gzhi zhu ba las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni las kyi gzhi zhu ba las /
translated: Here, the scripture is the Questions on the Bases of Training:

original: btsun pa re zhig las brjod par bgyid pa na /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig las brjod par bgyid pa na /
translated: “Lord, if, while reciting the actions,

original: dge slong stan las langs te mchi zhing dge slong mchis pa dag la yang mi smra bar mchi na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: dge slong stan las langs te mchi zhing dge slong mchis pa dag la yang mi smra bar mchi na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: a monk stands up from his seat and leaves without telling the other monks, what is his offense?”

original: nye ba 'khor nyes byas @269b so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor nyes byas @269b so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Upāli, it is an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: chos dang ldan pa nyid ma yin pa'i las la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni chos dang ldan pa nyid ma yin pa 'di rnams la dngos gzhi'i gnas su nyes byas so //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa nyid ma yin pa'i las la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni chos dang ldan pa nyid ma yin pa 'di rnams la dngos gzhi'i gnas su nyes byas so //
translated: “Also, in an action that is not in accordance with the Dharma” means: In these actions that are not in accordance with the Dharma, it is an offense of wrong conduct in the context of the main part.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las /
translated: Here, the scripture is the Questions of Some:

original: chos dang ldan pa nyid ma yin pa'i las byed pa na 'gro na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa nyid ma yin pa'i las byed pa na 'gro na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one performs a non-virtuous action, one commits an offense.🔽If one wishes to not transgress the range of hearing, there is no offense.

original: thos pa'i yul las mi 'da' bar 'dod pa ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba 'di ni sngar mdun rol du ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba smos pa de'i dmigs kyis bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: thos pa'i yul las mi 'da' bar 'dod pa ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba 'di ni sngar mdun rol du ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba smos pa de'i dmigs kyis bsal ba yin no //
translated: This is an exception to the previous statement that it is an offense if one does not speak.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
translated: Here is the text of the question and answer:

original: gsol ba brtsams pa nas bshang ba'i sa 'am gci ba'i sar 'gro ba 'am 'ong yang rung ste /
analyzed: gsol ba brtsams pa nas bshang ba'i sa 'am gci ba'i sar 'gro ba 'am 'ong yang rung ste /
translated: “If one begins to speak, whether going or coming to the place of defecating or urinating,

original: dge slong 'khod pa dag la mi smra yang thos pa'i nye 'khor yongs su mi gtong ba gang yin pa la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dge slong 'khod pa dag la mi smra yang thos pa'i nye 'khor yongs su mi gtong ba gang yin pa la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: if one does not speak to the assembled monks, but does not abandon the range of hearing, there is no offense.

original: 'dir snga ma la yang thos pa'i nye 'khor mi gtong ba la ltung ba med par rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir snga ma la yang thos pa'i nye 'khor mi gtong ba la ltung ba med par rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Here, it is established that there is no offense if one does not abandon the range of hearing.

original: gtong na ni nges par nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtong na ni nges par nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one abandons it, one definitely falls.

original: mi smra bar 'gro ba'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: mi smra bar 'gro ba'i ltung byed do /
translated: This is the downfall of not speaking when going.

original: // / gang la ma gus pa'i tshul gyis ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /🔽de'i phyir 'dug pa dang 'gro ba dang gnas mal dang gtsug lag khang len pa dang smra ba la sogs pa la bsgo ba'i don la ma gus pas chos dang ldan par shad kyis sbyang ba med par de las bzlog ste /🔽'gal bar byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni de las bzlog ste mi 'dug pa dang mi 'gro ba dang gnas mal mi len pa dang gtsug lag khang mi len pa dang mi smra ba'o //
analyzed: // / gang la ma gus pa'i tshul gyis ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na / de'i phyir 'dug pa dang 'gro ba dang gnas mal dang gtsug lag khang len pa dang smra ba la sogs pa la bsgo ba'i don la ma gus pas chos dang ldan par shad kyis sbyang ba med par de las bzlog ste / 'gal bar byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni de las bzlog ste mi 'dug pa dang mi 'gro ba dang gnas mal mi len pa dang gtsug lag khang mi len pa dang mi smra ba'o //
translated: What is the downfall through disrespect?🔽Therefore, the meaning of the verse is this: One who is disrespectful to the meaning of the injunctions regarding sitting, walking, bedding, seats, and the taking of temples and monasteries, and who does not practice in accordance with the Dharma, but acts in opposition to the injunctions,🔽and who does not sit, walk, take bedding and seats, or take temples and monasteries, and who does not speak,

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni lhag ma 'di las chos dang ldan pa'i don la nye bar bsdus pa'i don to //🔽mi 'gyur ba'i yid kyis kyang mi mthun par gyur pa yin te shad kyis kyang ngo //🔽'di lta ste dper na gus pa rab tu byed cing mi mthun pa ste /🔽kha na ma tho ba la 'jigs par mthong ba ni ma yin no //

original: chos dang mi ldan pa'i gsol ba 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad de /
analyzed: chos dang mi ldan pa'i gsol ba 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad de /
translated: And not only is it a request that is not in accordance with the Dharma,

original: chos dang ldan pa'i gsol ba btab pas kyang 'di ni gus pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i gsol ba btab pas kyang 'di ni gus pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: but also, when the request is in accordance with the Dharma, it is not a lack of respect.

original: de bas na mi gus par shes par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na mi gus par shes par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should not be understood as a lack of respect.

original: de bas na gus pa med pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag go //
analyzed: de bas na gus pa med pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag go //
translated: Thus, the lack of respect is a distinction.

original: gus pa yod pa las yang dus gcig gi tshe chos dang ldan pa'i gsol ba btab pa yod pa ma yin te /🔽'dir chos kyi gsol ba btab pa med par yang ster ba yin no //
analyzed: gus pa yod pa las yang dus gcig gi tshe chos dang ldan pa'i gsol ba btab pa yod pa ma yin te / 'dir chos kyi gsol ba btab pa med par yang ster ba yin no //
translated: And when there is respect, there is no request in accordance with the Dharma at one time,

original: dgongs @270a * //
analyzed: dgongs @270a * //
translated: but here, it is given even without a request in accordance with the Dharma.

original: pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intention is this:

original: gang gi phyir gnyis ka la 'khrul pa yod pa la kha na ma tho ba yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnyis ka la 'khrul pa yod pa la kha na ma tho ba yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
translated: Because there is error on both sides, there is a complete offense,

original: cig shos med pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: cig shos med pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: but not when the other is absent.

original: de bas na gnyis ka'i tshig bzung ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na gnyis ka'i tshig bzung ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the words of both are accepted.

original: gang du gsol ba ma btab pa la ma gus ba yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang du gsol ba ma btab pa la ma gus ba yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Where there is no request, there is no lack of respect.

original: gus pa ma yin pa la ni gsol ba mi sbyin par der ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba 'dis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gus pa ma yin pa la ni gsol ba mi sbyin par der ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba 'dis rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that if it is not done respectfully, then it is not a request, and it is a minor offense.

original: gang gis nye bar 'ongs pa'i don la 'gal bar byed pa la ltung ba ci lta bur 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis nye bar 'ongs pa'i don la 'gal bar byed pa la ltung ba ci lta bur 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What kind of downfall is it if one acts in contradiction to the purpose of the request?

original: de'i phyir dge slong gis dge 'dun la ni dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong gis dge 'dun la ni dngos gzhi'o //
translated: Therefore, it says, “For a monk, it is a downfall to act in contradiction to the purpose of the request of the saṅgha.

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon dag gi la ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon dag gi la ni nyes byas so //
translated: For a preceptor or a master, it is a minor infraction.

original: chos dang ldan pa nyid ma yin pa'i bsgo ba las kyang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa nyid ma yin pa'i bsgo ba las kyang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is also if it is not in accordance with the Dharma.”

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis bsgo ba'i don chos dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i bsgo ba las 'gal bar byed pa la yang nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis bsgo ba'i don chos dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i bsgo ba las 'gal bar byed pa la yang nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if one acts in contradiction to the purpose of the request of the saṅgha of monks, and if the request is not in accordance with the Dharma, then it is a minor offense.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
translated: Here is the text from the Questions of Subāhu:
